loans.name: Jose Ubirne

texts.es:
Jose Ubirne tiene 31 años, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, aprendió el oficio de su padre. Jose Ubirne cultiva maíz y frijol en varias parcelas cerca de su casa.

Para comprar el abono y los pesticidas para sus cultivos, Jose tiene que viajar a dos ciudades. Jose vive en una comunidad muy rural, a la cual toma una hora en llegar a pie desde la carretera donde para el bus. Cuando Jose Ubirne trae sus insumos de regreso, los acarrea con un bar de bueyes cruzando un río y varias colinas.

Jose Ubirne ha solicitado un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de cinco bolsas de abono y pesticida para sus cultivos. Con la ayuda del préstamo el podrá comprar todo lo que necesita en un solo viaje, y recibir precios de mayorista. De esta forma el podrá ahorrar tiempo y dinero, y sacar su cosecha a tiempo para la venta.

En un futuro Jse Ubirne desea poder trabajar mas tranquilamente, teniendo los recursos necesarios para seguir cultivando y así proveer lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Ubirne is 31 years old, married with 3 children. He has worked as a farmer from an early age and learned the trade from his father. Jose Ubirne grows corn and beans on several plots of land near his house.

To buy manure and pesticides for his crops, Jose has to travel to two cities. Jose lives in a very rural area, an hour away on foot from the road where the bus stops. When Jose brings back his supplies, he transports them across a river and several hills using a pair of oxen.  

Jose Ubirne has asked Fundación Campo for a loan to buy 5 bags of manure and pesticide for his crops. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy all he needs with one trip and obtain wholesale prices. In this way he will be able to save time and money and harvest the crop in time for the sale.

In the future, Jose Ubirne wants to be able to work more calmly, having the necessary resources to continue cultivating the land and so provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticide for his corn crops.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province in Kenya. He is married and has five children, who are all in school – classes 6, 5, 3, 2, and kindergarten level two respectively. He has been operating a vegetable kiosk for five years, a venture he began to supplement his income.

He has been a client of Milango for one year and three months. A loan of 100,000 KES will help Henry to purchase a motorbike. He is a driver, too, and has links with Italian visitors to the Malindi area. Indeed, he is purchasing the motorbike in order to rent it out to tourists visiting the area. He also has three rental houses.

Henry intends to build more rental houses in the future and to buy a public transport vehicle. The main challenge he faces is a lack of capital. This loan will add to his asset base and provide him with security/collateral for future loans. It will also help to increase his family’s income. He appreciates the partnership with Milango.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to her beauty salon

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина проживет вместе со своей семьей в городе Мелитополе. У нее есть собственный бизнес. Валентина имеет точку на привокзальном рынке. Продает продукты питание и разные сладости. На этот товар всегда есть спрос, поэтому Валентина выбрала это направление.  Она занимается этим делом 11 лет. 

На рост бизнеса повлияли предприимчивость и умение правильно вести бизнес. Валентина всегда вежлива и доброжелательна с клиентами. Ее бизнес  цель - расширить «границы» бизнеса и при возможности открыть новую точку. 

Валентина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 15,000 гривен на увеличение ассортимента кондитерских изделий. Увеличивши доход  Валентина сможет улучшить бытовые условия своей семьи.
texts.en: Valentina lives together with her family in the town of Melitopol.  She has her own business.  Valentina has a retail outlet at the train station market.  She sells food products and various sweets.  There is always demand for these products, and this is why Valentina chose to focus on this business.  She has been involved in this business for 11 years.  Her entrepreneurship and the ability to run the business right affected the business growth.  Valentina is always polite and kind to her customers.  Her business goal is to expand business "borders" and possibly open another retail outlet.  Valentina is requesting a loan in the sum of 15,000 hryvnia to expand the assortment of candy goods.  Having increased her income, Valentina would be able to improve her family's household conditions.

loans.use: to expand the assortment of candy goods

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province. He is single and has been operating a cleaning and garbage collection business for six years. He employs 36 people who help in the routine cleaning at contracted places.
 
Benard has been a client of Milango for four months. A loan of 30,000 KES will help Benard to purchase a scrubbing machine, which will help increase the speed of service delivery and improve his efficiency at work. He also does clearing and forwarding, as well as property management. Benard plans to open a chemical cleaning business, and he cites a lack of funds and competition as the challenges to overcome. He appreciates the partnership with Milango and feels this is the best option for his financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase a scrubbing machine.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married and has a grown son. She and her family live in Pavlograd. Olga lost her previous job due to downsizing so she decided to start her own business. Today Olga owns a small business selling men’s shirts and sweaters in the central city market. Her prices are relatively low. Olga has been working in the market for about 15 years. Olga is a very honest, client-friendly, and hard-working entrepreneur. She has many loyal customers. Currently, her turnover capital is about 36,000 UAH and her monthly income is 3500-4000 UAH. 

Olga is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to increase her winter clothing assortment. She is hoping to continue expanding her trade and would like to open one more vending facility in the market.

loans.use: to increase winter clothing assortment

loans.name: Marcos Herminia

texts.es:
Marcos es una mujer muy trabajadora de 46 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres.

Desde un año ella se dedica a vender panes con pollo y gaseosas, entre otras más, pero esta es la preferida por ella. Este es un negocio que lo aprendió de su mamá, ya que ella se dedicaba a esto y tenia muchos clientes que es algo que le ha favorecido a Marcos.

Ella es la que cuida a sus padres y de las ganancias que obtiene les da lo necesario. Los materiales que utiliza los compra, en unas tiendas situadas a pocas cuadras de su casa, por lo que no tiene que pagar autobús, esas compras las realiza al crédito y paga cuando termina la venta de sus productos. Por lo que Marcos solicita un préstamo para comprar los materiales que necesita de una sola vez y al contado, para comprarlos a mejor precio, de esta forma podrá ayudar más a sus padres. Además desea comprar unas mesas y sillas para que los clientes puedan consumir ahí lo que ella vende.

Ella desea tener un chalet situado en el parque de su comunidad e ir ahorrando de las ganancias, por que la venta la situada a fuera de su casa y cuando llueve no puede salir con su venta, por que se moja, solo coloca una manta granda como techo, pero no es suficiente siempre se moja.
texts.en:
Marcos is a very hard-working woman of 46.  She is single and lives with her parents.

For one year, Marcos has been selling 'panes con pollo' (cooked chicken sandwiches) and soda.  She also sells other products but this is her favorite.  This is a business that she learned from her mom as she used to work in this business and had many customers.  This has been very useful to Marcos.

Marcos looks after her parents and uses the profits she makes to provide them with what they need.  She buys the supplies that she uses in some shops which are located a few blocks from her home so that she doesn't have to pay bus fare.  She makes her purchases on credit and pays when she finishes selling her products.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy the supplies that she needs in one go and pay cash for them.  This will enable her to buy them at a better price and so will be able to help her parents more.  In addition, she would also like to buy some tables and chairs so that her customers can eat what she sells on site.

Marcos would like to have a hut in the park in her community and would also like to save her profits.  She currently makes her sales outside her house and when it rains she can't go out and sell her products because they get wet.  She hangs a large blanket up as a roof but it isn't enough and things always get wet.

loans.use: to buy materials for making 'panes con pollo' (paying cash), and to buy some tables and chairs for her business

loans.name: Juan Andres

texts.es:
Juan es un joven,de 23 años, soltero y vive junto con sus padres, gracias al apoyo economico y moral de sus padres se ha recibido en la carrera de derecho, siendo su mama quien lo impulso para encontrar trabajo mas rapido, ya que ella labora en la profesion, y por medio de amistad se le hizo posible.

Juan, al ver la necesidad en su casa,desea mejorar el techo, ya que por ser el zinc, muy viejo, se le pasan gotas de agua, en temporada de invierno, situacion que desea cambiar, para el bienestar comun de la familia. Ya que ahora puede apoyar a sus padres con este cambio y que se le ha hecho mas rapido mediante el financiamiento en Afodenic, siendo recomendado por un amigo, para que este mejor situacion. Su casa es de concreto, y gracias a Dios, se han cubrido las necesidades, pero hoy se siente motivado hacer algo propio y de beneficios para muchos.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man, 23 years old, single and lives with his parents. Thanks to financial and moral support from his parents, he has been able to complete law school. His mother is the one who encouraged him to find work quickly, since she is also a lawyer, and through a friend he was able to do so.

Juan, recognizing the need to improve his house, wants to put in a better roof, since water leaks through the zinc beams in the winter. He wants to change the situation for the well being of his family. Now that he is able to support his parents, he wants to make the improvements quickly with the help of a loan from AFODENIC [Kiva Field Partner], which was recommended to him by a friend. 

His house is made of concrete and, thanks to god, he has been able to supply his family with necessities so far, but he now feels motivated to do to something more and benefit many other people.

loans.use: to replace the entire roof of his house.

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dinora tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Dinora se dedica a la venta de ropa, oficio que aprendió de su abuela.

Para vender la ropa Dinora se traslada a varias comunidades en bus, y así vende de comunidad en comunidad. En particular, Dinora sale a vender los días en que el gobierno paga la asistencia social a las personas de escasos recursos. Dinora vende bastante en esos días puesto que los receptores de dicha ayuda compran ropa y otras necesidades basicas cuando reciben el dinero.

Dinora ha pedido un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa para la reventa. Con la ayuda del préstamo Dinora ahorrará tiempo y dinero, puesto que podrá comprar mayor cantidad de una sola vez. Así ella no tendrá que hacer varios viajes para surtir su inventario.

En un futuro Dinora desea tener un bazar en un lugar estable, donde ella pueda estar a cargo del negocio y no descuidar la familia que planea tener en un futuro.
texts.en:
Dinora is 31 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  Her business is selling clothes - a trade she learned from her grandmother.

To sell her clothes, Dinora travels to several different communities by bus and there she makes her sales from community to community.  In particular, she goes out to sell her products on the days that the government makes social security payments to people of limited means.  Dinora sells quite a lot on these days as the people who receive this aid buy clothes and other basic necessities when they receive their money.

Dinora has requested a loan from Fundación Campo to buy a larger quantity of clothes to re-sell.  With the help of the loan, Dinora will save both time and money as she will be able to buy a larger quantity of products in one go.  This means she won't have to make several trips in order to stock up with merchandise.

In the future, Dinora would like to have a store in a stable location where she can run her business and not neglect the family that she plans to have in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяне нужны дополнительные средства, чтобы расширить ассортимент осенних и зимних шарфов.
Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Татьяна, увеличив ассортимент, смогла получить дополнительную прибыль.
Она провела газ и воду в свой дом, помогла детям с учебой в колледже. Благодаря своему бизнесу Татьяна оказывает финансовую помощь своей племянице.
texts.en: Tatyana needs additional funds to expand the assortment of autumn and winter scarves.  Thanks to the previous loan, Tatyana was able to expand her goods assortment and make an additional profit.  She was able to bring gas and water to her house and helped her children with their college education.  Thanks to her business, Tatyana provides financial assistance to her niece.

loans.use: to expand the assortment of autumn and winter scarves

loans.name: Sugey Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Sugey sigue laborando en zona franca, como foliadora, trabajo que hace desde hace varios años, la encargada de pegar las etiquetas, enumerar piezas, el cual se esfuerza por hacer mas de un mil piezas, ya que se gana por paquetes. Tambien su esposo labora como mecanico industrial, ahí mismo en zona franca, sus hijos siguen estudiando ya por terminar el año escolar.
Contenta por que ha logrado las mejora a su casa, con los prestamos que la institucion ha dado en tres ciclos de los cuales, ya pudo hacer mas grande los cuarto de los niños para una mejor privacidad y comidad de todos.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo podra continuar un muro que tiene comenzado en la parte de atrás, el cual seguira levantando paredes de concreto, hasta terminarlo, y asi asegurar mas su propiedad, y a sus hijos que pasan solos despues que vienen del colegio, el cual dara mas tranquilidad como madre, y mayor sastifaccion el poder lograr la obra atraves de estos financiamiento que vienen ha dar oportunidad para una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Sugey is still working in the tax-free zone as a document processor, a job she has done for several years. She is responsible for putting on stamps and numbering the pieces, and she makes an effort to finish more than a thousand pieces because she is paid per packet. Her husband also works as an industrial mechanic, also in the tax-free zone. Their children study and are about to finish the school year.

Sugey is happy because she has been able to make improvements to her house. With the loans the institution has given her for three loan cycles, she was able to make the children's bedroom larger for better privacy and comfort for everyone.

Now, with this new loan she can continue building a wall that she has started behind the house. She will continue building the concrete wall until she finishes this one to make her property safer, as well as her children who are alone after they come home from school. This will make her calmer as a mother, and she will have greater satisfaction from being able to complete the work with these loans that have given her the chance to have decent housing.

loans.use: to continue construction of a wall which she has already begun, until she finishes it to make her property and her family safer.

loans.name: Inna

texts.ru:
Инна обратилась за кредитом, так как она пользовалась заемными средствами раньше и считает, что это очень удобно и выгодно для бизнеса. В этот раз Инна берет кредит на обустройство второй теплицы - покупку пленки и установку  отопления.

В прошлом году благодаря кредиту построили теплицу. В этом году построили еще одну теплицу для рассады. Прибыль увеличили до 60 тыс грн за сезон, после установки отопления планируют зарабатывать еще больше.

В этом году муж Инны поехал в Харьков работать на стройку. Семья планировала выкупить соседний дом, но не получилось, так как хозяева подняли цену и Инна с мужем пока отказались.
texts.en: Inna requested a loan because she had previously used loaned funds and thinks that this is very convenient and profitable for the business.  This time, Inna is requesting a loan to make improvements to her second greenhouse, specifically for the purchase of plastic and installation of heating.  Last year, thanks to the previous loan, Inna and her husband built a greenhouse.  This year, they built another greenhouse for seedlings.  They increased their profits to 60 thousand hryvnia in one season and plan to earn even more after installing heating.  This year, Inna's husband left to do construction work in Kharkov.  The family planned to buy a neighboring house, but was unable to because the owners increased the price, and Inna and her husband decided against the purchase for now.

loans.use: to purchase plastic and install heating in the greenhouse

loans.name: Igualdad Para Todas Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras denominado Igualdad para Todas es del Chaco. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, con 10 integrantes. En su mayoría las clientes se dedican a la  venta D. todo tipo D. productos y también están las demás miembros del grupo que con mucho esfuerzo responsabilidad ven el fruto D. muchos años D. sacrificio.
una D. las miembros es la señora Carmen, que se dedica a la venta D. productos D. limpieza, ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que gracias al sacrificio y a su trabajo ha logrado salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. los elementos D. limpieza que venD., para que D. esa forma pueda tener mas abastecido su negocio y pueda cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Entrepreneurial Women Committee called 'Igualdad para Todas' (Equality for All), is from Chaco.  They are currently in their first loan cycle with ten members.  Most of these clients work selling different types of products.  The other members of the group, through a lot of hard work and responsibility, are also seeing the rewards of many years of sacrifice.

One of the members of this group is Carmen who sells cleaning products.  She considers herself to be a very hard-working and tenacious woman who, thanks to her sacrifice and hard work, has managed to get ahead and help her family.  

Carmen is requesting this loan to buy cleaning products to sell so that her business is better stocked and she is able to fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to re-sell

loans.name: Tory Group

texts.es:
11 mujeres del Chaco se unieron para que por medio de su trabajo en conjunto puedan ayudar a sus familias. Ellas son mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras y muy emprendedoras. Se encuentran actualmente en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, y desean poder llegar al nivel máximo del mismo.
Una de las miembros es la señora Nelida, la cual se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas, trabajo que le trae muy buenos ingresos, mediante los cuales puede darle a su familia las condiciones básicas de vida digna y decorosa. desea poder seguir con su negocio, por lo que solicita la ayuda de la fundación y kiva.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo para esta nueva estación que se acerca, con lo cual podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: These eleven women from the Chaco came together in order to work together to help their families. They are determined, hardworking, enterprising women. They are currently in the first loan cycle in the Fundación Paraguaya's program for women entrepreneurs, and they'd like to make the most of it. One of the members is Nelida, who sells all kinds of clothing. Her work earns her a good income that allows her to offer her family the basic conditions for a decent, dignified life. She would like to keep going with her business, and is asking for support from the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva. She is requesting this loan to buy all kinds of clothing for the approaching season, which will help her fill her customers' requests.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas” se formó con la unión D. varias vecinas D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades como son las ventas, preparación D. comidas rápidas, despensa etc. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz D. realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Señora Nancy es una D. las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la costura, elaboración D. porta joyas, sabanas, crochet en fin realiza varias actividades. Es una señora muy creativa y sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos. Ella  tiene 4 hijos y su marido es Guardia D. Seguridad.
La señora Nancy solicita el crédito para la compra D. mas materiales que necesita para su costura, como ser hilos, agujas, telas y demás.
texts.en:
Women living in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso came together to form the Mujeres Unidas village bank. The members work in sales, preparing quick meals, grocery stores, etc. They have formed a very supportive group and are able to carry out activities that fortify their team spirit.
Nancy is one of the members of the group. She is a seamstress and makes jewelry cases and sheets. She also crochets. She is very creative and her customers love her work. She has four children and her husband is a security guard.
Nancy is requesting this loan to buy more supplies for her sewing, such as thread, needles, cloth, and so on.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, and thread.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
Mujeres en Acción se denomina el excelente grupo D. mujeres conformado en la ciudad D. Itá, gracias a  la Sra. Esmeralda,  contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona para enterarse D. la forma D. trabajo que tiene el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras. Una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el  sexto ciclo ,en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La señora Esmeralda tiene una despensa, mediante la cual genera los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, los cuales siempre compran D. ella, gracias a eso a ido creciendo cada día mas y mas. Desea poder seguir con su negocio por lo que animo a solicitar el crédito.
Desea el préstamo para el abastecimiento D. su despensa con comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás para tener mayor variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mujeres en Acción is the name of an excellent group of women in the city of Itá. Esmeralda founded the group when she contacted the advisor for another weekly meeting in the area to find out about the work that the Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras [Committee of Women Entrepreneurs] does. Once she'd learned about the program, she got together 17 women who are now happily in their sixth loan cycle with the program.
Esmeralda has a small grocery store whose profits are enough to enable her to support her family. She says that she has many customers who always buy from her, so her business is growing day by day. She would like to keep going with her business, which is why she's requesting the loan. She intends to use the loan to stock her shop with foods, beverges, dairy products, and other goods in order to have a wiD. variety for her customers.

loans.use: to buy foods, beverages, and dairy products.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Este Comité denominado 8 D. Diciembre, se formo gracias a la señora Rosalia. Cabe destacar que dicho grupo esta pasando al segundo ciclo con una excelente calificación y 0 dias D. mora, la presidenta se motivo en la idea D. producir un bien para sus compañeras, dando la una visión D. que através del comité estan alcanzando un  nuevo progreso a cada una. Encantadas aceptaron continuar dentro del comité y D. la gran Familia D. Fundación Paraguaya.
La señora Rosalia se dedica a las ventas, comenta que esto lo realiza hace ya un buen tiempo, por lo que le va muy bien y ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Uno D. sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo dia a dia y poder ser una gran comerciante que sobresalga.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. panificados., azúcar, harina, aceite, y otros productos básicos y mas buscados dentro D. una despensa.
texts.en:
The 8 D. Diciembre village bank was founded by Rosalia. The group is in its second loan cycle and has received excellent ratings for its prompt payments. The president of the group was driven by the idea of helping her colleagues, and she sees that through the group they are all making great progress. The other members are delighted to remain in the group and be part of the Fundación Paraguaya's greater family.
Rosalia has been selling food products for a long time, so her business is strong and she has a solid customer base. One of her dreams is to keep growing and become a very successful businesswoman.
She is requesting the loan to buy breads, sugar, flour, oil, and other basic goods that are in high demand in a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy breads, sugar, flour, oil, and other basic goods.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
La Sra. Esperanza tiene 58 años, y tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos ya están casados y formaron su propia familia y un hija de 25 años que le ayuda a atender el negocio y que esta realizando sus estudios para obtener el titulo de Despachante de Aduanas.
La sra. Esperanza tiene su despensa desde el año 2000 donde tambien vende comestibles y helados.La misma desea invertir en su negocio para que pueda seguir creciendo en el ámbito comercial.
Ella Solicitada el préstamo para la compra de azúcar,arroz, fideos, yerba y otros productos mas en forma mayorista, de esa manera obtendría un menor precio de compra y aumentaría sus ganancias por las ventas realizadas. También podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 58 years old and has 4 children. Three of them are married and have started their own families, and her 25-year-old daughter helps her run the business and is studying to be a customs officer.
Esperanza has had a grocery store since 2000. She wants to invest in her business so it will keep growing commercially.
She is requesting this loan to buy sugar, rice, pasta, yerba mate, and other products in bulk. That way, she will get a better price and be able to increase her profits. She will also be able to offer her clients a wider variety of products.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, pasta, yerba mate, and other products.

loans.name: Waldir Osmar

texts.es:
El Sr. Waldir, está casado tiene 2 hijos, todos aun en edad escolar. El se dedica a la venta de Zapatos Usados, en su domicilio, cuya venta le genera un buen ingreso. Con la ayuda de su esposa están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación. Hoy día el es una microempresario exitoso con mucha clientela, debido a su buen trato y al buen servicio que presta.
El comenta que su trabajo diario es por darle a su esposa e hijos lo mejor, para que ellos no tengan que sufrir de las privaciones por las que el tuvo que pasar en su vida. Desea que ellos sean grandes profesionales útiles a la sociedad.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatos de segunda mano, para la posterior venta.
texts.en:
Waldir is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. He sells used shoes out of his home, which earns him a good income. With his wife's help and a lot of determination and sacrifice, they are giving their family a better life. Today he is a successful businessman with a good customer base, thanks to the excellent service he offers.
He says that he works hard to give his wife and children the best so they don't have to suffer the deprivation that he's experienced in his life. He wants his children to have good careers and be of service to society.
He is requesting this loan to buy secondhand shoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy secondhand shoes for resale.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El Sr Silvio es de ciudad del Este, él se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, en el barrio Remansito de Ciudad del Este y  por las colonias. Comenta que tiene clientela formada que siempre acuden a el para comprar sus artículos, además de eso dice que tiene ingresos permanentes.
Con el apoyo de su familia, trabajo en equipo y cooperación entre todos, se puede ver el crecimiento y progreso en el cual se está desenvolviendo. Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, como ser remeras, shorts, bermudas y demás para la posterior venta, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Silvio is from the city of Este.  He works selling all different kinds of clothes in the Remansito neighborhood of Este city, and in the surrounding settlements.  He comments that he has a steady customer base who always come to him to buy their clothes.  Furthermore, he says that he earns steady income.

With the support of his family, he works as part of a team in cooperation with everyone.  He can see the growth and progress which is is creating.  He has demonstrated himself to be a responsible person who is honest in meeting his commitments.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of clothing, such as T--shirts, shorts, bermudas, and other items that he will resell.  With this, he will be able to stock up and meet his customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
La Sra. Ignacia tiene 52 años D. edad, está casada, tiene 3 hijos varones, todos estudiantes. La sra. Ignacia es D. profesión docente y al retirarse por la jubilación abrió una pequeña casilla en su domicilio para iniciar una actividad productiva, luego gracias al apoyo D. su cónyuge construyó un salón comercial y dio apertura a una despensa. Este negocio tiene 7 años D. antigüedad, posee una buena clientela gracias a su amable atención y la variedad D. sus productos ofrecidos a sus clientes. Desea poder seguir creciendo, y por lo mismo solicita el crédito.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D. azúcar, yerba, arroz, fideos, panificados, bebidas en general y otros, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y siempre tener variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Ignacia is 52 years old.  She is married with three sons who are all students.  

Señora Ignacia is a teacher by profession, and upon her retirement she opened a small stall in her home to start a productive activity.  Then, thanks to the support of her husband, she constructed a commercial space and opened up a store.  This business is seven years old, and she has a good clientele thanks to her friendly service and the variety of products she offers her customers.  She wants to be able to continue to grow, and for this reason is requesting the loan.

She is requesting the loan for purchasing sugar, yerba, rice, noodles, bakery items, drinks in general, and other items with which she can stock up her store and always have a variety of things to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, yerba, rice, noodles, bakery items and drinks in general.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
El señor Isidro tiene 45 años de edad, vive en compañía de la señora Norma de 31 años de edad, hace 17 años que viven juntos, tienen 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad, los cuales ya son independientes y viven en la Argentina y una hija menor la cual vive con ellos.
El señor Isidro es transportista, posee un ómnibus en el cual realiza transporte de pasajeros en la zona de Itá-Oculto-Valle Yo´a. Comenta que tiene muchos pasajeros y eso le trae muy buenos ingresos.desea poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá para la compra de cubiertas para su camión, ya que anualmente lo realiza de manera imprescindible, tratando de brindar comodidad y seguridad a sus pasajeros. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Isidro is 45 years old and he lives together with Norma who is 31 years old. They have been living together for 17 years and they have 3 children. Two of them are grown and are already independent and living in Argentina. They have one daughter who is a minor and still living with them. 

Isidro is a bus driver and he has a minibus which he uses to transport passengers in the region of Ita-Oculto-Valle Yo'a. He comments that he has many passengers and this brings him a very good income. He wants to keep growing in order to help his family. 

He requests the loan to invest in the purchase of seat covers for his bus. Annually he makes this essential purchase with the goal or providing comfort and safety to his passengers. He is thankful to Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) for the opportunity provided to him.

loans.use: to purchase seat covers for his bus.

loans.name: Justino

texts.es:
El Sr Justino tiene 32 años es Mecanico de motos, hace mas de 7 años. Tiene su taller a media cuadra de su casa, está acompañado con la Sra Maria hace más de 9 años, tienen 3 hijos, el mayor tiene 13 años se llama Julio y ya le está ayudando a su papa en el taller.
Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela porque ya que su trabajo hace con garantía y también porque ya se le conoce en la ciudad, su sueño es comprar un terreno y montar su propio taller ya que donde esta es alquilado.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para las motos, lo cual le ayudará mucho en su negocio. Afirma que esta muy agradecido con la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Justino is 32 years old and he has been a motorcycle mechanic for 7 years. He has a shop half a block away from his house. He has been together with Maria for more than 9 years and they have 3 children. The eldest is 13 and his name is Julio. He helps his father in the shop.

He comments that he has a very good clientele because he offers a guarantee on his work and also because he is known in the city. His dream is to purchase a plot of land and to set up his own shop, especially because he rents where he is now.

He requests a loan to purchase spare parts for motorcycles. This will greatly help him in his business. He affirms that he is very thankful to Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) for the opportunity that has been given to him.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Cesar, es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, se dedica a la producción y venta de panes, desde chico empezó a trabajar con sus padres y después poco a poco se fue independizando y formo su propia panadería.
El señor está casado con la señora Zulma, tienen un hijo de 12 años que se llama Marcos. Comenta que tiene buena venta, ya que los productos que vende son de muy buen calidad. Por eso dice que tiene siempre buenos ingresos. Desea poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Él solicito el préstamo para aumentar más su stock de harina. El señor y la familia agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, porque gracias a esto va aumentar su stock y satisfacer así a sus clientes porque tiene mucha demanda de sus productos
texts.en:
Señor Cesar is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. He makes his living by making and selling bread. As a child, he started working with his parents. Later, little by little he became independent and started his own bakery.

Cesar is married to Señora Zulma and they have a 12 year-old son named Marcos. He remarks that he has good sales because the products he sells are of very high quality. For this reason, he says he always has good income. He wants to be able to continue growing and thus be able to continue helping his family.

He requested the loan in order to further increase his stock of flour. Cesar and his family thank the foundation for the opportunity that they have given him, because thanks to this loan, he is going to increase his stock, and he will be able to satisfy his customers since there is a great demand for his products.

loans.use: to purchase flour for the bakery.

loans.name: Caren Lucia

texts.es:
Caren es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 22 años y  está cursando el tercer año de la carrera de Derecho en la Universidad del Norte de la misma ciudad. Ella tiene 3 hermanas, 2 mayores y una menor que ella, las dos mayores ya terminaron su carrera universitaria y la menor esta comenzando. Su madre es ama de casa y su padre es comerciante.
Caren actualmente trabaja como auxiliar, donde se encuentra adquiriendo experiencia ya que esta trabajando en la Corte Suprema de Justicia de la Ciudad, al mismo tiempo obtiene un ingreso para costear sus estudios.    Ella tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera y abrir su propio Estudio Jurídico, para contar con un buen ingreso y ayudar a su familia, especialmente a su madre quien es una mujer muy sacrificada.
Ella solicito este préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad, así también agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, ya que es de suma ayuda para ella.
texts.en:
Caren is from the city of Villarrica. She is 22 years old and in her third year of law school at Universidad del Norte [University of the North], also in Villarrica. She has three sisters, two older and one younger; her older sisters have already finished their university degrees, and the younger is just starting. Her mother is a housewife and her father a shopkeeper. 

Caren currently works as an assistant for the City Supreme Court of Justice, where she is gaining experience and at the same time earning an income to finance her studies. She really wants to finish her studies and open her own legal practice so that she can count on a good income. She wants to be able to help her family, especially her mother, who is a very selfless woman. 

She is asking for this loan in order to make monthly payments for school. She is appreciative to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity given to her, as it's a great help to her.

loans.use: to make monthly payments to the university.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is a 35-year-old married woman with a son. They live in Ho Chi Minh. Her husband works as a bricklayer.

Since 2004, Trang has been operating a general store, selling basic household necessities and many kinds of instant food to people in her local community. She would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of goods in bulk to stock her store. She would also like to use part of her loan to purchase materials to sew clothing from her house. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business.

Trang hopes that, through her loan, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and set aside savings for her children's education.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of goods in bulk to stock her general store and materials to sew clothes from her house.

loans.name: Doi

texts.en:
Doi is a 57-year-old married man with two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City.  Since 2009, Doi has supported his family by running a general store in front of his house. He sells a large range of products from household items to personal use products. 

He would like a loan to buy new products, such as many kinds of cakes, green tea, milk and beverages to sell in his store, to better meet his customers' needs. He hopes that through the loan he will be able to increase his income and set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy new products, such as cakes, green tea, milk and beverages to sell in his store.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 53-year old married mother of three children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a hairdresser. 
Hoa runs a small general store, selling food products and household necessities in their community. She has been in this business for over 15 years. 

Hoa would like a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic foods to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income. This will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her family.

loans.use: To buy basic foods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a 49-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has three children. Her husband earns an income working as a security guard. Nga runs a general  store, which she has done for over ten years. 

Nga would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, and shampoos to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and increase the turnover of her business. 

She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings for repairing her house.

loans.use: To buy basic goods, such as foods and beverages, in bulk for her general store.

loans.name: Mop

texts.en:
Mop is a married mother of two children. She earns a living running a general store. She started this business in 2009. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Mop would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as eggs, sugar, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, and toiletries, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income, which will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods for her general store.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is 49 years old, and is a married woman with three children. Her husband works in a flower nursery. Hue has been running a general store and selling mobile phone cards for over four years. She started this business to cover her family's every day expenses. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hue is requesting a loan to purchase a stock of mobile phone SIM cards and a greater variety of general goods (such as foods and beverages) to sell from her store. Hue hopes that by offering a greater variety of products that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand this business, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of mobile phone SIM cards and general goods to sell from her store.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 42 years old. She lives in a house with her husband and three children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a security guard. 

Thuy supports her family by selling sugar-cane juice, coffee and soft drinks from a stall in her local community. She started her stall in 2006. She intends to take a loan to repair her sugar-cane squeezing machine and to buy a greater range of food to sell from her stall. 

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money and save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: To repair sugar-cane squeezing machine and buy food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang is a 55-year-old married woman with two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a security guard and helps her to run a general store and sell bread to people in their community. Sang has run this business for the past seven years.
  
Sang would like a loan to buy new products, such as many kinds of cakes, green tea, milk and beverages to sell in her store to better meet her customers' needs. She hopes that she will be able to increase her income and set aside some savings through the loan.

loans.use: To buy new products such as many kinds of cakes, green tea, and milk to sell in her store.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao, age 37, is married and earns a living to support her family by sewing clothes. Her husband is involved in the business of repairing old sewing machines. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Thao has been sewing clothes for eight years. Thao would now like to take out a loan to expand her business. With the loan, she intends to buy some sewing machines that will enable her to make better quality clothes for her customers. She hopes that this will generate more income and that she can save money for her children to go to school.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines to make better quality clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be is 57 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and six daughters in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a security guard. 

Be supports her family by making doors and windows. She started her business over 3 years ago. She intends to take a loan to invest in her business by buying more materials to increase her production of doors and windows. 

Be hopes that through the loan she can earn more money and can save enough money for her family's emergencies.

loans.use: To buy more materials to increase her production of doors and windows.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is married and 39 years of age. She is a professional seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skilful and receives regular orders every month.  Her husband operates a grocery store and sells different household items like spices, cooking oil, soaps etc. He is very fair in his rates and has a good number of clients who purchases groceries from him regularly. He has another business raising and selling animals to butchers.  Kosar is the mother of 2 children, both of whom are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband, who will invest it in his grocery store business. He is very experienced in his business and Kosar is very confident about his success after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband, who will invest it in his crockery business.  With the loan, he will buy crockery in bulk quantity which will allow him to sell in larger quantity and increase his income. He is the only bread winner in the family.  It is very necessary that his business improves and that he manages the financial cycle smoothly. 

Rehana is the mother of 3 children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She is very active and performs her household duties very well. She is also a great administrator and manages her family expenses very well.  She is hopeful that after the loan investment, her husband will be able to increase his profits and help her family to live better financial life.

loans.use: To buy crockery to sell

loans.name: Sheeman's Group

texts.en:
Sheeman is a housewife who remains at her home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very good administrator and has maintained her household expenses very well.  Her husband has an animal selling business. He buys animals (sheep and goats), raises them by giving them good quality food, and then sells to butchers at a profit.  Sheeman also supports her husband in his business by taking care of his animals.  She is a mother of 4 children. All of them are enrolled in the local school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy goats and sheep for selling to butchers to earn better profits.  He has been operating his business for the past 6 years, and Sheeman is hopeful that after the loan investment he will be able to improve his business and increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats & sheep) for animal sales business

loans.name: Farkhanda's Group

texts.en:
Farkhanda is married and has 3 children. Her eldest son is working while other 2 are very young and are not yet of school-going age. 

Farkhanda is very supportive of her family.  She sells decoration pieces to different gift shops in the market. She is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well.  Her husband is a teacher. He teaches in a school and also tutors different students in his area for a reasonable rate. 

Farkhanda has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her business. With the loan, she will buy decoration pieces like vases, artificial flowers & sceneries, etc. in larger quantities to sell to her customers to earn better profits.   She is confident that this investment will be productive one for her and she will be able to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy decoration pieces to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy embroidery beads and textiles

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is married and has given birth to 3 children, all of them are attending the local school.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to his passengers and earns income for his family. 

Shahnaz is a seamstress. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month.  She is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well along with her sewing business.

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to repair his rickshaw because it is creating problems and doesn’t allow him to drive for longer hours.   Shahnaz is hopeful that after the repair work her husband will be able to provide better quality transport services to his passengers and increase his profits and allow her family to live a better life.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en: Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a rickshaw driver.  He wants to change the body of his rickshaw to help him drive it more smoothly and provide better quality transport services to his passengers.   Sughran herself is very active and performs her household duties very well.  She has given birth to 3 children, 2 of them are studying while her youngest child is not of school-going age yet.  Sughran is hopeful that this investment will help her husband save his business asset and increase his income.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Fehmida's Group

texts.en:
Fehmida is married.  She has given birth to 3 children, all of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.  Fehmida is a housewife and stays at her home and does her household responsibilities.  Her husband has a business making car seat covers, which is called Poshish in the local Urdu language.  He is an expert in this work and makes beautiful seat covers,  which has a good demand among his customers. 

Fehmida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy leather, thread and foam to make seat covers of better quality and increase his sales.  Fehmida is confident that this investment will be a productive one for him and he will be able to make more profits. 

Note: In the photo, one of the members has a spice selling business, that is why they are holding spices packs.

loans.use: to buy materials to make car seat covers

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to support her husband who is a rickshaw driver and the only breadwinner in the family.   With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw whose engine is creating problems and needs repair and maintenance work urgently otherwise it will seize up.  He has been driving his rickshaw for the past 20 years and Tahira is hopeful that this investment will not only help him save his business asset but also help him make more profit by providing better quality transport services to his passengers.  Tahira doesn’t have any children and spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. 

Note:  In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Tahira.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Na'ema

texts.en:
Na'ema is a 62-year-old woman.  She is married and has four sons and four daughters, all of them are married except one of her sons, who is employed and has a decent salary. 

Na'ema wants to open a small entertainment business by purchasing a number of computers to open a store for customers who like to play computer games.  But, the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,000 from FATEN. When Na'ema gets the loan, she will be able to purchase a number of computers she needs to open the business.  This will enable her to open her business successfully and have many customers who enjoy playing computer games, which will lead to improving her income and better life conditions.   

Na'ema is photographed in the FATEN branch with her son Shareef.

loans.use: buy computers

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is 52 years old but she is still very active at this age. She has some buffaloes at home and sells their milk. She is known in her community for providing fresh quality milk.  Her husband is a mason by profession. 

Khursheed has 2 sons, her eldest son is married and is a master tailor. He is a specialist in sewing men's trousers and pants. Her youngest son works in a private organization for a low income.   

Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her milk selling business.  With the loan, she will buy another buffalo that will not only help her to add to the asset for her business but also allow her to provide a larger quantity of milk to her clients and increase her sales and profits.   She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for the past 15 years. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khursheed.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
Riffat is married and has 2 daughters and 2 sons, all of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers.  He is the only breadwinner in the family.  Nowadays, his rickshaw is having problems and its body needs to be replaced.  For this purpose, Riffat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. The loan will help her husband repair his rickshaw and also buy a new body for it.  This will allow him to provide better quality transport services to his passengers and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for past 10 years and Riffat is confident about the positive financial growth for her husband's business after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Riffat.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 40-year-old woman.  She is married and has three sons and one daughter.  Her husband is a worker with a low income and her daughter is employed with a decent salary. Lubna sells embroideries and wants to improve her business to increase her income.  She wants to purchase more textiles and threads to improve her embroidery business, but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN for this purpose.  When Lubna gets the loan, she will be able to purchase more textiles and threads and have a better collection to compete with other embroidery vendors and increase her sales and so increase her income. 

Lubna is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: buy embroidery textiles and threads

loans.name: Christina's Group

texts.en:
Christina could not complete her education due to financial constraints. Her husband is an electrician by profession. He provides electrical repair services to his clients. He is an expert in his work, and his customers are very satisfied with the quality of services he provides.

Christina is the mother of a son and a daughter. Both children are very young and not of school-going age. She is very supportive and has a job in order to, along with her husband, afford the living expenses of her family. She is also a very good housewife, and she performs her duties very well after coming home from work.

Christina has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to further expand her husband’s electrical repair business. With the loan, he will buy electrical repair tools, such as a drill and pliers, to provide better quality services to his clients and to increase his profits. He has been operating his business for the past 10 years, and Christina hopes that an investment will bring better profits to him and improve the lifestyle of her family.

loans.use: to buy electrical repair tools, such as a drill and pliers, for an electrician's business.

loans.name: Lateefa

texts.en: Lateefa is a 56-year-old woman. She is married and has one son and three daughters. Her husband and her son are workers with decent salaries. Lateefa makes embroideries and her daughters help her in this project. Because of high customer demand to buy and get these Palestinian traditional embroideries, Lateefa wants to expand her project and purchase more beads and textiles. The amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Lateefa gets the loan, she will be able to purchase beads and textiles for embroideries and has a better collection to sell. This will increase her income and enable her to offer better life conditions to her family. Lateefa is photographed in FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing beads and textiles for embroideries.

loans.name: Fawwaz

texts.en: Fawwaz is a 62-year-old man. He is married and has three sons and three daughters. Fawwaz drives a taxi that is used for cargo, and he has another source of income from agriculture. Fawwaz wants to improve his work through making some repairs to his taxi, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Fawwaz gets the loan, he will be able to pay for repairing the taxi. This will increase the taxi capacity positively and enable Fawwaz to work extra and increase his income and provide better life conditions for the family. Fawwaz is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To pay for making repairs to the taxi.

loans.name: Othman

texts.en: Othman is a 66-year-old man. He is married with three sons and four daughters, and he works in agriculture, raising sheep. Othman wants to expand his project by increasing his number of sheep. He has to benefit more from selling sheep products. He wants to purchase more sheep but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan amount of $2,000 from FATEN. When Othman gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase more sheep and expand his project. His income will increase by selling more sheep products and he will be able to offer better life conditions to his family. Othman is photographed in his project.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy computers and accessories

loans.name: Isam

texts.en:
Isam is a 49-year-old man. He is married and has two sons and one daughter.  He has his own business, which is making furniture. His furniture has high customer demand because of the high-quality. Isam wants to purchase wood that is essential in his work in large quantity, but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan of amount $3,000 from FATEN for this purpose.  

When Isam gets the loan, he will be able to purchase large quantities of wood.  This will enable him to continue his work of making high-quality furniture and so have a better collection that will enable him to compete with others and sell more and increase his income.  That will enable him to provide better life conditions to his family. 

Isam is photographed in his business.

loans.use: To purchase large bulk of wood for furniture making.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child aged 17 years who is in secondary school. She has a construction business through which she supplies sand, ballast and building stones, etc. to the construction sites. She employs three people and began the business out of the high demand for building materials around the growing towns in Mombasa. 

Dorothy has been a client of Milango for over one and half years.  Dorothy always hires a transport vehicle to supply the materials and has set her eyes on buying her own in the future.  Her main challenges are the high municipal charges and lack of capital. Dorothy is quite excited with the fact that her business will be viewed online through KIVA.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married and has one child. He offers taxi services using his personal car. Alexander used to work at a plant which was later downsized. Then he worked as a guard at a security company. After that he decided to become self-employed and began using his car as a taxi. He has been a taxi driver for 6 years now. His monthly income is about 5,000 UAH.

Alexander would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to fix the engine of his car. His business goal is to make enough income to be able to help his son get a better education. Alexander is a family man and has decided to work only during the daytime in order to spend more time with his family.

loans.use: fix his car engine

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.ru:
Лидия замужем. У них с Андреем трое детей. Муж занимается фермерством, а Лидия имеет собственный бизнес.
Лидия занимается выпечкой и реализацией пекарных изделий.  Приемлемые цены и качественная продукция помогли Лидии «держаться на плаву» уже 17 лет. Но она хочет увеличить прибыль и вложить ее в подсобное хозяйство. Лидия трудолюбивая, ответственная и старательная. 
Лидия просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10000 гривен  на ремонт и улучшение торгового места, и закупку продуктов.
texts.en: Lidiya is married.  She and her husband Andrey have three children.  Her husband is involved in farm work, and Lidiya has her own business.  She is involved in baking and selling baked goods.  Reasonable prices and quality products helped Lidiya "to stay afloat" for 17 years.  However, she wants to increase her profits and invest them into her private household.  Lidiya is a hard-working, responsible and diligent person.  Lidiya is requesting a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia to make repairs and improvements to her retail outlet and to buy products.

loans.use: to make improvements to her retail outlet and buy products

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 55 years old, married, and has two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She also earns an income from farming rice.

Salvacion is requesting a loan for 18,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  Salvacion has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora is married and works hard to support her family. She sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Cora is requesting a loan for 14,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase more clothing to sell.

In the future, Cora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy is 39 years old, has a common law husband, and has five children, four of whom attend school. Cathy is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has bee doing for five years. 

Cathy is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to bU. feeds and vitamins for the pigs.  This is Cathy's fifth loan from NWTF.

In the future, Cathy would like to expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has children.  She works hard to support her family.  Cathy has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from a general store. 

Christine is requesting a loan for 29,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.  This is Christine's fifteenth loan from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 64 years old, married, and has 11 children. Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more items to sell in her sari-sari (general) store.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns income from buying and selling tobacco. Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 51 years old. Evelyn has a truck-for-hire business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance of her truck. Evelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for maintenance of her truck

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is 33 years old, married, and has one child. Jenny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines. She has requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store. Jenny has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns income from fattening pigs. Jenny aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia works hard to support her family. Letecia is married and has a rice-farming business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. Letecia has been in this business for 28 years now. She also earns additional income from growing bananas. In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe is 51 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Fe buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines. Ma. Fe requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell. Ma. Fe has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en: Maricor is 43 years old, married and has six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is seeking a loan for PHP 20,000 from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her animals. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and earns additional income by farming sugarcane. She is working to achieve her goal, which is expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her herd of pigs.

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie is 36 years old, married, and has two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. Rosenie runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years.   She also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Rosenie is requesting a loan for 25,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.  Rosenie has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF. 

Rosenie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as shampoo and groceries in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 52 years old, married, and has two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. Rosita runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 33 years.  She also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Rosita is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase additional stock to sell.  Rosita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF.

Rosita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Cesaria Rosalia

texts.en: Cesaria Rosalia is 53 years old, married and has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family, buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She has applied for a loan for PHP 12,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. This will be her 15th loan, and she has been in this line of work for eight years. Her goal is to build and expand her business so that her family can have a secure future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by providing tailoring services in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more materials and supplies for her business. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and supplements her income by selling frozen foods. Her goal is to earn enough money to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies and materials for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 58 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines. She has requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell in her store.

Esperanza has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns income from raising pigs. Esperanza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Loncia

texts.en: Loncia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell. Loncia has been in this business for 20 years. Loncia earns more income by selling ready-to-wear clothing. Loncia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is 47 years old, married, and has six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Linda is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Linda has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a frozen foods business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.  She earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. 

Janice is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell.  Janice has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 48 years old, married, and has nine children.  She works hard to provide for her family. Delia runs an egg business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 24 years.  She  also earns additional income from pig fattening, fishing, and dried fish vending.

Delia is requesting a loan for 29,500 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy additional trays of eggs to sell.  Delia has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF.  

Delia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 42 years old, married, and has four children.  She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. She also earns additional income from rice retailing.

Alma is requesting a loan for 11,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy feeds and medicines for her chickens.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and medicines for her chickens.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 44 years old, married, and has four children.  She works hard to provide for her family. Analiza runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years.  She also earns additional income from raising livestock. 

Analiza is requesting a loan for 14,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase more stock to sell.  Analiza has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF.   Analiza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Diwani

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Diwani works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Diwani is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her furniture making business.

Diwani has sustained her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to achieve her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business.

Monaliza has been in this business for seven years. She earns additional income from her sari-sari store.

Monaliza has sustained her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 55 years old, married, and has six children 3 of whom are in school. 

Lorna has a pig raising business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Lorna has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF in order to sustain her business.

Lorna would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Diadema

texts.en:
Diadema is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and works hard to support her family. 

Diadema has requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and equipment.  

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 37 years old and married with four children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elsie is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for eight years, and also earns additional income from selling fish.

She is working tirelessly towards achieving her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a candy making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Josephine is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her candy making business.

Josephine has sustained her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to achieve her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her candy making business.

loans.name: Ahjol

texts.en:
Ahjol is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt,  in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed, his eldest son is a college student, and his younger two children are secondary school students. 

Ahjol started his taxi business in 2006.  He drives an old Russian sedan which is 31 years old and no one wants to sit in that car nowadays. Therefore, he wants to buy another car for his business.  He is a hardworking and diligent man who says "I ran my business for a long time and I love it. Unfortunately, my car is getting old."   He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy a new car.

loans.use: buy a car

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 61 years old and widowed with three children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store. Prior to this loan, Letecia has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF.
