She has been running the general store for 13 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Letecia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jimmylyn

texts.en:
Jimmylyn is 23 years old and is married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jimmylyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Jimmylyn has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Jimmylyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Lielyn

texts.en:
Lielyn is married and runs a business that buys and sells jewelry in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family.

Lielyn has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more jewelry items to sell. She has been in this business for five years.

Lielyn would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry items to sell.

loans.name: Lina Luz

texts.en:
Lina Luz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a sewing business in the Philippines for 15 years. She also earns income from a general store.

Lina Luz, who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF, is now requesting a new loan of PHP 13,000 to buy more fabrics for her sewing business. She dreams of expanding her enterprise to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics for her sewing.

loans.name: Almagul

texts.en:
Almagul is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with her work and her kids go to kindergarten. 

Almagul started her business in 2004 by trading wool and cashmere. During the summer time she works at a construction site. Her living condition is average and this summer she built her own house. Now that winter is coming, she needs more stock to run her business. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says "I do everything I can to upgrade my living condition". She is requesting 2,200,000 MNT to purchase more wool.

loans.use: buy wool

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 53 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Monina runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, rice, and other groceries. 

In the future, Monina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en: Mylen, a 38-year-old married mother of three children, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for five years and earns additional income by selling frozen foods. She is now requesting a loan of  PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for pigs. Mylen is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for pigs.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann, who works hard to support her family, is married and has operated a sari-sari store in the Philippines for five years. Now requesting a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, she would like  to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Ma.teresa

texts.en: Ma. Teresa is 41 years old and has three children. She is married, and her three children are in school. Ma. Teresa is in the agricultural industry, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Ma. Teresa has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to renovate her family home and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie, a 40-year-old married mother of six children, two of whom attend school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has been selling RTW clothing in the Philippines for eight years. Now requesting  a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like pants, blouses, shoes etc. to sell, Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like pants, blouses, shoes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is married and has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Salvacion has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing equipment. Salvacion has been in this business for 25 years now, and also earns additional income from providing body massage services.

Salvacion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 50 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Norma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing equipment. Norma has been in this business for three years. 

Norma would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt,  in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife helps him with his business, his older 2 kids are in school and the youngest one goes to kindergarten. 

Batbayar started his raw materials business selling things such as bottles, pots, and plastics in 2005. He goes to rural areas to collect the raw materials.  Due to the high transport cost, he needs to buy a pick-up truck.  

Batbayar is a hardworking and diligent man who says "I know exactly how to run my business and I do everything I can to support my family."   He is requesting a loan for 2,500,000 MNT to buy a pick-up truck.

loans.use: buy a pick-up truck

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 51 years old and lives in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 8 children. 

Luciana has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to pay for additional capital for her hog fattening business.

Luciana has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to have a piggery.  Luciana is a MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: add capital to her hog business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Lydia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Aibek

texts.en:
Aibek is 26 years old and lives with his mother and sister in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His mother is a nurse in a local hospital and his sister is a college student. 

Aibek started his local transport business in 2008 by using his pick-up truck.  He also buys old salvaged cars and sells their parts.  He is highly skilled in his businesses. He is a talented young man who says "I am good what I am doing and I need some support to expand my business."   He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy a salvaged SUV.

loans.use: buy a salvaged SUV

loans.name: Bainga

texts.en:
Bainga is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger—a Mongolian yurt— in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife is a kindergarten teacher's assistant and his two kids are elementary school students. 

He was a bus driver from 2002-2010. Seven months ago he bought a van for his own business. Unfortunately, his new van is having some mechanical issues. He is a strong and diligent man who says: "I am very experienced in my field and have a very bright vision of my business." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy parts to repair his vehicle and get tires.

loans.use: To buy parts and tires to fix his van for his transportation business.

loans.name: Battsengel

texts.en: Battsengel is 31 years old and lives with his wife in ger, a Mongolian yurt (nomadic tent), in Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. He started his traditional Mongolian shoe making business in 2008 in his own home. He learned shoe making from his father. He is well experienced in making shoes. Currently, his business is going so well. He is a bright and hardworking man who says "I love to make shoes. I inherited this skill from my father and I want to make him proud also I have a vision that someday I would build my own workshop". He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy more materials to make shoes.

loans.use: To buy more materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Ema

texts.en:
Ema is 64 years old and lives in Makawa Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 
Ema has a general store and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase more stock for her general store . 
 
Ema has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 67 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 6 children. 
Pacita has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan  of 14,900 to purchase 10 sacks of feeds for her hog fattening business . 
Pacita has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Pacita hopes to have a big piggery.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of feed for her hog fattening business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas & coconuts to sell

loans.name: Kulash

texts.en: Kulash is 40 years old and lives with his 3 kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in Bayan-ulgii province of Mongolia. Her husband died 3 years ago. His eldest son helps with her business and her others children are in college. She started her business in 2004 by renting a counter in a local market. In 2009, she expanded her business by purchasing a pool table. She runs her business successfully and her son is very helpful to her. She is well known for her good service. She is a strong and hard working woman who says, "Even though my husband died, I never stepped back and it is my mission for my kids to graduate college". She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy pool balls.

loans.use: To buy pool balls

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 58 years old and lives in Conat, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 
To earn a living, Tessie has a snack business selling items such as puto (filipino rice cake shaped like american muffin), conchinta, hotcake and suman. She earns about PHP 1000 each month doing this type of work. Tessie has requested a loan of 14,900 to  purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. 
Tessie has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Tessie would like to have a food stall in the market.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Bernandita

texts.en:
Bernandita is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Bernandita has a shop that sells coconuts & bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

Bernandita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bernandita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & coconuts to sell

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 48 years old and lives in Labo Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with three children. 

Rizalina has a snack vending business. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending.

Rizalin has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Rizalin hopes to have a food stall in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. 

Esmeralda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Esmeralda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Esmeralda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Luna has a shop that sells coconuts & bananas. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

Luna has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Luna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell

loans.name: Rakhil's Group

texts.en:
Rakhil is 32 years old. Her husband operates a glass selling business. He also manufactures glass items like doors, tables and windows for his customers on order. Rakhil is a beauty expert and operates a beauty salon at her home through which she offers her services of bridal make up, hair cutting, etc to her clients. She has given birth to three daughters. Two of her daughters study. The youngest daughter is only one year old. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy glass in a larger quantity that will allow him to provide better quality services to his clients and earn him more profits. He has a good experience in his business and has been operating it for the past eight years. Rakhil is hopeful that after an investment, he will be able to make more profits, which will allow her family to live a better financial life. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Rakhil.

loans.use: To buy glass

loans.name: Tolobek's Group

texts.en:
Tolobek is a member of this group. He is 50 and he has three children. His daughter studies at the university and the two other children work in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). Two years ago because of the high unemployment rate, Tolobek started to breed livestock with an initial investment of 15,000 soms. By reselling livestock after fattening, he earns about 10,000 soms per month to meet the family needs. He applied for the loan because he needs additional money to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future with the profits gained from reselling livestock, he plans to repair the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en: Natsagdorj is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in Ulaanbaatar city in Mongolia. Her husband is a taxi driver and her two kids are in college. Her family moved to the city in 2009 from a rural area. She started her business in early 2010 by renting a counter in a local market to sell rice and flour. Her business is going well and she wants to expand her business by selling more kinds of products. She is a strong and diligent woman who says "at first, I thought it was difficult to run a business in city but now I have very positive vision to my business". She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy salt and noodles.

loans.use: To buy salt and noodles

loans.name: Uzma's Group

texts.en:
Uzma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a rickshaw driver and provides transport facilities to the passengers. With the loan, he will repair the engine of his rickshaw because it is creating problems for driving. 

Uzma is a working lady. She works in people's houses doing sweeping and cleaning work. The income she earns helps her pay the school fees for her children. She has four children and three of them are studying. She is a very caring and supportive lady who performs her household duties very well along with her work. 

Uzma is hopeful that after repairing his rickshaw, her husband will be able to provide better transport services to his passengers and earn better profits.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Guljamal's Group

texts.en:
Guljamal is a member of this group. She is 52 and unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised four children. All of her children except the youngest son live independently from Guljamal. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 2,000 soms, Guljamal started a wholesale fish business. She supplies fish to the stores and in this way, she earns about 12,000 soms per month. This profit made it possible to save money to purchase a vehicle for her son. At the moment, she needs money to purchase clothes for herself. Thus, she applied for the loan from “Kiva”. In the future, she hopes to expand her fish sales business and plans to invest money in cattle breeding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en: Jargal is 66 years old and lives with her daughter and son-in-law in her apartment in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Jargal operates a general store. She started her business in 2008 by renting a counter in a local market. She sells items such as napkins, toilet paper and wipes. Her business is now sustainable and she has many regular customers. She got a little break to take a vacation and, due to the vacation, her assets have decreased such that she is unable to continue the business. She is a strong and diligent woman who says, "I like to do my job. It makes me feel alive". She is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy more products.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Naseem Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Naseem bibi is illiterate and has spent most of her life in difficult financial circumstances. That is why she couldn’t provide education facilities to all of her children but now, with the financial support of her 3 oldest children, she is able to send her 2 younger children to school. Both of them are studying in 6th grade. 
She is a widow and lives with her children. She is a very caring mother and has worked very hard to raise her children after the sudden death of her husband. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who has a business making sofa covers. With the loan, he will buy cloth, foam and thread to make better quality sofa covers. 
He has been operating his business for many years and Naseem is very confident that, after investment, he will be able to grow his business and increase his profits. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naseem bibi”.

loans.use: To buy cloth, thread and foam to make sofa covers

loans.name: Aizada's Group

texts.en:
Aizada is the leader of this group. She is 39 and is married to a security guard. Together with her husband she has raised five children: three daughters and two sons. All the children except the youngest daughter study at school. Seven years ago, with an initial investment of 20000 soms, Aizada started to sell children’s clothing at the local market. She earns about 2600 soms per month. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to increase the turnover of her business. She plans to purchase more clothing for trade. In the future, Aizada wants to provide her children with a good education and save money to start building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Myagmar

texts.en:
Myagmar is 56 years old and lives with her husband and 4 kids in a house in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business. 3 of her kids work separately and the youngest one studies at a Movie and Arts college. She runs a grocery shop. Her shop has a good location and has many customers. I need support to be a distributor of a large grocery organization: a deposit needs to be placed. 
She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I am a very commited person and I will do everything I can to support my family". She is requesting 1,500,000 to purchase grocery products.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 25 лет. Он холост. У него имеется высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии он не работает. На сегодняшний день Бахтиёр предоставляет услугу, такси. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 25 years old and single.  He has a higher pedagogical education, but does not work in this field.  Today, Bakhtiyor provides a taxi service.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Meiramgul

texts.en: Meiramgul is 27 years old and lives with her husband and her two kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in her father's yard in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband runs a taxi business with his own car and her kids goes to kindergarten. She started her business in 2006 by growing vegetables and selling milk in the winter time. She milks about 20 liters per day. Her milk business is going so well she can't meet customer demand. She is a hard working and diligent woman who says, "I have a vision that someday I could buy my own land". She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT to buy five cows.

loans.use: To buy five cows

loans.name: Tehmina's Group

texts.en:
Tehmina is 39 years of age and married. Her husband operates a shop selling herbs. He also prepares herbal medicines, which he sells to his customers. He is very much an expert in his work and has obtained good knowledge about herbal medicines. 

Tehmina is also a working woman who operates a boutique at her home. She sells stitched and unstitched clothes to her community clients. She is very good at her work and receives a good number of orders every month. She has given birth to four children. Three of the children are studying and one works with his father at his shop.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her boutique business. With the loan, she will buy clothes of different varieties that will help her make more profits from her business. She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for many years. She is confident that after the loan investment, it will grow further.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Tehmina.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her boutique business

loans.name: Sangmad

texts.ru: Сангмад житель города Куляб. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Сангмад занимается торговлей на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает продукты питания. В этой области он уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сухофруктов, изюма, фундука, печенья, конфет и шоколада.
texts.en: Sangmad lives in the ton of Kulob.  He is 50 years old, married and has three children.  Sangmad is involved in sales at the market.  He leases a retail outlet, where he sells food products.  He has been in this business for 20 years.  He is requesting this loan to buy dried fruits, raisins, hazelnuts, cookies, candy and chocolate.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits, raisins, hazelnuts, cookies, candy and chocolate

loans.name: Shaheena's Group

texts.en:
Shaheena has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her grocery store business. She operates her business from her home where she sells different grocery items like spices, lentils, soaps etc. to her clients at reasonable rates. With the loan, she will put more groceries in her store that will allow her to complete the orders of her customers on time and increase her profits. 

Her husband operates a traditional Punjabi food business selling naan channey (made with chickpeas and served with bread). It is very popular food in the city and he makes good profits. 
 
Shaheena has given birth to six children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for the past 10 years. She is very confident that an investment will be a productive one for her and will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 33 and married but has no children yet. They live in a village and manage a variety store selling different grocery items and soft drinks. She has been operating her business for almost three years now and usually earns a profit of PHP 7,000 a month, which they use to acquire their basic necessities. She aims to improve her variety store to increase her income and save for their future. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she still has the strong determination to improve the business.

Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 7,000 to buy soft drinks, charcoal, beverages, junk foods, canned goods and noodles to sell in her store. She believes that her loan will help a lot to increase her product offerings and income. She hopes that in the future, she will make the business grow and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, charcoal, beverages, junk foods, canned goods and noodles to sell

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали проживает в городе Куляб. Он женат. Ему 23 года. У него трое детей. Курбонали уже три года как занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку на рынке, где продает парфюмерию. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара. Он хочет купить лаки для ногтей, маски для лица, шампуни и косметику.
texts.en: Kurbonali lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 23 years old, married and has three children.  Kurbonali has been involved in sales for three years.  He has a retail outlet, where he sells perfumes.  He is requesting this loan to expand merchandise assortment.  He wants to purchase nail polish, facial masks, shampoos and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase polish, masks, shampoos and cosmetics

loans.name: Tolgonai's Group

texts.en:
Tolgonai is the leader of this group. She is 25 and married to a private entrepreneur. Together with her husband she brings up a three-year-old daughter who goes to kindergarten. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 35000 soms, Tolgonai started to breed livestock and resell it after fattening. Her monthly profit from reselling livestock is about 8000 soms. This profit made it possible for her to purchase three horses for breeding. With the loan Tolgonai wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and resale.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, fish balls, siomi, bakery breads and assorted foods to sell

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia works hard to support her family. Virgilia is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Virgilia has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Virgilia has been in this business for 10 years.

Virgilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Saidmurod

texts.ru: Саидмурод умный и решительный молодой человек. Ему  33 года, женат, имеет двоих детей. Саидмурод  опытный  предприниматель. Он  занимается куплей и продажей более 10 лет. У  Саидмурода собственный магазин, в котором осуществляется купля и продажу бытовой техники это стиральные машины, холодильники, духовки, электронагреватели  и газовые баллоны. У него в магазине работает один продавец. Три четыре раза в месяц он приобретает товары  из города на общую сумму 4500$ - 5000$  США с наценкой 14-15%.  Саидмурод продает качественный  товар и у него много  постоянных клиентов. Он хочет получить займ на сумму $3000 США для покупки бытовой техники, получение, которого поможет разнообразить ассортимент товаров и развить бизнес. Саидмурод надеется на вашу поддержку и выражает вам свою признательность.
texts.en: Saidmurod is a smart and decisive young person.  He is 33 years, married and has two children.  Saidmurod is an experienced entrepreneur.  He has been involved in buying and selling for over 10 years.  Saidmurod has his own store, where he buys and sells household appliances, such as washing machines, refrigerators, ovens, electric heaters and gas containers.  He has another salesperson working in his store.  Saidmurod buys merchandise with a 14-15% add-on in the city three to four times per month, using a total sum of $4500-5000.  He sells quality merchandise and has many loyal customers.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of household appliances, which would help him expand his current merchandise selection and develop his business.  Saidmurod hopes that you will support him and expresses his gratitude to you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase household appliances

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 46 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. She is married with 2 children. 
Mary has a general store and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more stock for her general store. 
Mary has been a member of PMPC for 11 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Ma. Guadalupe

texts.en:
Ma. Guadalupe is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Guadalupe is 43 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Guadalupe has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fabric for her tailoring business.

Ma. Guadalupe has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Wenifreda

texts.en:
Wenifreda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines.

Wenifreda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Wenifreda would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 38 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is single. 
Rosalie has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month. She has a requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business. 
Rosalie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Rosalie hopes to have a successful business because she wants to help her parents.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is married with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nenita is 44 years old.

Nenita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nenita has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more corn to sell in her stall.

Nenita has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more corn to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron is 23 years old, married and has a two-year-old child. To earn a living, he sells electronic spare parts such as computer and mobile phone spare parts. He also does electronic repairs in the same business premises. He has been in this business for three years and has employed one person.
Haron hopes to expand his business in the next five years. He has requested 25,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone spare parts.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Being a responsible housewife, Thelma sells fruit and vegetables in the market to supplement her husband's income. She is now 52 years old and has three adult children. Due to financial difficulty, she aims to sell more fruit and vegetables to increase her income and satisfy their basic needs. Despite the hardships of life, she is striving hard because she wants to earn and save for their future.

She wants to ask for additional capital of P7,000 to buy cabbages, tomatoes, beans, onions, garlic, carrots, bananas and ginger to sell in the market. She believes that, through this loan, she will increase her product range and satisfy her customers' needs. She is hoping that she can improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables in the market

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 42 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Carmen runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Carmen has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods and soap. 

In the future Carmen would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and lives in Pines, Oroquieta. She is married with 5 children. 
Josephine has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 
Josephine has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Josephine hopes to have a fishing boat to help meet their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Mahmadamin

texts.ru: Махмадамин возраст 53 года, женат, имеет 4 детей. Махмадамин трудолюбивый человек. Он 6 лет занимается  куплей и продажей крупного рогатого скота, и имеет накопленный опыт в этом бизнесе. Он продает скот на рынке и имеет хорошую прибыль. Он хочет получить займ на сумму $1700 США для  увеличения оборотных средств. Получение займа поможет ему расширению бизнеса.
texts.en: Mahmadamin is 53 years old, married and has four children.  He is a hard-working person.  Mahmadamin has been involved in buying and selling cattle for six years and has experience in this business.  He sells livestock at the market and has a good profit.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1700 to increase his revolving capital.  Obtaining this loan will help Mahmadamin to expand his business.

loans.use: to increase his revolving capital and expand his business

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Bonface is single and aged 22. He has been operating his bicycle transportation business to make a living. His hard work and determination has helped him to retain his business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business and get enough capital to venture into another business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to service his bicycle.

loans.use: To service his bicycle

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima is 34 years old, married and has 3 daughters and a son. All of her children are enrolled in the local school and are getting their education. 
Her husband is a driver and provides passenger transportation services. He is a very good driver and drives the 32-seat bus with a great sense of responsibility. 
Saima herself is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She learnt the art of sewing from her mother and now she makes money from it. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will utilize the loan to repair his vehicle because its engine is creating problems. This will help him improve the condition of his vehicle and also provide better transport services for his passengers. 
He has been in the driving profession for the past 10 years and Saima is confident that an investment will be productive for him. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Saima”.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona is a resident and farmer in Litein. She has been in poultry farming for  6 years producing eggs, milk and tea and selling them to the local market. She is married with 3 children aged between 6 and 2 years.

Lona has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry to expand her poultry farming. She says the loan will help boost her business through the experience she has gained running it for 6 years.
 
She says farming challenges remain fluctuating market prices and animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Meldy

texts.en:
Meldy is 47 years old and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children.
 
To earn a living, Meldy has a viand vending business. She earns about PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. Meldy has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more ingredients for her viand vending business.

Meldy has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her viand vending business

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.ru: Тохирджон  возраст 32 летний, женат, имеет 4 детей. Он решительный и умный молодой человек. Тохирджон 9 лет занимается куплей и продажей продуктов питания и других продовольственных товаров, необходимых населению. Бизнесом он занимается самостоятельно и имеет хороший доход, это положительно влияет на семейный бюджет.  У Тохирджона в ассортименте качественные товары, благодаря, чему имеет хорошую репутацию и постоянных клиентов. Тохирджон хочет получить займ на сумму $2850 США для увеличения оборотных средств и надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Tohirjon is 32 years old, married and has four children.  He is a decisive and smart young person.  Tohirjon has been involved in buying and selling food products and other products, necessary for residents.  He runs this business independently and has a good profit, which positively affects the family budget.  Tohirjon has a quality selection of products, and, thanks to that, he has a good reputation and loyal customers.  Tohirjon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2850 to increase his revolving capital and hopes that you will support him.

loans.use: to increase his revolving capital

loans.name: Almakan's Group

texts.en:
Almakan is the treasurer of this group. She is 43 and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she brings up two daughters and a son, all of whom study at school. Almakan cultivates nuts and is engaged in livestock breeding. She started to breed livestock in 2007. With an initial investment of 3000 soms, she purchased a calf. If they need money to meet the family needs, they can sell some livestock. With money received from the loan, Almakan wants to purchase about 300kg of nuts in order to resell them at a higher price in spring. In the future, she wants to provide her children with a good education. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase nuts for resale

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a cobbler. He makes shoes and sells them to different factories and shoe selling shops. He has a good number of business contacts and he receives regular orders every month. With the loan, he will buy raw materials like leather, shoe polish, nails etc in larger quantity.

Lubna is a seamstress who works for her neighborhood clients and earns a reasonably good income, which allows her to pay the utilities. She is the mother of three daughters and two sons. All of them are studying except the youngest one who is only three years of age. She is a very caring mother and raising her children very well. She wants them to become successful in life by getting a quality education.
 
Her husband has been operating his business for the past nine years and Lubna is very hopeful that after the loan investment his business will be improved further.

loans.use: To buy raw material for making shoes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a father of four who are between 13 and 6 years old and all schooling. He lives with his family in Kitale, Western Kenya where he carries out farming and produces milk and maize for the local market. He also runs a butchery business for additional income.

Joseph has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow that will help him boost his milk production and get income to make life better for his family members. He is focusing on running a farm of five dairy cows.

He too laments the high costs of feed and animal diseases as the major challenges in farming business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Bakhtiniso

texts.ru: Бахтинисо проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Зарабатывает путем разведения мелко – рогатого скота. Уже десять лет как она занимается животноводством. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Bakhtiniso lives in the town of Tursun-zoda.  She is 32 years old, married and has four children.  She has a secondary education.  She earns a living by breeding small livestock and has been involved in animal husbandry for ten years.  Bakhtiniso is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis used his previous loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients for preparing food in his cafeteria. His business has grown since he received the loan, and he has six employees. His desire is to expand his business and get enough capital to open other outlets of his business.

He has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
This is Nimfa, a 41-year-old resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. As a single person, she manages her household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Nimfa operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops like Nimfa's for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2250 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan on her current revolving funds used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nimfa hopes her business grows more in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for scrap materials she needs in her business.

loans.name: Afzaala's Group

texts.en:
Afzaala is a 43-year-old married woman. Her husband has a job, but his income is not enough to afford the living expenses of the whole family so he also does clothes sewing work and is a tailor master. Afzaala also does clothes sewing work at her home. She is very good at her work and receives regular orders every month. Afzaala is the mother of three daughters, all of whom are studying as well as learning the art of embroidery. They are earning from their skills and contributing to the family financially. 

Afzaala has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to buy a new sewing machine. He will also hire a worker, which will allow him to finish the client orders on time and increase his sales and profits. Eid (a Muslim occasion) is coming and Afzaala is very confident that her husband will be able to earn great profits at Eid by making an investment in his business. He has been operating his business for the past fifteen years and Afzaala is very confident about his success.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine for tailoring business.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Jonhstone is aged 34 and has been in the farming business for four years, producing and selling tea, milk and maize for the local market. He is married and lives with his family of four children, with the first three already attending school in his home area in Litein, South Rift, Kenya.

Jonhstone has made a first-time loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to pay for the education of his children as well as improve his breeds to more productive ones.

He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for loan services but reiterates that animal diseases are a great limitation in farming.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Vohid

texts.ru: Вохид возраст 25 лет, холост. Он самостоятельный, ответственный молодой человек. Работает Вохид в сфере транспортных услуг водителем микроавтобуса, которую он арендует. Он перевозит пассажиров с одного населенного пункта на другой. Вохид выполняет свою работу хорошо и среди водителей имеет хорошую репутацию. Он очень самостоятельный и у него большие планы на будущее. Вохид хочет получить займ на сумму $2000 США для покупки микроавтобуса. Этот займ поможет сделать самостоятельный шаг в развитие собственного бизнеса. Вохид надеется на вашу поддержку и благодарит вас за помощь
texts.en: Vohid is 25 years old, he is a bachelor. He is an independent and responsible young man. Vohid works in the field of transportation services as a driver of a minibus which he rents. He transports passengers from one location to another. Vohid does his job well and has a good reputation among his fellow drivers. He is a self-suficient man and has big plans for the future. Vohid wants to take out a loan in the amount $2,000 USD to buy a minibus. This loan will help him make an independent step in the growth of his own business. Vohid hopes for everyone's support and thanks for the help.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 28-year-old business lady.  She runs a general shop so as to earn a living.  She has been in the business for three years.  She also relies on her husband's support in the business.  Previously, she used to sell clothes.

Carolyne is grateful to Faulu Kenya because of the financial support. This has helped her to improve her business. She needs 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy maize flour, rice, cooking fat, sugar and soap.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, cooking fat, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is a resident of Litein South Rift, Kenya and is aged 26 and married with 1 child aged 4. He has has been in farming for 3 years with his farm currently producing vegetables, beans, maize and milk. His family relies on his farming income.

Nickson has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chaff cutter for preparing feed for his dairy cows. He says this will lead to better income and lead to better living standards for the family. He also wants to build a modern dairy unit in future.

Nickson however laments of rampant animal diseases and drought.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Patao

texts.en:
Patao is a 43-year-old married man who supports four people (his wife and three children). He has been a mixed farmer for the last eight years and he deals in both animal trade and wheat farming. The farming business has proved to be doing well in the area due to the conducive climatic conditions.

He learned about KADET from KADET staff during a marketing session done in his area of business. This will be his third loan and he is planning to buy more sheep and farm inputs which include seedlings and farming equipment. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to expand the business.

His hope and dream is to become a prominent business man in livestock and to buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and farm inputs for the next planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
This is Nilo, 41, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. A father of  two children, Nilo has managed by the grace of God to support his children's schooling.  He is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nilo oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 1,000 every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy new accessories, spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Nilo dreams that his children will finish their education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Roderic

texts.en:
Being a father, Roderic is responsible for feeding his family and for supporting the education of his children. Likewise, Roderic aims to improve their status of living and give his family a better life. He is now 36 years old and has two school-age children. As a way of gaining income, he is engaged in a vegetable production business in their village. He has been in this business for almost 15 years and usually earns a profits of P9,000 a month that he utilizes for their basic necessities. 

He aims to plant more of a variety of vegetables to increase his yields and income, but due to financial difficulty, he is asking for an additional P10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his vegetable production. He hopes that through patience and hard work he can be able to improve the business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable production.

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 50 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. She is married with 3 children. She has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 200 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. Elisa has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, she hopes to have a fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya and is married with 8 children, all schooling. She has been practicing mixed farming for five years with her maize and milk produce sold to the local market.

Judith has requested a loan of 61,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow at 46,800 KES and also construct a dairy unit at 15,000 KES. She says this will improve her dairy cows' yield and give her family financial security. She remains confident that farming will be her source of success.

She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services but reiterates that hostile weather patterns and animal diseases are still the major challenges.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 24 years old and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is married with 2 children. To earn a living, she has a business of selling in her sari-sari (variety) store. She earns about PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan of 13,000 to purchase more stock for her general store. Lolita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Ziyobek

texts.ru: Зиёбек житель города Турсунзаде. Ему 62 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Зиёбек десять лет как предоставляет услугу, такси. Он развозит людей по городу Турсунзаде. Кредит берет для смены шин и приобретения необходимых запасных частей.
texts.en: Ziyobek lives in the town of Tursun-zoda.  He is 62 years old, married and has three children.  He has a secondary education.  Ziyobek has been providing a taxi service for ten years.  He transports people within the Tursun-zoda.  Ziyobek is requesting this loan to replace tires and buy necessary spare parts.

loans.use: to replace tires and buy necessary spare parts

loans.name: Hesborn

texts.en:
Hesborn is 40 years old, married, and a father of 5 children, aged 23, 21, 18, 15 and 12 years old. His spouse is Beatrice, who is a small scale farmer but contributes to the family’s total income.  Hesborn owns a timber yard where he sells timber to other traders. This business has been in operation for a period of 2 years, earning a monthly income of about Kshs 28,000.

Hesborn has just joined KADET LTD and borrowed a loan of Kshs 20,000. He wishes to use this amount to purchase trees for felling into timber.  The profits will be used to pay school fees for his school-going children as well as repaying his borrowed amount.

He hopes to expand his business and own a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase trees for timber.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 36 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 14 years old. Her husband works as a welder.

Betty has been running her retail business for 6 years. She sells items like shirts, jeans and blankets to the people in her community. She earns about 6,000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell, such as blankets, shirts and socks. Betty hopes to be a successful businesswoman someday. She also hopes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as blankets, shirts and socks.

loans.name: Anjline

texts.en:
Anjline is a widowed woman with one school-going child. She lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child. 

She has operated as a tailor for the past five years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of creditors not paying their debts on time. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and cosmetics for her new business. She decided to join Yehu to boost her economically through loan taking.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and cosmetics for her new business.

loans.name: Desmond

texts.en:
Desmond is a farmer in Kitale and has been in farming for 5 years, producing and selling milk and vegetables to the local market. He is married with 2 children aged 6 and 4, with himself being 26 years old.

Desmond has requested a loan of 61,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow at 41,600 KES as well as build a dairy unit at 20,000 KES. He says that access to the loan will improve his family's living standards for the better. He hopes to expand his farming and move from a smallholder to a major supplier in the market.

He says farmers' inability to access finances, coupled with low feeds during dry seasons, are the farmers' major limitations.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 26 years old and lives in Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. She has a snack vending business in the school and earns approximately PHP 700 each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan of  7,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending. Rose has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending.

loans.name: Juvelene

texts.en:
Juvelene is 26 years old and single. She lives in Talibon, Bohol where she manages a hog-raising business. She raises pigs in her backyard for fattening and sells them at her town's market. Juvelene also sells sausages to the people in her community.

She has requested a loan to purchase piglets and feeds as well as sausages to sell. Juvelene hopes to have a stable business. She also plans to save for her future family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds and sausages to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 31 years old and lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. She has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more pigs to sell. Esther has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Esther hopes to have a big piggery.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to sell.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is a very supportive lady who, along with her husband, makes and sells paper envelopes. Her husband collects the orders from different stationery shops and also delivers the envelopes to them on their requested date. She is 49 years old and doesn’t have any children.  

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business, because her husband has a big order to fill. With the loan, he will buy paper and glue in bulk quantities that will allow him to complete the orders on time and increase his profits. Her husband has been operating the business for the past 10 years, and Salma is confident that an investment will be a productive one for him and will increase his profits. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Salma”.

loans.use: To buy paper and glue for her envelope making and selling business.

loans.name: Mutunga

texts.en:
Mutunga is a married man with six school-going children. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

Mutunga has operated a charcoal selling business for the past six years. In addition he also sells maize. His potential clients are the local area brokers. He faces a major challenge of transportation. He dreams of buying a motorcycle for easy transport.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and maize for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and maize for resale.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 36 лет. Замужем. Имеет двоих детей. У нее среднее образование. Она более восьми лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Nazira lives in the town of Tursun-zoda.  She is 36 years old, married and has two children.  She has a secondary education.  Nazira has been involved in agriculture for over eight years.  She has a plot of land by her house, where she grows vegetables.  Nazira is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Guljuma's Group

texts.en:
Guljuma is the treasurer of this group. She is 25 and married to an electrician. Together with her husband she is bringing up two sons, both of whom are preschool age (under seven). 

Seven years ago Guljuma, with an initial investment of 50,000 soms, started to sell various goods for house coziness. At the moment her business is running well. She has increased the commodity turnover and her monthly profit is about 25,000 soms. She is applying for the loan because she needs additional financial funds to purchase umbrellas, microwaves, teapots, etc. for selling. In the future, Guljuma dreams of building her own store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase umbrellas, microwaves, teapots, etc.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Uganda. She is single and has 2 children, both of whom are in school.  She has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 3 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She generates additional income through working as a cleaner at a nearby school. The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to build rental rooms.  

Hadjah lives in a home that she owns where she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Tagona Group

texts.en:
Alice is a 53-year-old lady who is widowed. She has four children, aged 33, 30, 23 and 16, with only one going to school. She has no other dependents and she lives in Majange, Masvingo. 

She is doing a poultry project and has been in operation for the past 8 years. She sells chickens and also sells clothes. She is going to buy chicks, chicken feeds and clothes for resale with the loan. With the profits from the business she will be able to buy sufficient food for the family.

Alice faces some challenges in the business, which include her debtors failing to pay on time. She has a vision of opening a shop in town in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy chicks, chicken feed and clothes.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. Betty has a business of selling secondhand clothes.  She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand clothes.  She also generates additional income through a pub. The main business challenges for Betty include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only, to open up another shop selling clothes, and also to build rental rooms. 

Betty lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells various items like coffee, sugar, canned goods and soap. She also sells vegetables and dried fish to the people in her community.

She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and vegetables. Carmelita hopes to earn better and be able to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and vegetables.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 27 years old, married, and they do not have children yet. He has operated an auto spare parts shop for the last four years, with a monthly profit of about KES 40,000.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a registered client of KADET LTD, and he is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, with which he plans to buy a welding machine.

He will plow the anticipated profits back into his business for it to grow. In future he plans to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is married and her husband is 41 years of age. She is the mother of two daughters. All of them, including Rukhsana, her children, and her husband operate a paper envelope making business. This is their family business and they have been operating it for the past 15 years. 
Her husband collects orders from different shops and Rukhsana and her family complete them on time. 
These days, her husband has a large number of orders to fulfill, and he needs money for buying paper and glue in bulk quantity. That’s why Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. Rukhsana is very hopeful that her family business will be improved a lot after investing the loan into it. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Rukhsana.

loans.use: To buy paper and glue for paper envelope making & selling business

loans.name: Ndzinza

texts.en:
Ndizinza is a widowed woman with three children who are all independent. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself. 

Ndizinza has operated a fruit and coconut stall for the past three years; her potential clients are the people who come to the market. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods to the market. She dreams of expanding her business to supplying her products to the factory.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase more fruit and coconuts for resale, and she wants to start a retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to boost her life economically.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and coconuts for resale and to start a retail shop.

loans.name: Electine

texts.en: Electine is 26 years old and married.  To earn a living, she runs a cafeteria.  She has been in the business for two years and has employed four people.  She also relies on her husband for support in the business.  Through Faulu Kenya's trainings on financial management, she has also learned how to manage her finances.  This has helped her to improve her business. Her desire is to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She has requested 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as beans, maize and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as beans, maize and maize flour.

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en: Rufa is 34 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children. Rufa has a clothing business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more clothes to sell. Rufa has been a member of PMPC for eight years.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, age 51, is a farmer in Kitale, Kenya. He has been involved in farming for the past 10 years and it is his only source of income. His farm produces milk, vegetables, and eggs, which are sold at the local market.

Moses has requested his first loan through Juhudi Kilimo in the amount of 61,600 KES. 41,600 KES will allow him to purchase and insure a dairy cow, and 20,000 KES will assist him in constructing a dairy unit for the same. He says the loan will enable him to generate income, provide for his family's basic needs, and improve their living standards.

Like other local farmers, Moses notes that finances for farmers are hard to come by, and he appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's intervention on their behalf.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for hog-raising business.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with six school-going children. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mwanasiti has operated a fruit selling business for the past seven years; her potential clients are the people at the market. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods to the market. She dreams of supplying her goods to the factory.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase more fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase more  fruit for resale.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 49 years old, married  to Makau, and they have seven children. She has been selling both new and old second-hand handbags for the last five years, and with a monthly profit of KES 10,000.  


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a registered client of KADET LTD, and she is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to buy more stock of new and second-hand bags for sale.

With the anticipated profits she will pay school fees for her children. In future she plans to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy new and second-hand bags for sale.

loans.name: Asmat's Group

texts.en:
Asmat is 45 years old, married and has three sons. Two of them are studying while her eldest son makes and sells ladies' handbags. 

Her husband operates a medicine shop in the market. He also supplies medicines to different medical clinics. He has put a good quality of medicines in his shop and his customers prefer buying from him because they find it easy to buy the medicine they need. 

Asmat is a very good housewife and performs her household tasks very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son's business. With the loan, he will buy raw materials like leather, cloth, zips and thread etc. in bulk quantity to be able to make a larger quantity of handbags of different varieties to increase his sales and profits. 

He has been operating his business for the past four years and Asmat is confident that an investment will help him improve his business and income.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Asmat.

loans.use: To buy leather, cloth, zips and thread for handbag making & selling business.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 38 years old, married and has four children in school.  To earn a living, he sells bananas.  He has been in the business for over ten years.  He sells the bananas both retail and wholesale.  He also does dairy farming to earn extra income.  

Titus hopes to expand his business and become financially stable in the future.  He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to add stock of bananas.

loans.use: To add stock of bananas.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a divorced woman with three children who attend school. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Saumu has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past three years; her potential clients are the people who come to the marketplace. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase more stocks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of access to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 49 years old and married to Henry.  The couple does not have children. For the last 10 years, Grace has owned rental houses.  She earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000.  

Grace was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a registered client of the organization.  She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the full amount of the loan to renovate the houses.
