She will use her anticipated profits to build more rental houses. In the future, Grace plans to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Karamatkhan's Group

texts.en:
Karamatkhan is the treasurer of this group. She is 49 and together with her husband, who is retired, she is bringing up two sons, both of whom study at school. 

In 2006, the family took an initial investment of 8000 soms and started to breed livestock. The sons help in running this business, reselling livestock after fattening it to help the family earn money to meet daily needs. With money received from the loan, Karamatkhan wants to purchase five farm animals for breeding, fattening and further reselling. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 66 years old and lives in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is married with 6 children. 

To earn a living, Alfredo has a rice field. He earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Alfredo has a requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase fertilizer for his rice field.

Alfredo has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, Alfredo would like to have additional agricultural supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his rice field

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a farmer and a father of 7 children with the last three still in school. He lives with his family in the Kitale area of Western Kenya where he has been practicing mixed farming for 30 years. He currently employs one farmhand and produces beans, maize, milk and vegetables for the local market.

William has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says farming has been his sole source of income and the loan will enable him to provide his family with increased income. He wants to acquire three more dairy cows in the future.

William acknowledges the challenge posed by fluctuating milk prices and rampant animal diseases.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 71 years old and lives in Mitazan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 

To earn a living, Isabel has a business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 1,5000 each month doing this type of work. Isabel has a requested a loan of  PHP 14,900 to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Isabel has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Isabel would like to have a space in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya.  She is 39 years old, and married, with 5 children between 6 and 15 years old.  The first four children are already in school.  Mary has been in farming for 5 years and currently employs one farmhand. Her produce of milk, beans and maize is sold to the local market.

Mary has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says she will use the income to educate her children as well as boost her butchery business within the local market. She remains hopeful she will be able to add more dairy cows to her farm.

She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services but points out that diseases remain a challenge.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Medy

texts.en:
This is Medy, 41, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Govanie, a tricycle driver, and the mother of six children. Two of the children are in college, two are in high school, and two are in elementary school. Medy shares the responsibilities of wife, mother and businesswoman. 

Medy owns a junk shop that purchases scrap materials, plastics, bottles, steel, paper, and other recyclable materials. There are junk shop boys who do the routine rounds in their community to buy scrap items from neighborhood. Other people do the selling directly in her junk shop. She purchases plastic items by the kilogram, as well as paper, bronze and steel. Other items, like bottles, are bought per piece. She also sells these scrap items back to their manufacturers. From her business alone, she earns 200 PHP per day. 

Medy is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000 that will help as additional capital. She will spend it to purchase scrap items being sold in the junk shop. The loan will definitely help her to have a better profit, the more amount invested, the better the profit. 

Medy dreams that her business will become bigger. She wants to have more carts that will be used by her helpers. Having a junk shop is her way of helping the community understand the value of trash. She believes that people just need to know how to recycle items that they believe to be worthless.  The weekly fellowship* of CCT continuously inspires her to have an optimistic attitude in life, she sees every individual has a worth in this world just like the scrap items that she recycles. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for scrap materials needed in her business

loans.name: C 7904 Duteraninkunga Group

texts.en:
Evariste is 41 years old with five children aged between 13 and 17 years. He owns an agriculture business. His business is open from 6 am until 12:30 pm every day--he has 24 years of experience. Evariste is the leader of the group which is called "DUTERANINKUNGA" in the local language. In the photo, he has raised his hand. 

Evariste and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more fertilizer for their field. They hope to grow their rice business. With any profits, he and his team expect to save money for their future and to pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: to cultivate more rice to sell.

loans.name: Dorren May

texts.en:
Dorren May is widowed with four children. She is 40 years old and lives in Kauswagan, Plaridel.

To earn a living, Dorren May works abroad as a caregiver. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 20000. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to use for the payment of placement fees abroad. Dorren May has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: To use for the payment of placement fees abroad

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is 39 years old, married, and has three children. He runs a butcher shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for eight years. He also owns rental houses, which earn him extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his business has improved and his living standards have too. Nicholas hopes to open other outlets of his business to generate extra income. He needs a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a refrigerator and add to his stock of meat.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and add to his stock of meat

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.en:
This is Inocencio, 46, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. He is married to Lolita, a housemaid, and is the father of two children, one in high school and one in elementary. He values his time a lot and keeps himself busy with kids and business that helps in their daily expenses.  

Inocencio owns a variety store. He buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, and primary commodities that are needed in every household. He earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

He is requesting a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP that will help keep his business running well. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand his product inventory. It will also help him to attract more customers to buy household needs. His profits from the business will definitely help him to cover his daily needs.

Inocencio dreams that his variety store will grow bigger and be sustainable. He wants all his children to finish their studies and have a good life once they settle down. He believes that education is the best gift that they can give to them, and it will be their armor to combat life. The fellowship* every week never fails to inspire him to grow more spiritually, and it helps him to be a better father to his children. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business

loans.name: Nareman

texts.en: Nareman is a 32-year-old young woman. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He also owns a taxi and works as a taxi driver. Nareman wants to help her husband pay for insuring and licensing the taxi, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take out a loan of $1,200 from FATEN. When Nareman gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to help her husband pay the expense of insuring and licensing the taxi. This will enable her husband to work extra hours and take internal and external transport, which will increase his income and give the family better living conditions. Nareman is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed next to the taxi.

loans.use: to pay for insuring and licensing the taxi

loans.name: Azamzhan

texts.ru: Аъзамжон женат имеет детей. Он занимается выращиванием и откормом крупного рогатого скота. От этого вида бизнеса он получает хорошие доходы. Для расширения своего бизнеса он хочет получить кредит. На полученный кредит он приобретет крупный рогатый скот и корм для них.
texts.en: Azamzhan is married and has children.  He is involved in raising and fattening up cattle.  He make a good profit from this business.  Azamzhan wants to obtain this loan to expand his business.  He wants use this loan to buy cattle and fodder for it.

loans.use: to buy cattle and fodder

loans.name: Wellie

texts.en:
Wellie is widowed with 4 children. Wellie is 63 years old and lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga.
To earn a living, Wellie has a clothing business. She has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3500.She has requested a loan of 14,900 to  Wellie has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

loans.use: to purchase spare motor parts and pay for her driver's license this motorcycle motor use for her business

loans.name: Kuul's Group

texts.en:
Kuul is the leader of this group. She is 77 and, unfortunately, a widow. All her children are adults, have their own families, and live independently from her. In order to earn a livelihood, she breeds livestock. Her younger son helps her in running the business. She has been breeding livestock since 1985, so she has plenty of experience in this sphere. With money received from the loan, Kuul wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening, and future reselling. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she plans to purchase furniture to improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo chose to be a single man. He is now 54 years old and lives in a village planting and harvesting rice for sale. Due to financial difficulty, he engages in hog-raising business to earn additional income. He aims to earn and save to support his parents and save for his future. He endures hardships and problems he encounters for he wants to make his business viable and profitable.

He wants to ask for an additional capital of P15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hog-raising business. He believes that this loan will enable him to improve the business as long he works hard and strives for it.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for hog-raising business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 50 years old and lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with yhree children. 

Carolina has a 'nipa' (palm frond mat) weaving business and earns approximately PHP 2500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use for the delivery of her Nipa weaving business. 

Carolina has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use for the delivery of her "Nipa" mats (woven palm frond products).

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Madougou Bétché

texts.fr:
Madougou est une femme de 52 ans. Elle est mariée à in revendeur. Elle a 02 enfants qui ne font pas des études scolaires. Le premier a 25 ans et le dernier a 22 ans.  
Madougou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1996. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale  dans sa boutique. 
Madougou a requis son troisième crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de riz, des sachets d’eau minérale et des bidons d’huile.  
Dans les prochaines années, Madougou voudrait agrandir son activité et avoir une bonne situation financière. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madougou is a fifty-two year old woman. She is married to a reseller. She has two children who aren't in school. The first is twenty-five years old and the last is twenty-two. 
Madougou has worked as a reseller since 1996. She sells grocery products in her store. Madougou received her third loan from WAGES in order to buy bags of rice, packets of mineral water, and cans of oil. In the coming years, Madougou would like to expand her activities and have a good financial situation. She says that with the profits, she foresees providing for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 41 years old, married   to Samuel, and they have one child who is school-going. She owns a retail shop and sells milk at the same time, for the last three years, and with a monthly profit of KES 10,000.  


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a group of clients registered with KADET LTD, and she is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy more milk from farmers to sell.

With the anticipated profits, she will pay school fees for her child. In future she plans to grow her business and  start dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy more milk from farmers to sell.

loans.name: Alicia Group

texts.en:
Alicia is 50 years old and lives in Dioyo, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with six children. 

To earn a living, Alicia has a business selling 'tuba,' a native wine. She earns about PHP 1500 each month doing this type of work. Alicia has requested a loan of 1500 PHP  to purchase medicines and pay for medical purposes.

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for four years. Alicia is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase medicines and pay for check-up.

loans.name: C7854 Intwari Group

texts.en:
Domitrie is 26 years old and married with one child. She also takes care of three children. She is the president of a group which is called "INTWARI," which means in English "HERO." Domitrie is in the middle of the photo with a raised hand. She sells rice. This business is well organized. She works from 6 am until 6 pm every day except on the weekend. She has eight years of experience and she currently employs four people to help her. 

Domitrie and her team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy more fertilizer for their field. With the resulting profit from their rice business, Domitrie and her team will be able to save for their future and pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Odil

texts.ru: Одил женат, отец троих детей. Для содержания и обучения своих детей он занимается предпринимательством, купле - продажей риса. Он в сезон закупает рис по низким ценам и в течении года продает его по доходным ценам. Полученные доходы помогают ему в содержании своей семьи. Полученный кредит он хочет потратить на расширение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Odil is married and is a father of three children. He runs his own business of buying and selling rice to support his family and for education of his children. During the season he buys rice at low prices and sells it throughout the year at more profitable cost. The received profit helps him to support his family. He wants to use the loan to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and purchase poultry.

loans.name: Fégbawe

texts.fr:
Fégbawe est une femme  de 31 ans. Elle est mariée à un contremaître. Elle n’a pas d’enfants. 
Fégbawe gère un pressing depuis 2010. Elle fait l’activité dans son atelier et a une clientèle plutôt diversifiée. 
Fégbawe a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter une nouvelle machine à laver. Elle veut utiliser ses profits supplémentaires pour améliorer le cadre de son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Fégbawe voudrait ouvrir d’autre pressing. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses futurs  enfants.
texts.en:
Fégbawe is a 31 year old woman. She is married to a foreman. She doesn't have any children. 
Since 2010, Fégbawe has managed a laundry. She runs her business from her workshop and has a diverse clientèle. 
Fégbawe has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy a new washing machine. She wants to use the additional revenue to improve the standing of her business. 
In the coming years, Fégbawe would like to open another laundry. She says that she wants to use the profits to improve the living conditions of her future children.

loans.use: Buy a washing machine

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 55, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Alberto, 59, who is self-employed. She is childless but enjoys being a wife and keeping herself busy with her business.

Alicia owns a sari-sari (variety) store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, and primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also retails electronic cell phone loads. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 950 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 that will help to continue her business well. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. It will also help her to attract more customers to buy household needs. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs.

Anita dreams that her sari-sari store will turn into a grocery someday. She hopes to improve her family’s future so they can enjoy a comfortable life. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week as the teachings and sharing of the word of God continue to strengthen her every day.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and the mother of two. For a living, she runs a grocery. She has been in the business for four years.  

She has managed to grow her business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya. She has also learned how to keep business records. This has helped her to manage her business well.

Mary hopes to venture into the real estate business in five years. She has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits.

loans.use: To buy fruits.

loans.name: Justo Lorica Group

texts.en:
Justo is married and has three children. Justo is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Justo is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for two years. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase 10 sacks of feed for his hogs. 

Justo has been a member of PMPC for three months.

Justo is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, both members of the group have their own businesses.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a single woman. She has two children 14 and 16. She describes herself as honest. She operates a butcher shop and a cereals sales business where she sells meat and cereals including beans, maize and green grams (mung beans). She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a shopping center. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of renting the business premises. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to increase the stock of cereals. Her business goal is to grow the businesses, separate them and employ people to run the two businesses within five years.

loans.use: To add stock of cereals

loans.name: Affiyo

texts.fr:
Affiyo est une femme de 40 ans. Elle est mariée à un agent de la fonction publique. Elle a 05 enfants, dont 03 sont encore à l’école. Le premier a 12ans et le dernier a 01 an et demi.  
Affiyo vend des produits d’alimentation générale et des sacs de charbon depuis l’année 2000. Elle sert toute personne dans sa boutique. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence. 
Affiyo a requis son troisième crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbon, des bidons d’huile, des cartons de lait concentré et d’autres produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir ses profits supplémentaires dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Affiyo voudrait pérenniser son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’investir dans l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants
texts.en:
Affiyo is a 40 year old woman. She is married to a public official. She has 05 children, 03 of whom are still in school. The oldest is 12 years old and the youngest is 1 and a half years old. 
Affiyo has been selling general food supplies and bags of coal since 2000. She serves all kinds of people in her shop. At the moment, her greatest challenge is the competition. 
Affiyo has requested her third loan through WAGES in order to buy bags of coal, cans of oil, cartons of condensed milk and other general grocery products. She wants to reinvest any additional profits into her business.
In the coming years, Affiyo would like to sustain her business. She says that she would like to use the profits to invest in the education of her children.

loans.use: Buy food supplies and bags of coal

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya. She is married and has seven children and all are in school. She is 40 and has been in farming for 10 years, producing and selling vegetables, maize and eggs for the local market. She notes that poultry diseases are a great threat to her poultry business,

Alice has made a loan request of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry birds and give a boost to her poultry farming business. She says the income will go a long way toward providing education to the children.

She had previously acquired loans of 20,000 KES and 40,000 KES.

loans.use: To buy more poultry birds.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, and married with three children.

Salam is a tailor. In 2002 he decided to open a workshop, making, repairing, and altering clothing professionally. He has more than ten years' experience in this field, and has a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan to pay the annual rent and to increase his stock. His goal is to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and increase his stock.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and has five children. Erlinda is 61 years old and lives in Tangub City.

Erlinda sells crabs and prawns to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 to purchase more crabs and prawns for her retailing business.

Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase more crabs and prawns for her retailing business.

location.town: Silangit, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mindana

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est un homme de 28 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il a 02 enfants qui font des études scolaires. Le premier a 08 ans et le dernier a 06 ans.  
Koffi est un soudeur ferrailleur depuis 2005. Il répare les moulins traditionnels et autres dans son atelier. 
Koffi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des matériaux de soudure pour son atelier. Il veut réinvestir les profits supplémentaires dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Koffi voudrait agrandir son atelier. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit de rendre heureuse sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi is a 28 year old man. He is married to a retailer. He has 02 children who are both at school. The oldest is 08 years old and the youngest is 6 years old.
Koffi has been a scrap metal welder since 2005. He repairs traditional mills and other items in his workshop. 
Koffi has requested his first loan cycle from WAGES in order to buy welding materials for his workshop. He wants to reinvest the additional profits into his business. 
Over the coming years, Koffi would like to enlarge his workshop. He says that he would like to use any profits to make his family happy.

loans.use: Buy welding materials for his workshop

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira is the leader of this group. She is 44 and married to a mechanic. Together with her husband she is bringing up a son and a daughter. The son is a student and the daughter is not yet because she is preschool age (under seven). 

At the moment, Elmira is trying to open a small nice canteen. She is applying for the loan because she needs money to purchase tables for the canteen. In the future, she hopes her business will be successful.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase tables.

loans.name: Tolibshoh

texts.ru: Толибшох проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Его дети находятся в России на заработках. Его старший сын помогает ему материально. Сам Толибшо занимает животноводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов бычков, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Tolibshoh lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 54 years old, married and has seven children.  His children are working in Russia.  Tolibshoh's oldest son helps him financially.  Tolibshoh is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds livestock for subsequent sale.  He has been in this business for six years.  Tolibshoh is requesting this loan for the purchase of several heads of bulls in order to increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to buy several heads of bulls

loans.name: Ismoiljon

texts.ru: Имоилжон женат имеет двоих детей. Вот уже семь лет как он занимается выращиванием лука. Выращивание лука приносит большие доходы и в то же время требует кропотливого труда. Для выращивания лука на обработку земли нужно много минеральных удобрений. Он хочет получить кредит для покупки минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов. Он надеется на получение займа.
texts.en: Ismoiljon is married and has two children. He has been growing onions for seven years now. Onion growing gives good profit, but also requires painstaking labor. A lot of mineral fertilizer is needed for growing of onions and processing of land. He wants to take out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and pesticides. He hopes to receive this loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 68-year-old farmer. He practices pig farming for a living. He also rears goats for additional income. His region has a good climate that is conducive to farming. 

Previously, he was involved in dairy farming. He has improved his farming through the financial support of Faulu Kenya.

Peter hopes to farm on a large scale in five years. He has requested 40,000 KES to buy pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 30 years old, married and a mother of three children.

Hala has been a tailor since 2000. She makes, repairs, and alters clothing professionally. She has more than ten years' experience in this field, and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. She has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a $3000 loan to purchase two sewing machines and to renovate and redecorate her workplace. She hopes to increase her profits to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase two sewing machines and to renovate and redecorate her workplace.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and has eight children. Jocelyn is 47 years old and lives in Tangub City.

Jocelyn sells banana fruit to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to  purchase fertilizers for her banana fruit plantation.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her banana fruit plantation.

loans.name: Maidash's Group

texts.en:
Maidash is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a farmer. The family earns money a livelihood by reselling livestock after fattening them. Maidash also sells milk; she sells about 10 liters a day. At the moment, the family needs money to purchase feed for livestock so Maidash applied for the loan. In the future she plans to increase the number of livestock because she wants to leave a good inheritance to her children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 37-years-old, married and blessed with two children aged 11 and 7-years-old. Jacob buys and sells milk in a trading centre near his area of residence and has been in business for a period of 5 years earning a monthly income of Kshs 5,000.

He has borrowed a loan of Kshs 40,000 from KADET; this being his third term loan after he repaid the previous loan successfully. He wishes to use the amount to pay the milk suppliers and also improve on the quantity of milk he sells as he will be able to get more. The profits will be used to improve the business as well as improving the living standards of his family.

He dreams to prosper in business.

loans.use: to pay for the milk suppliers.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo is a father who owns and manages a hog-raising business to generates income. He is 29-years-old, married and has three children. He aims to strengthen his source of income to support his family and educate their children. They planned to earn and save more income to support the education of their children for they want them to become professionals someday.

Due to inadequate capital, he wants to ask for a loan of P15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hog-raising business. He believes that through this loan he will improve his business and make it a viable source of income. He hopes that in the future they will become financially stable and be able to give their children a better life.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hog-raising business.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 38-years-old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years Alfred has been working hard to manage his small shop which sells clothes and materials. 

To help expand his business, Alfred has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more rolls of lining and other supplies and will help Alfred to generate greater profits and support his family. Alfred hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business by opening new branches. 

Alfred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alfred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more rolls of cloth.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a farmer in Kitale where she has been farming actively for 20 years. Her farm currently produces tea, milk, and coffee for the local market. She has one farmhand. She also runs a retail shop to supplement the farming income. She and her husband have three adult children.

Margaret has requested a loan in the amount of 63,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the loan will improve her farming income and improve her life. She notes that farmers in the area are faced with challenges when breeding for dairy cows since necessary services are very limited. Nevertheless, she aspires toward becoming the major supplier of milk in the area. 

She adds that Juhudi Kilimo loans are having a very positive impact on local farmers.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
To make a living, Josie has operated a food-production business, where she sells street food in the village, for more than two years. She earns 300 Philippines pesos (PHP) each day in the business, which is being rolled into revolving capital to maintain the business. She is 45 years old and is married with three children. 

To expand her business, Josie wants to borrow PHP 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed in her food-production business.

Josie hopes to further grow her business and to increase her income, which will secure her family's future and the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed in her food production business.

loans.name: Asumani

texts.en:
Asumani is 45 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 9 children with 7 of them currently in school. For the past 20 years, Asumani has been working hard to manage his butcher shop, which sells fresh cuts of meat. 

To help expand his business, Asumani has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cattle, and will help Asumani to generate greater profits and pay for his children's school fees. Asumani hopes that in the future he will be able to continuing to expand his business by taking out larger loans from BRAC. 

Asumani is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Asumani who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for butchering

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en:
Renilda is married with three children, all of whom are in school. She is 41 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Renilda has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her weaving business.

Renilda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for abaca weaving.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 45 years old and lives in the town of Pakwach in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, Robert has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells second hand clothes. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bundles of second hand clothes from the market, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and provide for his family. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to work with BRAC and Kiva to expand his business. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of second hand clothes

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 48 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Ali has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells second-hand clothes. 

To help expand his business, Ali has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase new products like shoes, and will help Ali to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Ali hopes that in the future he will be able to open new branches. 

Ali is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ali who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase new products like shoes for resale

loans.name: Nataiyuang

texts.en:
Nataiyuang is a very scrupulous woman who practices mixed farming. She has been in this business for over five years. She is 35 years old and is married to Alexander also a farmer and they have two children.

Nataiyuang is applying for her third loan. She plans to use  part of the loan amount to buy farm inputs like seedlings and fertilizers’ and part to buy fruit for sale. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. 

Nataiyuang  hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and fruit for sale

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 29 years old and lives in Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has one child.
Fely sells assorted grocery items to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14900 to purchase 10 boxes of assorted groceries.
Fely has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: To purchase  10 boxes of assorted groceries

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is from the village of Calaocan, Angadanan. He is 40 years old, married, and has five children. Two of his children are still studying. To make a living, Joseph owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for 20 years and earns approximately 17,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

Now, Joseph is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his business farm. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his business farm.

loans.name: Kutfiddin

texts.ru: Кутфиддин вдовец и ответственный отец 4 детей. Он сам обеспечить своих детей и воспитывает их. Кутфиддин занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур более 20 лет и у него очень богатый опыт в данной сфере деятельности. В основном он выращивает картошку и пшеницу. Кроме этого он занимается откормом скота. Кутфиддин хотел бы получить займ для покупки двух голов бычка с целью расширения своего бизнеса и получения прибыли. Полученную прибыль он потратить для ремонта своего дома и улучшение свое жилищное условие.
texts.en: Kutfiddin is a widower and a responsible father of four children.  He provides for and raises his children by himself.  Kutfiddin has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over 20 years and has a very rich experience in this type of business.  He primarily grows potatoes and wheat.  Besides this, he is involved in fattening up livestock.  Kutfiddin wants to obtain this loan to purchase two heads of bulls in order to expand his business and make a profit.  He will spend the resulting profit to make repairs to his house and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two bulls in order to expand his business

loans.name: Reycel

texts.en: Reycel works hard to support her family. She is single and has a rafia-production business in the Philippines. Reycel requested a 12,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items for rafia to sell to customers. Reycel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Reycel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items for rafia to sell to customers

loans.name: Alonane

texts.en: Alonane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rope-making business in the Philippines. Alonane requested a 12,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business. Alonane has been in this business for five years. In the future, Alonane would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely, age 43, lives in the village of Calaocan, Angadanan, Isabela, with her husband and two school-aged children. To make a living, Fely owns and operates a farming business. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Fely has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 36,500 PHP a month. She is also sells bananas in the local community for additional income. She needs both sources of income in order to sustain the family's daily needs and to afford to send her children to school.

She would like to request a loan in the amount of PHP 40,000 in order to purchase seeds, insecticides, and fertilizer for her farm production.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticides, and fertilizer for her farm production

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo, 52 years old, is married. They were blessed with three children. Alfredo has been engaged in growing corn for almost 40 years. Last growing season, his net income was 40,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). 

He's asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. Future loans from Kiva would be invaluable to him as he sees the loans as the only opportunity for progression of his business and financial security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past five years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells motorbikes, bicycles and spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more spare parts, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits, buy a plot of land for his family, and pay for his kids' school fees. Joseph hopes that in the future, he will be able to transition into a wholesale business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married, and has three children. Tarek has owned a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese, dairy products, and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $1,500, in order to make a ceiling for his market and to add more food products. He is aiming to gain more profits so he will be able to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make a ceiling for his market and to add more food products.

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
This is Darlyn, age 38, a resident of Quezon City in the Philippines. She and her husband Bejamine, who works as a vendor, have five children. She and Benjamine share the responsibility in attending to their young children while at the same time earning an income to provide for their daily needs. 

Darlyn is a Balut vendor. In the Philippines, Balut is well-known egg snack that is sold on the sidewalk. It is a duck egg boiled with a delicious small amount of soup inside. It is highly nutritious food that Filipinos love to eat, especially when they feel tired, as it revitalizes energy and strength. About 450 to 600 Balut eggs are boiled and sold every night. She and her husband not only prepare these eggs but also do the selling, which means they do not need to pay commissions to vendors to sell the eggs. They earn 300 Philippine Pesos (PhP) in sales per day.  

Darlyn is requesting a loan amounting to Php 10,000 that she will use as start-up capital for her additional business, which will involve selling fried chicken skin and quail eggs. There is a high demand for fried chicken skin and Darlyn wants to give it a try since her stall is located in a crowded and busy area. The remaining amount will be spent on purchasing additional Balut eggs.

Darlyn dreams of having a stall located in the market. She still has to wait a little longer to make this dream come true because she needs to prioritize being a mother to her young children. For now, Darlyn and her husband will continue to depend on to each other to make their small business grow for the sake of their children’s future. 

Darlyn never fails to attend weekly fellowship* as it inspires her to go on with her life no matter what the obstacles might be, because she has faith in a God Who she believes will never fail her. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of Balut and to add new food items to her business

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 28 years old, married, and supports a family of six which includes his children (ages seven and four years old), his wife, and some family members. His wife is a business lady and she contributes to the family’s monthly income.  Reuben owns a retail shop in the Kaiboi trading center and has been in business for two years. He earns a monthly income of Kshs 8,000.

Reuben has borrowed a loan of Kshs 10,000 from KADET which is his first loan, and he wishes to use this amount to purchase more stock for his shop. Some of the items he will add include flour, rice, sugar, biscuits, soft drinks, and many more things. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business and improve his family's living standards.

He hopes to expand his business and be able to support his family without difficulty.

loans.use: To purchase flour, rice, sugar, biscuits, soft drinks, and other stock for his shop

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto is 53 years old. He is widowed and has eight children. He has been growing corn for 38 years. His net income for the last growing season was PHP 40,000.

Being a single parent is very difficult, but Norberto does his best to meet their needs. He works hard every single day to provide for the needs of his children.

Now, Roberto is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: C 7849 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Pierre is 40 years old and has three children between ages five and nine. He owns an agriculture business, which is open from 6am until 5pm every day. He currently employs four people to help him. He is the leader of the group (pictured with his hand raised) called "C 7849 TUZAMURANE" in the local language, and has eight years of experience in this work. 

Pierre and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more fertilizer for their field. With their profits, he and his team expect to save money for their future and to pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to expand an agriculture business.

loans.name: Saodatdjon

texts.ru: Саодатджон замужем имеет двоих детей. Она пекарь и у нее своя пекарня. Национальные лепешки очень востребованы. Она приобретает муку на рынке и занимается выпечкой, от чего получает хорошие доходы. Она хочет получить кредит для закупа муки и увеличения объема производства лепешек.
texts.en: Saodatdjon is married and has two children. She owns a bakery and makes ethnic pastries that are in high demand. She buys flour at the market, bakes pastries, and makes a profit. She's requesting a loan in order to buy more flour and increase her production rates.

loans.use: To purchase flour

loans.name: Washingtone

texts.en: Washingtone is a 33-year-old married man. He has five children whose ages range from five to nineteen years. He describes himself to be humble, patient, and obedient. He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat to the local people. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a shopping center in Kisumu. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the transportation of meat, which causes delays. He will use the KES 90,000 loan to add to his stock of meat and to improve the business premises. His business goal is to become a supplier of meat to institutions within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children in order to better their lives.

loans.use: to add to his stock of meat and to improve the business premises

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.en:
Crisanto, age 24, is from the village of Calaocan, Angadanan, Isabela. He and his wife have a baby. To make a living, Crisanto plants and harvests corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 14 years and earned approximately 35,000 PHP with his last crop.

At this time, he would like to request a loan of PHP 50,000 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides to supplement his farm business. He hopes that Kiva lenders will continue assisting him in the business so that he can further improve it and thereby support his family basic necessities.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides for his farm

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Yeng (in the photo) is a weaver, while her husband, Kung, is a fisherman and drives a motor taxi when he is free. They have been married since 1995 and have one daughter. They live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Yeng is asking for another loan of $200 to purchase fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business and buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business and buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
Nely is from the village of Calaocan, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 44 years old and single. To make a living, Nely owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. She’s been engaged in farming corn for over 20 years and earns approximately 50,000 PHP every crop season(every four months) from these activities. She's also engaged in a retail store where she sells food and daily use products in the local community. 

Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her corn production business. Future loans from KIVA would be invaluable to her as she sees the loans as the only opportunity for progression of her business and thus financial security.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her corn production business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past seven years, James has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells paint and does painting jobs in town. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cans of paint and will help James to generate greater profits and provide for his family's medical needs. James hopes that in the future he will be able to transition into wholesale business. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more cans of paint.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel, 35 years old, is married and they are blessed with three children. Rodel has been growing corn for almost 15 years. Last growing season his net income was 42,000 PHP. He's asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. 

Future loans from KIVA would be invaluable to him as he sees the loans as the only opportunity for progression of his business toward financial security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Oumarou

texts.fr:
Oumarou est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est marié à une commerçante. Il a 03 enfants, dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 10 ans et le dernier 02 ans.  
Oumarou gère un commerce d’alimentation et des cartes de recharge depuis 1996. Il  vend (des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huile…) à toutes personnes dans sa boutique. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est liée au stockage des marchandises.
Oumarou a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale et des cartes de recharge téléphonique. Il veut réinvestir ses profits supplémentaires dans son commerce de cartes de recharge. 
Dans les prochaines années, Oumarou voudrait rendre son activité pérenne. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit de s’occuper de l’éducation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Oumarou is a 28-year-old man who is married to a merchant.  He has three children, two of whom attend school.  His eldest is 10 years old and his youngest is 2.  Oumarou has been running a business selling food products and top-up cards since 1996.  He sells bags of rice, cans of oil, etc. to the general public in his store.  His main problem right now is keeping his store stocked with merchandise.

Oumarou has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy general food products and top-up cards for phones.  He would like to re-invest his extra profits in his business selling top-up cards.

Over the coming years, Oumarou would like to work to ensure his business is viable in the long term.  He says that he plans to use the profits he makes to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio, 45 years old, is married and has three children. He's been growing corn for almost 45 years. His net income last planting season was 80,000 PHP. 

He's asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his corn farm. He hopes to continue to access loans and achieve his dream for his children through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his corn farm.

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru: Толиб занимается поварским делом. Он женат, имеет двоих детей. Общее питание востребовано везде. Толиб на заказ готовит национальные блюда. Поэтому он для расширения своего бизнеса  и для получения больше прибыли хочет открыть собственную столовую. Но для этого нужны средства. Поэтому он решил обратиться к нам и получить займ. Полученный займ поможет ему для открытия и оформления собственной столовой.
texts.en: Tolib is a cook. He's married and has two children. Good cooking is always in demand and Tolib makes ethnic dishes on a by-order basis. In order to expand his business and increase profits, he wants to open a cafe. But for this he requires capital. Therefore, he decided to consult us and request a loan. He would use that loan to open and perfect his cafe.

loans.use: To open a cafe

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin, a borrower from Iraq, is 29 years old, married and has one child. Amin has been the owner of a women's accessories and clothing shop since 2006. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has extensive experience in this field. His shop is situated in a crowded area, so there are many potential customers passing by.

Amin is requesting this $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. His goal is to gain more profits so that he can provide a better life for his entire family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Mareen

texts.en:
Mareen, age 30, lives in the town of Ishaka in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. She is single and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Mareen has been working hard to manage her grocery store, where she sells food items and home supplies. 

To help expand her business, Mareen has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items to fill her store's shelves, which will help Mareen to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Mareen hopes that in the future she will be able to open another business in the area. 

Mareen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mareen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food items and home supplies to offer for sale

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a farmer. He works daily on his farm and has a strong desire to improve his crop production. He devotes himself full-time to maintaining his business. His wife is engaged in a hog-raising business in order to bring in additional income. They work hard in their efforts to lift their family out of poverty. 

Due to the high cost of basic commodities, Edwin is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 in order to purchase farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizer to improve and increase his farm production. He hopes to increase his profits so that he can sustain the financial needs of the family and save money for the future. 

Edwin believes that through his patience in managing his business, he will be able to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizer to improve and increase his farm

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 51 years old and is married with five children. He is well known in the business of tailoring. His business hours are from 8 am until 6 pm every day except on Saturday and he currently employs two people to help him.

Evariste has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more materials and machines for his tailoring school.

If successful, Evariste hopes that he will earn more profits than previously. With any profits, he will keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To purchase materials and machines for his tailoring school

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Nao, pictured with her son at her home, is 46 years old. She and her husband Tol, age 42, have been married since 1984 and have one son and two daughters. One is a garment worker and other two are in school. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Nao and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, during the farming off-season, her husband does construction wO.. 

Nao is asking for her first loan of $300 in order to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam  lives in  Uganda.  She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (father and sister).    

Mariam has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Mariam sells her products at the market, retail. Mariam has requested  a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. 

The main business challenges for Mariam   include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to build her own house. Mariam lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Saruni Ole

texts.en:
Saruni is currently married and is a father to two children. He is still a farmer and wheat farming is his specialty.
 
He has been a good client and currently he is applying for his second loan which he plans to use to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to make profit and use the amount to purchase sheep for fattening and resale in future.

His dreams are to become a well-known farmer in the area in the future as he is a hard-working man who can do more if supported.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mortada

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, married and a father of one child.

Mortada is a photographer.  In 2006, he decided to open his own store for printing, photocopying and imaging. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local consumer needs and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to renovate his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to renovate his store.

loans.name: Savan

texts.en:
Savan and her husband, Sombath, have been married since 1987 and have six children-five sons and one daughter. Two are garment worker and other four are in school.  The family is living in a village outside of Phnom Penh City.

Savan is a rice farmer, while her husband works for commune official. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase water pumping machine to spray her rice farm.

Photo: Savan is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine to spray her rice farm.

loans.name: Samuel Kariuki

texts.en:
Samuel is a 24-year-old single man. He describes himself as honest and obedient. He operates a battery-charging services business where he provides battery-charging services to the local people. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a shopping centre. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be low sales as a result of competition. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy batteries for sale. His business goal is to grow his business to a big battery sales business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will further his studies at the university.

loans.use: To buy batteries.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is a simple mother yet hardworking. She is now 40 years old and widowed for almost five years. She did not finished her college education and was engaged into early marriage. Maria Fe was not able to seek for an employment; that is why she only runs a variety store and this what occupies her daily schedule. She had been doing this for almost two years and approximately earns an income of P5,000 each month. 

Maria Fe needs to earn more money to provide a good education for her two children despite being a widow. She has insufficient funds and that is why she is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy distilled water, soft drinks, canned goods, bread, eggs, milk and sugar to sell in her store. These additional items would help increase her sales thus boost her profits. 

In the future, she wants to provide a progressive life-style for her family.

loans.use: to buy distilled water, soft drinks, canned goods, bread, eggs, milk and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Roth

texts.en:
Roth (in the photo) and his wife, Sreybourch, have been married for more than ten years and have two children who are in school--one son and one daughter. They live in a village outside Phnom Penh. 

Roth is a rice farmer and he also was hired by a relative to sell groceries when he is not at the farm. His wife is a garment worker.  He is asking for another loan of $400 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 32 years old and lives in Burgos, Oroquieta City. She is married and has one child.

Julie has a snack vending business and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her business. 

Julie has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending

loans.name: Jojo

texts.en:
Jojo believes, that "a hard working person will become successful in the future ". He is 29 years old and still single. Due to financial difficulties, he did not pursue his college education, he decided to work and help his parents in financing the education of his younger brothers and sisters. He is engaged in vegetable production to generates income. 

He aims to plant more vegetables to increase his yield and income but due to lack of capital, he is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and insecticides. He believes that this loan will help a lot to increase his production and income. He hopes that in the future, he will save up more income and start his own business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for vegetable production

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 41 years old, married to Gesuka, and has five children. She has been selling cereals for the last four years, making a monthly profit of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a group of clients registered with KADET Ltd., and she is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd., with which she plans to buy more cereals like maize, beans, and millet/sorghum. 

She will reinvest the anticipated profits. In the future she plans to grow her business and be able to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy more cereals like maize, beans, and millet/sorgum

loans.name: Sorng

texts.en:
Sorng and her husband Chamnan are both 31 years old; they have been married since 1990 and have two sons and two daughters. Two of their children are in school and other two are still young. They live in a village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sorng and her husband are construction workers. She is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to get to work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils and supplies

loans.name: Hamrochon

texts.ru: Хамрочон на протяжении многих лет содержит семью на полученные доходы от своего бизнеса. Она разведенная и содержит семью одна. У нее двое детей. Старший ребенок помогает ей по бизнесу. Она занимается продажей продовольственных товаров. На полученный доход она закончила ремонт своего дома. Для расширения оборота  ей нужны средства. Она хочет получить займ, увеличить ассортимент и количество товаров. Она надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en: Hamrochon is divorced and has two children. For many years, she has provided for her family all alone, running a business focused on selling groceries and foodstuffs. Her oldest child helps her run the store. With the income generated from the business, Hamrochon has finished repairing her house. In order to expand her business, she requires more capital. A loan would allow her to augment her assortment of products. She hopes for your help.

loans.use: to purchase new goods

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past four years, Susan has been working hard to manage her grocery store, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more of a traditional food called pocho, since famine has been rampant and pocho is now in high demand. This will help Susan generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees and other family bills. Susan hopes that in the future she will be able to finish building her new home. 

Susan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Susan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more of a traditional food called pocho

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Shehroz

texts.ru: Шехроз любит работать на земле. У него свой сад и огород. Полученные плоды приносят хорошие доходы, но для содержания семьи – жены и троих детей этого не достаточно. Кроме этого  вот уже на протяжении пяти лет он занимается скотоводством. Он на полученный займ хочет приобрести крупный и мелкий рогатый скот. Это поможет ему увеличить свой прибыль и таким образом улучшить условия жизни своей семьи.
texts.en: Shehroz is married and has three children. He enjoys working with the land and owns a garden and an orchard. Although selling the fruits generates some income, it's not enough to support a family of five. Additioinally, over the past five years, Shehroz has bred cattle. If he were to receive a loan, Shehroz would use the money to purchase large and small cattle. This would help him increase his profits and, thus, attain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам проживает в районе Кубодиён. Возраст, 55 лет. Он женат. У него трое сыновей. Его дети находятся в России на заработках. Сам Рустам зарабатывает путем разведения мелко - рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа двух коров и теленка.
texts.en: Rustam lives in the Qubadiyon district.  He is 55 years old, married and has three sons.  His children are working in Russia.  Rustam earns a living by breeding small livestock.  He has been involved in this business for six years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of two cows and a calf.

loans.use: to buy two cows and a calf

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 26 years old and is married with two children between 2 and 4 years old.  Charles owns a mill business milling different products. He has seven years in this business and he currently employs one person to help him. The hours of his business are from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day. 

Charles has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his mill business. This will allow him to purchase new materials for good function to his mill. Charles hopes to earn more profits. With any profits, he will be able to build a secure future for his business as well as for his family and he will be able to buy a motorcycle to help him in his business.

loans.use: To expand his mill business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy four televisions and other electrical goods

loans.name: Chroep

texts.en:
Chroep raises pigs at home, while her husband, Khim is a policeman. They live in a village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1986 and have three children, one son and two daughters. 

Chroep is asking for another loan of $500 to assist in her pig farming business by buying pig feed.

loans.use: To assist in her pig farming business by buying pig feed.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 53-year-old mother who wants to support her son Ahmad in his mini-market. He has been in business for more than a year now. 

At first she used to help him by making goods orders to guide her son in the business field. Now that he is capable of doing that, she has applied for a loan to expand the mini-market space and add more variety in the goods they sell. 

Because Hanan is a conservative person, her son Ahmad has agreed to appear in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: To expand the mini-market space and add more variety in the goods they sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, age 24, buys and sells milk to earn a living. This has been his business for a period of three years, earning him a monthly income of Kshs 10,000. He and his wife Elizabeth are the parents of a three-year-old child. Elizabeth works as a small-scale farmer and contributes her earnings to the monthly income for the family. 

Joseph has just recently joined KADET and is requesting a loan of Ksh 10,000 as his first term. He wishes to use the amount to pay the local farmers who supply him with the milk and to be able to capitalize on the increase by getting more returns. He hopes to us the profits to purchase a dairy cow and improve the welfare of his family.

He hopes to prosper in business and live a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more milk from local farmers to offer for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda. She is single and has six children, all of whom are in school. Sarah has a tailoring business. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days a week. Sarah sells her products from home, by means of retail.
