Sarah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothing materials. She also generates additional income through selling fish and by renting rooms. The main business challenges for Sarah include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals for her business are to start selling at wholesale only and also to build her own  tailoring school. 

Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding family.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, 40, a resident of Quezon City in the Philippines. She is married to Leonido, a security guard, and the mother of one child. She enjoys performing her jobs as a wife, mother and a businesswoman. Her business is her way of helping her husband to meet the demands of their daily expenses. 

Josephine is in the garment business. She buys raw materials like textiles, buttons, thread, etc. She cuts and sews these into different patterns, depending upon the job order from her clients. There are round neck, v-neck, polo shirts and sometimes office and school uniforms. She caters to the needs of her clients and provides them a satisfaction guaranteed kind of service to have them repeat orders from her. Her business allows her to earn 700 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per day. 

Josephine is requesting a loan amounting to 11,000 PHP that will help as  additional capital. She will spend it to buy additional products she needs in her business. She will prioritize her purchases of the materials that she needs right now for her current order which is for polo shirts. She makes sure that the order is delivered on time as it will add additional points in her negotiations. "Meeting my clients demand, satisfaction guaranteed will definitely mean additional customers because they will refer me to other companies who need garments," she says.

Josephine dreams of having a more visible shop. Her business location right now is quite far from the highway, there are times when her clients have a hard time finding residence. She is praying to God that one day, she will be able to have enough income that will sustain her to maintain a shop in a more visible area. She never fails to attend the weekly fellowship* as it inspires her to be a more God-fearing and God-loving individual. The fellowship lightens up the load she has, every time they gather together to share the word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials she needs in her business.

loans.name: Jerson

texts.en:
To make living, Jerson has a rice farming business. He started this business when he was 20 years old. He is lucky to be married to a teacher. Now, Jerson is 29 years of age and already has two children. 

Jerson's primary source of income which enables him to provide for his family's daily food and other household expenses is farming. He has been in this business for nine years. With the high cost of farm inputs now, Jerson is asking for a loan of 27,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizer, seed, and herbicides that he will use in rice farming. 

Jerson desires to get better yield yearly to earn higher income and save some of it. He hopes to attain his desire in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and herbicides that he will use in rice farming.

loans.name: Tith

texts.en:
Tith and his wife, Chantha, live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They have been married for more than ten years and have four children--two sons and two daughters. 

Tith and his wife are vegetable farmers. He is asking for another loan in the amount of $700 to repair the roof of the house where he lives.

loans.use: To repair the roof of the house where he lives.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna lives in the peaceful village of Enrile, Cagayan. Despite her age, she established a retail store selling both food and daily used products such as milk, eggs, biscuits, soap and shampoo to the people in her village. She had been in this business for almost five years. She needs to generate an income to pay for bills such as electric, water and daily meals. 

Edna is now 56-years-old, married and has five grown children. Sometimes they help her financially but she doesn't want to rely on their remittances. 

She is now requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, biscuits and sugars to sell in her store. She would like to improve her sales to make her financially stable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, biscuits and sugars to sell in her store.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
FeryA. is a 30-year-old lady who has four children. Her husband works in a private company.

FeryA. is a housewife, who has found that she has a lot of free time during the day, so she decided with her husband to also support the family financially to have a medium-sized yard and buy a good number of goats, sheep, and chickens and start a trading business re-selling them to other farms, or butchers.

Being in the business for more than a year has given her the courage to expand and bring in more goats and chickens, and that’s why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more goats and chickens to raise and resell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama fries fresh fish at Elmina. She has an additional trade which is the selling of different types of soaps. She is divorced and has 6 children.  She is assisted by her ex-spouse to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profits.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Jean D`amour

texts.en:
D`Amour is 36 years old and married with four children between 3 and 10 years old. He makes a living by selling local drinks. This is his third successful year in this business and his work is open from 8 am until 8 pm every day. He currently employs one person to help him. 

D`Amour has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks to sell. With this loan, he will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира замужем имеет троих детей. Она и ее муж являются преподавателями. Она преподаватель немецкого языка. Заработная плата у учителя маленькая и она не хватает на содержание семьи. Для этого она вместе с мужем занимается выращиванием крупного рогатого скота. Полученный доход они тратят как дополнительные средства для улучшения благосостояния семьи. Она хочет получить кредит и купить крупный рогатый скот для откорма и дальнейшей продажи. Она надеется получить займ в целях получения дохода от бизнеса.
texts.en: Munira is married and has three children. Both she and her husband are teachers; she teaches german. Teachers have a small salary and it's not enough to support a family. So, in order to generate some additional income, they breed large cattle. They spend the money on increasing their standard of living. Munira is asking for a loan to buy some cattle for fattening and breeding. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase their profits.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 46-year-old woman. She is married with three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a taxi driver which is the only source of income to the family. Faten wants to help her husband in paying for insuring and licencing the taxi he has as the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay. She wants to take a loan in in the amount of $1,500 from FATEN to help in paying for these expenses. 

When Faten gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will have the amount of money that is required for insuring and licencing the taxi to be legal. Once the taxi is legal her husband will be able to drive and work extra hours to increase his income and provide to his family better life conditions. Faten is a conservative woman so her husband Mahmood is photographed instead next to his taxi.

loans.use: to pay for insuring and licencing the taxi.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 30-year-old single man. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a motorcycle transport services business where he provides transport services to the local people in Thika. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a busy shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to repair the motor cycle. His business goal is to to grow his business and buy a fleet of motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a renowned businessman in Thika.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther used her previous loan of 10, 000 Kenya shillings from Faulu Kenya to purchase hair braids and weaves. Her business has improved and she has employed two people. Esther dreams of expanding her business so that she can become financially stable.  She needs another loan of 20, 000 Kenya shillings to buy a hair dryer and a blow dryer.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and a blow dryer.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 25 years old and is single. He sells secondhand clothes. Paul has been in this business for three years and is open from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. every day except on Saturday, and he currently employs one person to help him. 

Paul has requested a loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. With any profits, he would like to save money and reinvest in this business. Paul also hopes to buy a cow.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Ghalia

texts.en:
Ghalia is a 52-year-old hard-working woman who, with her husband, Khalil built a barn in their backyard a long time ago. In the barn they have a large number of goats that they bring from outside Jordan and sell them at the market. They are now well known among their competitors with their trading business, which has been growing greatly year after year. Even their sons are now in the business helping their old parents.

Now Ghalia has applied for a loan under her name to buy more goats to be prepared for the next Islamic holiday orders which will be next month. In this Islamic holiday the orders become very high, requesting sheep, cow, and goat meat.

Since Ghalia is a conservative person, her husband Khalil has agreed to appear in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more goats and prepare for the upcoming holiday orders.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира замужем и у них двое детей. Её муж работает сторожем, и она занимается купля продажей тканей на местном рынке. Она привозить высококачественные товары, и она имеет много постоянных клиентов. В этом бизнесе помогает ей её свекровь. Более 6 лет она продолжает этот бизнес и у неё очень богатый опыт. Замира хотела бы получить займ для покупки нового ассортимента тканей для продажи.
texts.en: Zamira is married and has two children.  Her husband works as a security guard, and she is involved in buying and selling fabrics at the local market.  She brings in high quality merchandise and has many loyal customers.  Her mother-in-law helps her with this business.  Zamira has been running this business for over six years and has a rich experience in it.  Zamira wants to obtain a loan to purchase a new assortment of fabrics for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of fabrics for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a seamstress in Elmina. She also sells provisions for additional income. She and her husband have two children. Her husband is a mason, and both of them use their income to support the family and maintain the home.

Ama will use her loan funds to purchase cloth and materials to sew into clothes to offer for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and materials to sew into clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children who attend school.  

Angel selling clothes and has been in this business for 5 years.  She works 6 days out of every week.  Angel sells her products at the market, by means of retail.    

Angel has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. The main business challenges for Angel are seasonality and defaulters.  

Her goals is to start selling wholesale only and to build a new house.   Angel lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa sells Kenkeya, made from corn.  She is a single parent who takes care of 7 children.  Adjoa is responsible for the well-being of her home. 

Her loan will be used to buy bags of corn.  Adjoa hopes to use the new profits to buy additional bags of corn to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa operates a salon where people come to have their hair cut and styles.  She has 5 children and her family has lived in Elmina for about 30 years. 

Adjowa uses her income to see to the well-being of her home and family.  She will use the loan to buy hair, pomade, hair extensions and other supplies to make her customers happy.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjowa plans to buy a dryer.

loans.use: to buy hair, pomade, hair extensions and others to cut and style her customers hair.

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda is a 44-year-old housewife, who is raising a daughter and a son with her husband who is a worker at one of the glass factories in Jordan. 

Since she was 18 years old, Raghda has made embroidered stuff for fun, and now, using her long experience in embroidery she started a small business at home making embroidered pillows, wall hangings, and other items to sell.

Now Raghda wants to widen her business and add more variety to what she makes, such as making embroidered table covers, picture frames, and others. In order to do that she applied for a loan to buy more materiA. that she needs to achieve her goA..

loans.use: to buy more embroidery material to make new items.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 22 years old, married  to Tuyote and they have one child who is two years old.  She has been selling clothes for the last two years, and makes a monthly profit of KES. 10,000.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a group of clients, and is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to buy more clothes to sell.

With the anticipated profits from the loan, Sophia will open another outlet where she will start selling beads to match the colors of the clothes she has been selling.

In the future Sophia plans to grow her business and provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 39 years old and is married with four children aged between 5 and 13 years old. Alfred owns a canteen selling bread, biscuits, cakes and drinks. This is his second successful year in this business and his work is open from 7 a.m. until 6:30 p.m. every day. He currently employees one person to help him. 

Alfred has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase large quantities of food like bread, biscuits, cakes and drinks to sell. With this loan, Alfred will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of food like bread, biscuits and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is divorced and cares for seven dependents. 

Ama sells fish, bowls and locally made soap at Elmina and she moves from one place to another.  Her income is used to feed, cloth and educate her children. 

The loan will help make her soap business a success.

loans.use: to obtain materials to make soap.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 26 years old married woman with three children who attend school.

She selling charcoal in South Sudan and has been in business for five years.

Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal to sell.  Rose says the extra income will helps her pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en:
Edilberto has the drive and attitude to succeed.  He raises and sells hogs and also has a rice farm. He sells hogs to the butchers. 

He wants to maintain his businesses so he can provide for his family and education of his five children.  Edilberto is 50 years old and married. 

Edilberto is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy feed, vitamins, medicines and vaccines for his hog, to ensure proper growth and nutrition. 

Edilberto would like to see all his children finished school with a degree so they can obtain good jobs someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, medicines and vaccines for his hog to ensure proper growth.

loans.name: Annah Kiluh

texts.en:
Annah is a 37 year old married woman who has 3 children ranging from 11 year to 16 years old.  She describes herself as quiet, peaceful, and wise. 

She operates a a tailoring services business where she makes and sells clothes to the local people.  She has one employee and has been in business for 5 years.  Her business is located in a busy shopping center.  

Annah says her biggest business challenge is the low purchasing power of her customers who do not pay their debts.  

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more materials for making clothes, to meet the high demand especially as we approach Christmas festivities. 

Her business goal is to to grow her business, buy a plot of land and build rental units to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Rasmiah

texts.en:
Rasmiah and her husband Rashad have started a small business in a storage room in their house mixing detergents and then selling them. 

Rashad also works as a driving teacher so they can support their family that includes five children. Now they want to buy more raw materials that are used in manufacturing these cleaning products, so Rasmiah has decided to apply for a loan under her name to be able to do that.

Because Rasmiah is a conservative person, her husband Rashad has agreed to be in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials that are used in manufacturing cleaning products.

loans.name: Mana

texts.en: Mana is a widow who has one child.  She has no formal educational and smokes fish to make a living. She needs a loan to buy more fresh fish to smoke to resell at a profit.  She provides the basic needs of her family.  Profits will be reinvested to spur further growth.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke to resell.

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Саид проживает в районе Дангара. Он женат. Ему 59 лет. У него трое детей. Саид занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном продает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для покупки в оптом картошки, лука и моркови.
texts.en: Said lives in the Dangara district.  He is 59 years old, married and has three children.  Said is involved in sales at the market.  He primarily sells vegetables and has been in this business for 15 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of potatoes, onions and carrots.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat, 41, is a hardworking business man who is married and blessed with one child. He has run a grocery business for the last two years to make a living.  He works hard to improve the living standard of his family.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Karimjon

texts.ru: Каримчон женат и любящий отец троих детей. Он умный и целеустремленный человек. Каримчон хочет содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и обеспечить их всему то, что они хотят. С этой целью он начал заниматься услугами такси 8 лет тому назад и до сегодняшней день успешно продолжает данный бизнес. Его жена занимается шитьем одежды и помогает мужу по пополнению семейного бюджета. Каримчон хотел бы получить займ для покупки нового автомобиля. Он заранее благодарить всех кредиторов за поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Karimjon is married and is a loving father of three children.  He is a smart and goal-oriented person.  Karimjon wants to supply his family with a good quality of life and provide them with everything that they want.  With this goal in mind, he became involved in offering taxi services 8 years ago and successfully continues his business today.  His wife is involved in sewing clothing and helps her husband with adding to the family budget.  Karimjon wants to obtain a loan to buy a new car.  He thanks all creditors in advance for the support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a new car

loans.name: Makhmadrasul

texts.ru: Махмадрасул опытный бизнесмен. У него свое автохозяйство. Он работает в МВД республики Таджикистан водителем. Он женат имеет одного ребенка. Работа в автохозяйстве требует хорошего вложения. Для этого надо всегда иметь запасные запчасти масла на все марки автомашин. Его бизнес налажен и продвигается вперед. Он запрашивает займ для кровли своего дома.
texts.en: Makhmadrasul is an experienced businessman. He has his own auto business. He works as a driver for the Ministry of Internal Affairs in the Republic of Tajikistan. He is married and has one child. His work in the auto business requires good investment. He always needs to have spare parts and oil for all types of vehicles. His business is established and moving forward. He is asking for a loan to put a roof on his house.

loans.use: to repair the house and put slate on the roof.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a 25 years old married woman with three school aged children.  She sells clothes in South Sudan and has been in business for four years.

Joice requested this loan through BRAC to purchase more clothes that she can resell at a profit.  She will use the extra income to build a concrete house.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Саид занимается скотоводством. На протяжении многих лет вместе с сыном он занимается откормом и выращиванием крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Он женат имеет троих детей, жена домохозяйка. Он хотел бы получить для покупки скота и корма для них  с целью расширения бизнеса и получения прибыли.
texts.en: Said is involved in animal husbandry.  Together with his son, he has been involved in fattening up and raising cattle and small livestock for many years.  Said is married, has three children and his wife is a homemaker.  He wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of livestock and fodder for it in order to expand his business and make a profit.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fodder

loans.name: Susan Taaka

texts.en:
Susan is a 35 year old married woman. She has 2 children ranging from 12 years to 18 years old.  Susan describes herself as honest, jovial, obedient, and kind. 

Susan operates a general store and sells food and household items. She has been in business for 11 year.   Susan's store is located in a shopping center. 

She says her biggest business challenges are high transport costs and inflation.  

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to increase her stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, beverages and detergents.  Her goal is to grow her business into a wholesale operation within 5 years.  She hopes to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to increase stock of general store items.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is married and has 7 children. She moves in the area of Elmina to sell salted fish, which she has done for 10 years.  

Adjoa uses her income to help take care of her home and family. 

She wants to sell other food items and needs a loan to purchase tomatoes, okra, onions, pepper, and salted fish to sell.  Any income realized will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as tomatoes, okra, onions, pepper, and salted fish to sell.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Её муж работает мастером по ремонту техники. Она занимается купля продажей скота. Она откармливает скот и продает в выгодную цену, когда они набирают вес. Мархабо более 6 лет занимается этим бизнесом, и она изучала все слабые и сильные стороны данного бизнеса и набрала хороший опыт. Мархабо запрашивает займ для покупки скота и ремонт коровника. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Marhabo is married and is a loving mother of two children.  Her husband works as an electronics master repairman.  Marhabo is involved in buying and selling livestock.  She fattens up livestock and sells it at a more profitable price, once it gains weight.  Marhabo has been in this business for over 6 years, learned all of the weaknesses and strengths of this business and gained a good experience.  Marhabo is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock and repair of the cowshed.  She thanks you in advance for your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock and make repairs to the cowshed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a widow who has 10 children. She is standing in front of her grocery shop at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. 

Efua uses her earnings to see to the well-being of her family and home.  She will use the loan to procure other types of groceries which she doesn’t have to supply her customers. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to build another shop.

loans.use: to procure other types of groceries which she doesn’t have to supply her customers.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 36 years old and married with 2 children ages 12 years and 15 years. He runs a pharmacy and cosmetics store in Lumley in the western area of Freetown. Both children are currently attending school. 

Musa has been in this business for 8 years and sells medicines and cosmetic like cream, Vaseline, pads, blood syrup (tonic), cola syrup and malaria drugs at his store. He also earns income from another business, a taxi transportation business. He says that the main challenges to his business are competition among sellers and price fluctuation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more medicines and cosmetic items.  Musa says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living for his family. In the future, he would like to be importing drugs and cosmetics from abroad.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines and cosmetic items such as cream and blood syrup

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru: Мухиддин житель района Дангара. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он таксист, в основном он разводит людей с одного месте на другое. Кроме того два раза в неделю Мухиддин развозит людей по маршруту Дангара - Куляб. Этим видом деятельности он занимается два года. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Muhiddin lives in the Dangara district.  He is 26 years old, married and has two children.  He is a taxi driver and primarily transports people from one place to another.  Besides this, Muhiddin transports people along the Dangara  -  Kulob route twice per week.  He has been involved in this business for two years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car in order to provide a safe service.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 23 years old married woman with two children whom attend school.

She sells fish in South Sudan and has been in business for five years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC to enable her purchase more fish to sell.  She says the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Aunte

texts.en:
Aunte is divorced and has 5 children. Aunte sells Banku, a fermented corn/cassava dough mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water, into a smooth whitish consistent paste, at Elmina.  

Banku is typically served with soup, stew or a pepper sauce with fish.

Aunte uses her income to see to the well-being of her children and home. 

Aunte will use the loan to purchase maize to make more Banku.  With the new profits, Aunte plans to build a restaurant one day.

loans.use: to purchase maize to make more Banku.

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.ru: Махфуза умная и честная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Её муж частный предприниматель и имеет свою пекарню. Она занимается купля продажей женских одежд в магазине. Её магазин находиться на центре города в населенном пункте.  Она привозить высококачественные товары из Турции. Более 7 лет она успешно продолжает данный бизнес и у неё очень хороший опыт. Махфуза хотела бы получить займ в размере $3000 США для покупки сезонной женской одежды из Турции.
texts.en: Mahfuza is a smart and honest woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of two children.  Her husband is an honest entrepreneur and has his own bakery.  Mahfuza is involved in buying and selling women's clothing at a store.  Her store is located in a populated area in the town center.  She brings in high quality merchandise from Turkey.  She has been successfully running this business for over 7 years and has a very good experience in it.  Mahfuza wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of seasonal women's clothing from Turkey.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal women's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical surgery.

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.ru: Курбонгул является парикмахером. Она замужем имеет одного ребенка. Муж строитель. Этим видом бизнеса она занимается только один год, парикмахер получает хорошую прибыль, так как эта профессия востребована. Займ она хочет получить для покупки сырья а именно краски фена масок для волос мусса и лака для волос, а также она хочет получить займ для приобретения униформы.
texts.en: Kurbongul is a hair stylist.  She is married and has one child.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Kurbongul has been involved in this business for only one year, but makes a good profit because hair stylists are in high demand.  She is requesting this loan to purchase salon materials, such as hair color, hair dryer, hair masks, hair mousse and gel, and also wants to purchase a uniform.

loans.use: to purchase hair salon supplies

loans.name: Kurbonsho

texts.ru: Курбоншо проживает в районе Дангара. Возраст, 22 года. Холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области уже два года. Кроме этого он занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Он берет кредит для ремонта машины и закупа теленка.
texts.en: Kurbonsho lives in the Dangara district.  He is 22 years old, single and lives with his parents.  He provides a taxi service and has been involved in this business for two years.  Besides this, he is also involved in breeding cattle.  Kurbonsho is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car and to buy a calf.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car and to buy a calf

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru: Мутабар умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она разведена и любящая мать одного сына. Она сама кормить своего сына и обеспечивает его. Ей тяжело одному и поэтому она усердно работает. Мутабар занимается купля продажей скота более 20 лет. Она откармливает их в течение определенного периода, а потом продает по выгодной цене. Мутабар хотела бы получить займ для покупки крупно и мелкорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mutabar is a smart and hard-working woman.  She is divorced and is loving mother of one son.  She supports and provides for her son by herself.  It is difficult for her to be by herself and this is why she works very diligently.  Mutabar has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over 20 years.  She fattens it up during a certain period of time and then sells it at a more profitable price.  Mutabar wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of cattle and small livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle and small livestock

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира занимается услугами маникюра, педикюра и наращиванием ногтей в парикмахерской. Даная услуга очень востребована и приносит хорошие доходы. Муж Нодиры на заработках в Российской Федерации и ее заработки помогают ей в содержании двоих детей. Она хочет получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса  для покупки сырья, а именно набор ногтей, крема, лаков, средство для снятия лака, аппарат для сушки ногтей и для покупки униформы.
texts.en: Nodira is involved in providing manicure, pedicure and nail extension services at a hair salon.  This service is in high demand and brings in a good income.  Nodira's husband is working in the Russian Federation, and Nodira's income helps her to support her children.  She wants to obtain this loan to expand her business and to buy supplies, such as a set of nails, lotion, nail polish, nail polish remover, equipment for drying nails and to purchase a uniform.

loans.use: to purchase salon supplies

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys lives in Uganda, is married and has one child.  She also takes care of additional family members.  

Gladys sells clothes and has been in business for three years.  She works six days a week, from home.

Gladys has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes.  

Her main business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations are to start selling on a wholesale basis and to build rental rooms.   

Gladys lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.ru: Икром женат и любящий отец четверых детей. Его жена домохозяйка и присматривает за детьми. Он хочет содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и улучшить свое жилищное условие. Икром занимается купля продажей крупно и мелко рогато скота. Более 20 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и всегда старается расширить свой бизнес. Икром хотел бы получить займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса и получения максимальной прибыли.
texts.en: Ikrom is married and is a loving father of four children.  His wife is a homemaker and looks after the children.  Ikrom wants to provide a good quality of life for his family and improve his living conditions.  He is involved in buying and selling cattle and small livestock.  He has been in this business for over 20 years and always tried to expand his business.  Ikrom wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of livestock with the goal of expanding his business and obtaining a maximum profit.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  lives in  Uganda, is married and has 7 children, six of whom are in school. 

Sarah sells clothes and has been in business for over 10 years.  She works 6 days out of every week. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

Her main business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals are to start selling on wholesale basis only and to build rental rooms. 

Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing and jewelry.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, single and lives with two family members, one of whom works.

Ali has owned a large electric generator since 2009, leasing electric lines for his area and surroundings. He has worked in this field for four years so he has good experience, a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to purchase a new generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a new generator

loans.name: Groundnut Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Groundnut” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 3,600,000 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Salamatu, 36. She was born in the town of Kamakwe in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a soldier and the couple has four children: three in primary school and one in secondary school.  Salamatu is a petty businesswoman who has been selling groundnuts for the past eight years. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy bags of groundnuts to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of groundnuts to add to her business

loans.name: Valerik

texts.en:
Valerik was born in 1955, and he lives in Zovaber village, Sevan area, with his wife and daughter. His daughter is married and lives separately.

He has a 20-year work experience as a driver for different organizations. For the past 15 years, Valerik and his wife are engaged in animal breeding. He has his own plot of land where he runs his animal breeding business. Valerik breeds cows and calves, sheep, chickens, lambs, goats and pigs in his farm. Valerik’s wife helps him in farming and they work very hard. They sell milk produced in the market near to Hrazdan city Sevan area. The couple also sells meat to meat dealers in their region. 

The money earned from farming helps Valerik cover a majority of his family’s expenses and develop their farm business. He is seeking a loan of 800,000 AMD to buy fodder for his swines as well as winter wheat seeds.

loans.use: to buy fodder for swines and winter wheat seeds

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married and the father of five children.

Fadel has been an owner of a food market since 2010, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his market and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his market and to add more foodstuffs

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of her brother. Madina has been selling charcoal for three years. She works 6 days a week in her business and retails her products from home. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, in order to buy more bags of charcoal. Seasonality and having to deal with defaulters are the main business challenges for Madina. Her business aspirations include selling charcoal on wholesale and building rental rooms. Madina lives in a home that she owns, and has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 37 years old, married and the father of one child.

Mohamad is a tailor. In 2009 he decided to open a workshop for selling, making, repairing or altering clothing professionally, things such as suits, coats and trousers for men. He has more than four years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to purchase a tailoring machine, a generator and to make a sliding door. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine, a generator and to make a sliding door

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Mor Talla

texts.fr: Monsieur Mor habite dans l’un des localités du Sénégal. Il est marié et s’active dans le commerce et la vente de téléphones portables. Il a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans son activité  qu’il a choisie sous l’influence de son grand  frère. Le  but de son option est de subvenir a ses besoins personnels ainsi qu’a ceux de sa femme. Il est sociétaire d’un des  guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de portables a revendre. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité pour maximaliser ses bénéfices, ce qui lui permettra d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Mor lives in a town in Senegal.  He is married and his business is buying and selling cell phones.  He has 5 years experience in his business which his older brother encouraged him to start.  His goal is to provide for his own personal needs as well as those of his wife.  He has been a member of one of U-IMCEC's offices since 2010.  He is requesting this loan for 500,000 francs to buy cell phones to re-sell.  His goal is to strengthen his business in order to maximize his profits.  This will allow him to improve his small family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cell phones to re-sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has one child, who is in school. She also takes care of her brother. Faith has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for two years, and she works 6 days a week. Faith retails her products in the market. Faith has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Seasonality and having to deal with defaulters are the main business challenges for Faith. Her goals and aspirations are to sell charcoal on wholesale and also to own a home. Faith lives in a house that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mabothraneh Group

texts.en:
Isatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Isatu was born in Portloko, a town in northern Sierra Leone. She is 46 years of old. Isatu is a widow and has one child who is no longer attending school. She sells medicines and has been running this business for many years now. 

With help from this loan, Isatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Isatu will use her share of the loan (1,000,000 SLL) to buy drugs like panadols, paracetamols, etc. to add to her drug store.

loans.use: to buy drugs like panadols, paracetamols, etc. to add to her drug store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for advertising and promotional materials

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a hardworking business man aged 35. He is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the past three years, he has been renting houses to bring up his family. He is also employed. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his house renting business. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to renovate the houses.

loans.use: to renovate the houses

loans.name: Jehan

texts.en: Jehan is a 34-year-old young woman, married and has two sons and three daughters. She is  a school teacher and her husband is employed as well, and both earn decent salaries. Jehan wants to make some repairs to her house such as changing windows and doors, and purchase some new furniture. Jehan doesn't have enough money to pay, so she needs to take out a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Jehan gets the loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for repairing expenses and purchase new home furniture. This will help improve her house conditions and provide better living conditions for her family. Jehan appears in the picture above.

loans.use: pay for making some repairs to her house and for purchasing new home furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour and add seats

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy margi, oil, onions, sugar, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 24-year-old married woman with three children, all three of whom are in school. She has a business of selling beans and rice in Yei county, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.
Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more beans and rice for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 38-year-old mother who has nine children. Her husband works in a governmental entity.

Aisha wanted to help her husband financially to be able to support their big family, so almost 5 years ago she and her husband opened  a small market selling kids snacks like chocolate, chips, ice cream, etc. Now Aisha wants to expand her business to include more items to what she sells such as rice, sugar, etc. to serve other age categories such as housewives.

loans.use: to include more items to what she sells such as rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru lives in the Malindi area of the Coastal Province of Kenya. She is separated from her husband and has one child aged three and a half. The child has joined baby class. She began her food café business three years ago.
She has been a Milango client for three months. A loan of Ksh 20,000 will help Nuru buy flour, sugar and other cereal food items for her business. She has no other source of income and plans to set up her own business premises in the future and to open other centers. During low season, she faces low sales volumes (Malindi is a tourist destination and there are a number of activities linked to the presence of tourists).
This loan will help her supply her family’s basic needs and educate her child. She asks Milango to continue to provide her with credit to enable her to support the family through her business.

loans.use: To buy food items to stock her food café

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes, uniforms, and jackets

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. He operates a motorbike transport business to support his family. He also sells clothes to earn extra income. Philip is able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Ishaq

texts.en: Ishaq is a 56-year-old man. He is married and has five daughters. He works in a carpet sales store, receiving a decent salary. Ishaq wants to purchase new home furniture such as bedroom furniture and living room furniture to replace the old one in order to improve his family living conditions. However, the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for this purchase, so he needs to take out a loan in the amount of $2,000 from FATEN. When Ishaq gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay for the new home furniture which will fulfill his family needs and provide them with better and healthier life conditions. Ishaq is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a hardworking businessman aged 45. He is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. He has been running a carpentry business for the last twenty-five years to make a living. Peter has been able to retain his business because of a good reputation with his customers. In the next five years, he wants to operate a timber factory. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more timber for his business.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Kururama Group

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman aged 60 years with three children, all of whom are married. She lives with her husband and two dependants in their house in Gweru.

Janet is cross-border trader who goes to South Africa and Botswana twice a month, where she sells seat covers and bedspreads. She has had this business since 1975. The business is affected by high tarriffs, import duty, and transport costs. With the amount of US$400 she applied for, Janet will buy material to make seat covers and bedspreads for sale. 

With the loan of US$400 she has applied for, Janet intends to diversify her business into poultry, where she looks foward to buying about 1000 chicks. This will enable her to pay school fees for her two grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy material for making seat covers and bedspreads

loans.name: Gülcan

texts.en:
Gülcan is married and has 2 children. She started working 7 years ago making lunches for the workers in her husband’s textile workshop.  At first, she prepared lunches for 2-3 people. Now she prepares lunches everyday for over 30 employees. Before providing lunches at her husband’s textile workshop, she was a housewife. Gülcan's husband used to pay someone else to make food for his workers, but she later told him to give her the salary and she would make the lunches for the workshop. He agreed and it has been her work ever since.

All the time Gülcan has spent preparing food at home in her kitchen has been in preparation for future work. She wants to open a special kitchen (not in her home) to make and sell lunches to many area workshops and local tradesmen. She will use this loan to buy large-sized pots, kitchen utensils, and an oven.  With the equipment she purchases from this loan, she will expand her menu selection and earn more money.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Gülcan evli ve 2 çocuğu var.  Yedi yıl once,eşinin tekstil atölyesinde ,çalışanlara yemek yapmaya başladı.  İlk once,2-3 kişiye yemek hazırladı.  Şimdi 30 un üzerinde çalışana hergün yemek hazırlıyor.  Gülcan Hanım ev hanımı iken,önce eşinin tekstil atölyesinde yemek yapıyordu.  Eşi önceden başka birisine,çalışanlarına  yemek yapması için para veriyormuş fakat sonra eşine maaşı kendisine vermesini söylemiş ve yemekleri atölye için yapmaya başladı.  Kabul ettiğinden beri aynı işi yapıyor.

Evinin mutfağında yaptığı yemek hazırlama işini, ilerleyen dönemde ev dışında yapmaya başladı .  Bu iş için özel bir mutfak açıp, birden fazla işyerine ve yaşadığı bölgedeki esnaflara, yemek yapıp satmak istiyor.  Bu kredi ile büyük boy tencere , fırın ve mutfak araç gereci almak için kullanacak.  Satın aldığı cihazlarla ,yemek çeşidi  çoğaltıp, daha fazla para kazanacağını düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy large-sized pots, kitchen utensils, and an oven

loans.name: Mambowa Group

texts.en:
Loice is a 46 year-old widow with four children, aged 27, 23, 20 and 17. Only one child is still at school. Loice lives in Shurugwi, a small town  near Gweru city. She raises poultry and has been doing so for the past five years. Her business is affected by lack of funds to buy chickens and chicken feeds in bulk.  At the same time, she has to pay school fees for her child.  

She has taken a loan of $400 which she used to buy chicken feeds and chemicals. The loan will help her buy in bulk.  Over the next few years, she wants to increase capacity to four large fowl runs containing 5,000 birds.  She hopes that the profits from the business will enable her to send her child to college.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a single man who is 32 years old. For the last two years, he has been practicing poultry farming to make a living. He is also employed. He has employed two people to help him to manage the business. Samuel faces a major challenge of competition but he is able to retain his customers because of his good repetition. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy chickens.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries like sugar, bread, milk, and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 40 year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is in school.  She has a business of selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for six years.

Rose requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan, to enable her to purchase clothes to sell.  She will use the extra income from this loan to build a department store to extend her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Raeli

texts.en:
Raeli is a farmer in South Rift, Kenya. She is 57 and has been in active farming for 15 years. Her farm produces potatoes, tea and eggs for the local market. She is married, with 6 adult children.

Raeli (pictured above with one of her dairy cows) has made a loan request of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy poultry birds to boost her poultry  farming . She says the business will grow with additional poultry from the loan and make her family members' lives better, as they will have food security with increased income.  She laments the fact that she can only get poor prices for the farm produce.

loans.use: To buy more poultry birds

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married and blessed with two children who are still in school.  She has been selling clothes for the last seven years to make a living. Margaret has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en: Vedaste has been a motorcyclist for more than four years. He is 33 years old and is married to a teacher. They have one child who is two years old and has not yet been able to attend school.  He will buy another motorbike for transportation with the loan. The profits will be used to buy a plot of land where he plans to build his own house. He dreams of buying a car in the future.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 45 years old and a mother of four, two of whom are adults while the other two are still in school. She lives with her family in their home in Nkubu in central Kenya. She has been in farming for 20 years and currently produces vegetables, fruits, and milk for the local market.

Joyce has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a venture into the poultry business. She says  the loan will help improve her income and  pay for the kids' education. She hope to build residential houses in the future.

Joyce laments the poor prices for farm produce and the insufficiency of water.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is a 43-year-old man, and he is married with five sons and three daughters. He has a grocery store in addition to a project of raising sheep and poultry. Yousef wants to purchase more groceries for his store in order to have a better collection for sale and increase his income, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Yousef gets the loan, he will be able to purchase more groceries and have a better collection. This will increase his sales, improve his income, and enable him to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Wallace

texts.en: Wallace is a married man and is 34 years old. He describes himself as a focused businessman. He has been operating a motorbike transport business to make a living. He faces a major challenge of competition, but he has retained his customers because of his good reputation. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a single man and is 26 years old. For the last two years, he has been selling gas cylinders to make a living. He has grown his business because of his hard work and determination. In the next five years, he wants to open another outlet of his business in his region. He is requesting a loan of 18,000 Kenya shillings to buy more gas cylinders for resale.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy jeans, tackies (informal tennis shoes), skirts, blankets, and tops for sale

loans.name: Mehrubon

texts.ru: Мехрубон проживает в районе Дангара. Она замужем. Ей 31 год. У нее двое детей. Ее дети учатся в средней школе. Сама Мехрубон занимается торговлей у себя дома. Она в основном занимается торговлей детских костюмчиков, женской и детской летней обуви и тканей. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки детской одежды, женского и мужского нижнего белья, носков и платков.
texts.en: Mehrubon lives in the Dangara district.  She is 31 years old, married and has two children.  Her children attend a secondary school.  Mehrubon is involved in sales at home.  She primarily sells children's jumpsuits, women's and men's summer shoes and fabrics.  She has been in this business for four years.  Mehrubon is requesting this loan to purchase children's clothing, women's and men's undergarments, socks and scarves

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing, women's and men's undergarments, socks and scarves

loans.name: Lilico

texts.en:
Lilico is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has a business of selling groundnuts (peanuts) and simsim (sesame) in Yei county, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.
Lilico requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more inventory for sale. She will use the extra money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts (peanuts) and simsim (sesame) for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian has been a farmer for the last eleven years. He is 40 years old, married to a lady who is a housewife, and they are blessed with three children.

He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of abode. This is his second loan which he plans to use part to purchase farm supplies and the other parat to buy livestock for fattening. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and to buy a bigger farm.

His dream is to be the best and well known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Drocella

texts.en: Drocella sells vegetables and meat. She is a 28-year-old mom. She is married to a charcoal salesman. One of her children goes to school. Drocella has spent eight years in the same business. She wants to renovate her house from the profits that will be obtained from her business. She would like to have a store where she can sell vegetables in bulk so that she can sell to other buyers in big volumes.

loans.use: To buy food products to expand her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a very hard-working woman who practices farming. She has been farming for over three years. She is 30 years old and married, with two children.

She has been a good client with KADET, and currently she has applied for her third loan. She plans to use the entire loan to buy agricultural inputs like seedlings, fertilizer, farming equipment, and to pay for labor. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to invest in farming. 

She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: buy agricultural products

loans.name: Nasianta

texts.en:
Nasianta is a very hard-working woman who practices farming. She has been farming for over three years. She is 28 years old and married, with two children.

She has been a good client with KADET, and this will be her third loan. She plans to use the entire loan to buy farm inputs like seeds, pesticides and equipment which will be used in the next planting season. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to invest in farming. 

She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: buy agricultural products

loans.name: Hadidja

texts.en: Hadidja, aged 31, is married to a driver. They have one child who is 12 years old. Hadijha sells clothes and she has been doing this business for more than five years. After making profits, Hadidja plans to build her residential house. She dreams of having a booming business of mixed clothes.  She would love to buy from Tanzania at low prices and sell others in bulk.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sarik

texts.ru:
Сарик /Sarik/ родился в 1964г. в селе Гегануш /Geghanush/ Капанской  области, окончил сельскую среднюю школу, затем окончил Капанское профтехучилище по специальности радиоэлектрик. Женат имеет сына 18лет  и  двое дочерей. Дочке 20 лет, она  учится в Капанском сельскохозяйственном институте  на четвертом курсе, старшая дочь Сарика вышла замуж и живет отдельно. Сарику по  хозяйству помогает его жена. Сарик работает в в охраной службе Капанского Горно-обогодительного комбината. Сарику было трудно содержать семью только на зарплате, которая не высокая, поэтому кроме постоянной работы Сарик с 1998 года  занимается также сельскохозяйственной деятельностью в родном селе Гегануш. Имеет крупный рогатый скот, кур, пчел, огород на котором выращивает овощи и фрукты. У него есть постоянные клиенты в г. Капане, которые покупают  выращенные им овощи,  фрукты, а также говядину, свинину, мед, яйца, молоко. Выручка  от продажи сельскохозяйственных продуктов очень помогает ему содержать семью,  платить за учебу дочери.
Сарику нужен кредит 500.000 драм для приобретения ящиков для пчел, а также для покупки сена, что позволит улучшить производство меда и обеспечить корм для скота на зиму
texts.en: Sarik was born in 1964 in the Geghanush village of the Kapan region, graduated from the village secondary school and then graduated from the Kapan professional college as a radio technician.  He is married and has an eighteen-year-old son and two daughters.  His twenty-year-old daughter attends a fourth year of the Kapan agricultural institute, and Sarik's oldest daughter got married and lives separately.  Sarik's wife helps him with the household.  Sarik works in the security service of the Kapan Mining and Processing Plant.  He found it difficult to support his family solely on his salary, which is not high, and decided to become involved in an agricultural business in his native Geghanush village in 1998.  He owns cattle, chickens, bees and land, where he grows vegetables and fruits.  Sarik has loyal customers in Kapan, who purchase vegetables and fruits grown by him and also buy beef, pork, honey, eggs and milk.  The profit from the sales of agricultural products helps him to support his family and pay for his daughter's education.  Sarik needs a loan in the sum of 500,000 dram to buy beehive boxes and also to buy hay in order to improve honey production and provide livestock with fodder for the winter.

loans.use: To purchase beehive boxes and hay

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shoes, jeans and T-shirts for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for improving her house conditions.

loans.name: Foube

texts.en:
Foube is a 42-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has a business selling beans, sugar and cooking oil in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Foube requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase goods for sale. She will use the extra income for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 45-year-old married woman with six children, five of whom are in school. She has a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for seven years.

Nora requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more fish for sale. She will use the profits to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Ololkukua

texts.en:
Ololkukua is a 42-year-old man who is married and a father to five children. He has been farming for the past three years and getting good returns. 

Ololkukua paid his previous loan well and has applied for his third loan with KADET Ltd, which he will use to buy farm supplies. With the profits generated he plans to pay school fees for his children and re-invest the remaining amount in farming.

He dreams to be well-known farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more notwithstanding limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne was born in 1972. She is married with six children who are between five and seventeen years old and all attend school. Jeanne is married to a driver. 
Jeanne requested this loan to buy more fabrics which will enable her to expand the business.
Jeanne has had a sewing business for more than 20 years. She wants to save some of the profits she will make from the business. She would love to have a fabric store where she would make clothes for her customers.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and make more clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Baida

texts.en:
Baida is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Baida requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more clothes for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fish and electric gadgets for sale

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 50-year-old man who is always cheerful in his everyday life, according to the residents of his neighborhood. It is in this neighborhood where he got married and where his first child was born. Adel is the father of 11 children. The burden is becoming heavier than ever, as he needs to cover his children's expenses in terms of living, education, and other things required by the big family.

Adel started his business long ago in order to cover the big expenses imposed by his big family. His business was initially a cafe shop that didn't require a large amount of capital except to purchase kilos of sugar and tea. This business achieved a good reputation in old Sana'a, where it is located, and many people became regulars. Adel's family life was somewhat improved by the limited income of that cafe, but Adel did not stop at this point. He had some thoughts about further enlarging his business by opening another shop next to the cafe for selling cabab, which is a publicly sold food eaten as breakfast.

Adel was in need of a loan to start the other business and visited one of Al-Amal Bank's branches. He received three loans sequentially and this had a good impact on his business and family. Adel took the fourth loan of 180,000 YER from Al-Amal in order to pay the rent of the two shops and purchase needed materials like tea, sugar, new dishes, and tables for the cabab shop.

In the future, Adel hopes to expand his business by opening a restaurant selling all types of food, not only cabab. He also hopes to build a house for his family and children.

loans.use: to purchase tea, sugar, new dishes, and tables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house-building materials to complete his house-building project and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Parsapiyio

texts.en: Parsapiyio has been farming on his piece of land for the past eleven years. He is 52 years old, married and the father of eight children. He was initiated to KADET by staff and he has been a good client. He repaid his previous loan well; thus, when he applied for his third loan, KADET was willing to support him. He plans to purchase farm supplies including seedlings, manure and pesticides. He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand the farming business. He dreams of prospering in farming to provide better lives for his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Dioma

texts.fr: Madame DIoma  est une veuve  d’une soixantaine d’années qui vit au Sénégal. Elle a de grands enfants  et elle s’active dans le petit commerce et la vente d’encens et autres produits divers . Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2005. Elle n’y a  jamais bénéficié de crédit antérieur. Elle prévoit d’effectuer le pèlerinage a la Mecque  cette année. A cet effet elle sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs prévu pour compléter son argent destiné a faire face aux dépenses auxquelles elle est confronté. Ce financement pourra contribuer a améliorer le statut social de l’emprunteur.
texts.en:
Dioma is a 60-year-old widow who lives in Senegal.  She has grandchildren and she has a small business selling incense and other miscellaneous products.  She has been a member of one of U-MICEC's offices since April 2005.  She has not received any previous loans.

Dioma plans to make a pilgrimage to Mecca this year.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 500,000 francs to put together with some money she already has to cover the expenses that she faces.  This loan could contribute towards improving the social status of the borrower.

loans.use: to cover expenses related to her trip to the Holy Place

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en:
Nadine is 36 years old, married to a carpenter and has 6 children. Her children range from 5 to 19 years old and are all in school. 

She will use this loan to buy more charcoal and wood for making furniture. Nadine has spent many years in the business. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school fees. In the future she would like to have more valuable furniture.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and wood to make furniture for sale.

loans.name: Leseyio

texts.en:
Leseyio is 34 years old, married and blessed with four children. He is a livestock trader and has been doing this for the last five years. 

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area. He is a good client and this will be his first loan which he is planning to use to buy more livestock. He hopes to use the profit from this loan venture into farming to educate his children.

His dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. He is a finicky man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase or order more charcoal for sale. She will use the extra money from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tea seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stock of assorted vegetables for sale

loans.name: Annointed Group

texts.en:
Kaitano is 33 years old and lives in the Midlands province of Zimbabwe. He is married and has one child aged 1. 

Kaitano has been in the poultry business for three years. His challenges are the scarcity of feeds and a lack of funds to buy stock in bulk when they are available.

He has applied for US$400 to buy feeds and chicks. With the additional income obtained from his business, Kaitano will pay school fees for his three brothers he is looking after.

Kaitano plans to own a farm in the near future.

loans.use: To buy feeds and chicks.

loans.name: Finah

texts.en: Fina, aged 31, has two children; they are 4 and 13 years old. All the children are enrolled in schools. Fina owns a canteen, selling different things like milk and andazi (doughnuts) for students. The profits from the business will be used to buy her residential house. She would like to own a big store like a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel used his first loan to stock up his shop by buying flour, sugar and rice, and the business has been a success and profitable.Beside the shop he also started selling timber for building.

This is Daniel's second loan, which he plans to expand business of selling timber by  buying  more timber for resale.

In the future, Daniel hopes to become among the top timber dealers in the area.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh Vit au Sénégal. Il évolue depuis 7 ans dans le secteur du transport. Il est célibataire et membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achèvement  d’une construction qu’elle avait entamé.  Ce financement l’aidera à améliorer son cadre de vie social.
texts.en: Mr. Cheikh lives in Senegal.  He has worked in transport for seven years.   He is single and has been a member of l'U-IMCEC since June of 2011.  He is requesting a credit of 500,000 frs in order to finish some construction work that he has started.  This loan will help him to improve his social standing.

loans.use: to finish a construction project.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 23 years.  She is 47 years old and a mother to four children, all of whom are in school.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of the existing clients. This will be her second loan.  She paid all her previous loan well and on time.  She plans to use the loan to buy farming materials: seeds, fertilizers, and sprays.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to improve her farming skills and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy farming materials: seeds, fertilizers, and sprays.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy has been selling cereals and green grocery items for the last five years to make a living. She also practices livestock farming to earn extra income. She is married and blessed with one child who goes to school. In the next five years, she wants to manage a wholesale business. Mercy dreams of buying a piece of land and building rental houses. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize and beans.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica has a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for seven years. Monica is 36 years old. She is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. 

Monica requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more clothes for sale. She will use the extra income to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mabinty's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the priM. schools in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. These dedicated staff members have formed themselves into a group of four out of a total of fourteen teachers in the school, in order to seek a loan of 4,000,000 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders.  

With the help of this loan, they can solve immediate financial needs that their mere salaries alone cannot enable them to do.  At the end of each month, they will use their monthly salaries to repay the loan.  Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.

Mabinty is the leader of this group of teachers. Mabinty is 53 years old and a native of Mabonto village in northern Sierra Leone. Mabinty is married and has four children. She has served in the teaching profession for 33 years. She has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. She is 51 years old, married to Peter and they have one school-going child.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Esther hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 23 years. She is 49 years old and married to John; they have four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs.

In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her farming skills.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man blessed with one child. For the last three years, he has been selling animal feed to make a living. He also does tea farming to increase his saving. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy animal feed for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married and blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. For the last six years, he has been selling charcoal to make a living. He also rents houses to earn extra income. Previously, he was practicing livestock farming. His customers are people living in that area, and he is also able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. 

Through Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie, aged 30, is married to a motorcyclist. Marie has three children aged between 2 and 9 years. All three children attend school. Marie sells vegetables and spices.
