She has been doing this business for seven years. With the profits, she wants to buy a plot of land which will be used as her home. She dreams to sell cows in the future.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and spices

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is married and blessed with two children. He runs a retail business where he has been selling sweets, biscuits and sodas for the last five years to bring up the family. He also practices dairy farming to earn extra income. His potential customers are passesrby. In the next five years, he wants to become more financially stable. Anthony dreams of managing a supermarket in the future. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy sweets, sodas and biscuits for resale.

loans.use: To buy sweets, soda and biscuitsto sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy spare parts for her mini buses.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years. She is 52 years old, married to Antony, and they have three children going to school.  

Jane was introduced to KADET by a field officer and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Jane hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is married and blessed with three children. For the last five years, he has been practicing dairy farming to make a living. He also practices tea farming to earn extra income. Paul has been able to manage the business with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He dream for the future is to become a milk supplier in his region. He has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy animal feed.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Nevaditas De Chijini Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NEVADITAS DE CHIJINI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lucia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de lana hilada, tienda de barrio, artesanía en aguayo, tejido de mantas, venta de tucumanas, venta de repuestos de autos, elaboración de masitas.

La señora Lucia,  indica que es primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de hilado de vicuña que viene trabajando hace un año y medio atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana de vicuña) que adquirirá de la feria 16 de julio y posteriormente elaborado lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.

En la fotografía no se encuentran dos socias, Ana e Irene, ya que se fueron a consulta médica
texts.en:
Nevaditas de Chijini Communal Association will begin its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Cascada.  There are nine members and it is run by a board headed by Lucia.  The businesses managed by the members of the communal association are varied, including selling spun wool, a neighborhood store, traditional craftwork with wool cloth ("aguayo"), woven blankets, selling auto parts, and pastry making.

Lucia indicates that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, and that she joined on an invitation from friends.  Currently she has a business selling vicuña yarn that she has been working on for the past year and a half.

She will use this loan to increase her capital buying vicuña wool, which she will acquire from the 16 de Julio market and later will sell in the markets.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family in any way possible, since she is married and has eight children.
 
When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings.

Two members, Ana and Irene, are not in the photograph, since they had medical appointments.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy used her first loan to buy fertilizers, seedlings and also labor for her farm. She planted and had a good harvest and was very profitable.

This is Mercy's second loan and she plans to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, seedlings and labor.

In the future, Mercy hopes to expand her business and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings, and provide food for the hired laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Rouguiata Samba

texts.fr: Madame Rouguiata est âgée de 50 ans. Elle vit dans l’une des localités du territoire  sénégalais et s’active en même temps dans le commerce de tissus et la couture. Elle a une expérience de 3 ans dans ses activités qu’elle a choisies par opportunité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus qu’elle va confectionner et vendre à l’ occasion de la fête de Tabaski qui approche. Son objectif est de répondre à la demande   de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle. Son objectif final est d’accroitre au maximum les bénéfices tirés de son activité.
texts.en: Madame Rouguiata is 50 years old. She lives in a town in Senegal and is in the business of selling fabric and tailoring.   She has three years of experience in this type of work that she chose as the opportunity presented itself.  She has been a member of l'U-IMCEC since March of 2011.  She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs in order to buy fabric that she will use to make clothing to sell at the upcoming festival of Tabaski.  Her goal is to meet the growing demand of her customers. Her ultimate goal is to make maximum profits from her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric to be made into clothing to be sold.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings to expand his farming business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has operated his M-PESA shop (a mobile-phone based money transfer service) and milk purchasing business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years.  He is 53 years old, married to Margaret and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of his friends and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more milk for resale in his dairy shop.

In future, James hopes to expand his milk business and get more income.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 45 years old, married to Mary and they have five school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this is his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for the next planting season.

In future, James hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is 26 years old and married to a businessman who sells cattle. Aisha has no children yet.  She sells different items such as potatoes, rice, cooking oil, sugar and salt. She plans to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Las Marquirivis Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS MARQUIRIVIS” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Martha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: dentista, venta de comida, tienda de carnicería, venta de verdura, tienda de barrio, costura y tejido. 

La señora Martha  indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida que viene trabajando desde hace trece años, el mismo lo aprendió de su suegra.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para compra de cocina, que servirá para la preparación de los alimentos, el mismo lo adquirirá de Villa Dolores y lo comercializa en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.
texts.en:
The communal bank “LAS MARQUIRIVIS” is starting their second lending cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Town Center Enhancement program.  The group is made up of eight members, and is led by a board of directors headed by Señora Martha.  The members of the communal bank work in varied businesses, including dentistry, food sales, butchers shop, vegetable sales, a neighborhood store, sewing and weaving.

Señora Martha tells that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago at the invitation of the promoter.  She currently has a business selling food, where she has been working for the last 13 years.  She learned this business from her mother-in-law.

The loan that she is looking for now is for the purchase of a cooker, which will help her in preparing her dishes.  She will purchase it in Villa Dolores and will use it for business at the markets.  This form of work will allow her to generate income for supporting her family as much as possible, as she is married with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she enjoys the meetings.

loans.use: to buy a cooker.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has operated her retail shop in Njabini town for the last three years.  She is 22 years old, married to Pius and they have two school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this is her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods for resale in her retail shop. Some of the goods she hopes to buy include maize meal flour, cooking fat, detergents and much more.

In future, Esther hopes to grow her retail shop to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to increase the stock of goods in her retail shop

loans.name: Women Of Amazing Grace Group

texts.en:
Pauline is a single woman, age 23, and she does not have any dependants. She lives in Gweru in Senga 2. She buys and sells motor spare parts like shock absorbers, mountings and oil. She has been doing business for the past two years now. The main hindrance to her business is that she cannot meet the demand due to insufficient funds injected into the business. 

Pauline was granted a loan of $400 by Microking Finance and she will spend the money to buy shock absorbers, nuts and bolts, and brake pads. From the proceeds, Ms. Pauline will be in a position to pay fees for her studies and also buy a laptop for her studies. She intends to open an auto spare parts hardware if the business goes well.

loans.use: to buy shock absorbers, nuts and bolts, and brake pads

loans.name: Pape Maita

texts.fr: Monsieur Maïta  est un jeune aviculteur de 25 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Il a une expérience de 4 ans dans son activité. Elle a choisi son activité par amour  pour l’élevage. Il éprouve beaucoup de plaisir en voyant les poussins grandir. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de nouveaux sujets , ce qui lui permettra d’élargir son activité.
texts.en: Mr. Maïta is a 25 year old poultry farmer who lives in Senegal.  He has four years of experience in this work.  He chose this type of work because of his love for raising poultry.  He gets a lot of pleasure from watching his chicks grow.  He has been a member of I'U-IMCEC since July of 2010.  He is requesting a loan of 200,000 frs. in order to by new chicks, which will allow him to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy chick to raise.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 47 years old and has six children with ages ranging between 6 and 25. All of Jacqueline’s children attend school except the youngest. Her husband does not work. Jacqueline sells different items such as potatoes, bananas and many others. She has been doing this business for six years. She plans to use the profits that will be obtained from the business for school fees for her children. Jacqueline dreams to have a big shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa D. 46 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Rosa desD. hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa D. su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción D. leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores D. la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado D. TambogranD., con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado y realizar arreglos en su corral, para que se incremente la producción D. la leche D. vaca y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.  Rosa es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio salga adelante para que su hijo tengan otras oportunidades D. estudio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 30 years old and lives with her children in her own home where they only have electricity (no running water).  Their home is located in the TambogranD. district, which is part of Piura department.  This area is characterized by its farming, livestock, and handicrafts activities.

For the last three years, Rosa has been working raising and selling sheep (she has 10 head of sheep), pigs (8 pigs) and farmyard poultry.  Her corrals are outsiD. her home, and are appropriate for her needs.  She feeds her animals with a balanced animal feed, grass, and natural grains so that her animals will reach an optimum size for her to offer for sale in the different markets in the area, and she can generate good earnings to cover her daily household expenses.

She has requested a loan of 1,500 New Soles form Edpyme Alternativa for purchasing more balanced animal feed for her animals and also to make improvements to her corrals.  With the income that she will earn, she will be able to cover her loan repayments and improve her family's quality of life.  

Rosa is a hard-working woman who is very responsible.  The only thing she wants is for her children to succeed in life and to have a better financial situation.

loans.use: to buy more balanced animal feed and to make several repairs to her animals' corrals.

loans.name: Tres Marias Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Florencia; ella es casada y tiene 38 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos y galletas, la socia atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor para implementar la tienda de abarrotes.
 
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de papa, negocio de venta de leña, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de venta de pasto, negocio de internet y negocio de llamadas telefónicas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These people are members of the Tres Marias Communal Bank which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name.

Florencia is one of the members. She is 38 years old and has three children. She runs a grocery store selling basics such as rice, sugar, milk, pasta, and cookies. She works from 6am to 10pm. Because of this job she is able to help her children get ahead. She wishes to expand and improve the store so she is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and pasta at wholesale prices to put in her store.

The other members have such businesses as selling potatoes, firewood, fruit, hay, or providing Internet and telephone services.

Florencia is grateful to those who help her achieve her dream and promises to make the repayments on the loan according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and pasta at wholesale prices

loans.name: Sunrise Group

texts.en:
Shamba, who lives in Shurugwi, a small town near Gweru, is a 32-year-old divorced woman with two children aged 11 and 3. She also has one 16-year-old dependent who is still going to school. 

Shamba has been operating a tuck shop (a small, food-selling retailer) since 2006 in which she sells products like cooking oil, washing soap, bread, soft drinks, and sweets. 

With her $400 portion of the loan, she intends to buy more stock and pay school fees for her children. Her business is mainly affected by the lack of funds.  In time, she hopes to buy a large stall from which to sell her products.

loans.use: To buy soap, cooking oil, bread, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Zama Zama Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a 50-year-old widow whose husband passed away ten years ago. She lives in Gweru with her five children, aged 25, 23, 21, 20 and 16. Three children are still at school. She doesn't have any other dependents.

She is a cross-border trader who has been operating for ten years now. Joyce trades in South Africa and specializes mainly in seat covers and chair backs. The business is mainly affected by changing government regulations, high import duty and transport costs. 

She sees herself opening a shop in Zimbabwe in the next five years and starting other projects.

loans.use: To buy materials to make seat covers and chair backs.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 36 years old and married to a soldier. They have three children between the ages of 14 and 16. All the children go to school. She has a beverage business, selling different drinks such as juice, milk, etc. She has been doing this business for five years. She plans to pay school fees and provide food for the family from the profits she will make. She dreams of having her own business shop and to sell the items to others in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beverages and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Teofila; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ganados,ella sigue vnediendo carne poero tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de ganados que lo realiza en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,ella sigue sacando adelante a sus hijos por medio de estos negocios,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar los negocios de venta de ganados y negocio de venta de carne . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne al por mayor y ganado.
                                                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is Señor Teofila; she is 39 years old and in a live-in relationship.  She has three children.  The member divides her time between her daily activities and her cattle business.  She is still selling meat, but also works selling cattle at the various markets in Anta district.  She is still moving her children ahead in life by means of these businesses.

The member would like to expand and improve her business selling cattle and her business selling meat. The member is requesting this loan to purchase meat at wholesale and cattle.

The member is happy about this loan and commits to complying with her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase meat at wholesale and to buy cattle.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie is 46 years old. She has seven children who are between the ages of 8 and 23. All her children attend school. Her husband works in a public institution which serves the vulnerable. Her loan will be used to increase her stock of items such as salt, sugar, rice and cooking oil. She would like to buy a plot of land with the profits she will make from the business. She would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as salt, sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy motor oil, brake fluids, filters, clutch fluids and other motoring supplies.

loans.name: Rosas Lindas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS LINDAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maribel. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de DVD’s, venta de chompas, venta de rellenos, venta de salchipapas, venta de dulces, venta de calzados, carniceria. 

La señora Maribel  indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción y de sus vecinas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que trabaja hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de dulces, masitas, refrescos, etc.), que adquirirá de las ferias y posteriormente lo comercializa en el puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es divorciada y tiene y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con el grupo la capacitación de salud y de crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “ROSAS LINDAS”  ("Beautiful Roses") is starting their first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo Center.  The group is made up of eight members, and is led by a board of directors headed by Señora Maribel.  The members of the communal bank are progressing various businesses, including DVD sales, sweater sales, stuffed chilli pepper sales, hot dog and fries sales, confectionery sales, shoe sales, and a butcher shop.

Señora Maribel tells that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago at the invitation of the promoter and her neighbors.  She currently has a business which is a neighborhood store; she has been working here for years.

The loan that she is now looking for is to expand her merchandise (purchase confectionery, pastries, sodas, etc.) which she will purchase at the markets and later sell at her sales location.  This form of work will allow her to generate income to support her family as much as possible, as she is divorced and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she enjoys sharing the trainings on health and loans with her group.

loans.use: to buy confectionery, pastries, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Ernestina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ernestina tiene 32 años, y es madre soltera de tres niños. Ernestina se dedica al cultivo de maíz, y tambien trabaja en una escuela preparando las meriendas para los estudiantes. Por su trabajo en la escuela Ernestina gana $100 al mes. El cultivo de maíz lo trabaja ella personalmente, y lo utiliza primordialmente para la alimentación de sus hijos. Ella aprendió el oficio de agricultura de su madre, quien tambien fue madre soltera.

Ernestina ha solicitado un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de insumos agricolas, como abono y pesticidas, para su cultivo. Con la ayuda del préstamo Ernestina podra proporcionar el alimento necesario a su familia.

Ernestina desea seguir trabajando fuertemente para darle a sus hijos las oportunidades que ella no tuvo, brindarles una educación para que ellos se puedan defender cuando sean grandes.
texts.en:
Ernestina is 32 and a single mother of three children.  She grows corn for a living and also works in a school preparing student lunches.  She earns $100 a month at the school.  She grows the corn all by herself and uses it mainly to feed her children.  She learned agriculture from her mother who was also a single mother.

Ernestina has requested a loan through the Fundación Campo to buy agriculture supplies such as fertilizer and pesticides for her crop.  With the help of the loan Ernestina will be able to feed her family.

She wants to continue her hard work so she can give her children the opportunities she never had, and give them the education they need to earn a living when they are older.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her corn crop.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca is 35 years old and married to a businessman who owns a hardware store. They have three children who are between six and thirteen years old. Prisca sells garments for both women and men, and she has been doing this business for 5 years.  With the profits, she will pay school fees and provide food for the family. She dreams to become the sole manufacturer of garments in the future.

loans.use: To buy more garments for resale.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Maricela; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia sigue en us negocio de venta de carne,ella lleva diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,la socia tambien se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de ganados,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar los negocios de venta de ganados y negocio de venta de carne. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne al por mayor y tambien para comprar ganados.
                                                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
45-year old Sra. Maricela is married and has four children. She has continued with her meat-selling business in the various markets around Ana district. Maricela also sells livestock. Because of the businesses, she is able to help her children get ahead. 

She now wishes to expand and improve both businesses so she is seeking a loan to buy meat at wholesale prices and also to buy more livestock.

Maricela is pleased to get this loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy meat and livestock

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth trabaja como empleada domestica y su esposo es carpintero en aluminio. El crédito lo requiere para el costo de traslado de tierra para comenzar la construcción de una habitación en su casa y para la compra de arena, ladrillo y cemento. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Las Lomas  de la ciudad de La Paz; Janeth es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que desea que su crédito sea canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Janeth works as a domestic employee, and her husband is a carpenter who works with aluminum.

She needs the loan for the cost of moving dirt and starting to build a room in her house.  It is also to buy sand, bricks, and cement.

She lives in her own house in the Las Lomas zone in the city of La Paz.  Janeth is married and has four children.

This is the second time that she wishes to have a loan that is channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay to move dirt and to buy bricks, sand and cement in order to start building a room in her house.

loans.name: Elena Emperatriz

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Elena Emperatriz; ella tiene 70 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia sigue en su negocio de venta de animales como ganados, ovejas y chanchos, la socia vende animales en las diferentes ferias que existe en la provincia de Anta, la socia quiere seguir ampliando y mejorando el negocio de venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como chanchos,cuyes y gallinas al por mayor y tambien para comprar comida para los animales.
                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Her name is Elena Emperatriz. She is 70 years old, single, and she has 2 children. She has a business selling livestock such as cattle, sheep, and pigs. She sells the livestock at the different fairs that exist in the province of Anta. She wants to keep growing and improving her livestock sales business. She requests a loan to purchase livestock such as pigs, guinea pigs, and poultry in wholesale, and to purchase feed for them.

She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making the loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase livestock such as guinea pigs and poultry in wholesale, and to purchase their feed.

loans.name: Taringana Group

texts.en:
Theresa is a 44-year-old widow who lives in Mvuma, a small town near Gweru. She has 4 children aged 22, 20,15 and 14, two of whom are still in school. She also has 2 more dependants that she looks after.

Theresa raises chickens and has been in operation for the past 3 years. 

She has taken a loan of $400 which she used to buy poultry feeds and chemicals. Apart from poultry keeping, she is also in the business of buying and selling goods in the local market.

Theresa will be in a position to send her children and other dependants to school if the business does well.  She is also looking forward to owning a butchery in the years to come.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds

loans.name: Cape Of Hope Group

texts.en:
Getrude, 49, is a hardworking woman, who is married with four children aged 28, 26, 22 and 15. She lives in Shurugwi, a small town near Gweru, the capital of the Midlands Province. Her spouse works for Zimasco Company in Shurugwi as an accountant.

She is in the business of raising chicken and also buys bundles of second-hand clothes for resale. She also sells cakes and samosas. She is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase day-old chicks and chicken feed.  The additional income derived from her business will enhance the quality of life of her family.

In the future, she plans to open a general store.

loans.use: To buy at least 1,000 chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: La señora Amalia trabaja en una tienda donde vende ropa para niños; su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada. El crédito lo requiere para iniciar un negocio propio de venta de artículos eléctricos para el hogar, como licuadoras, batidoras, planchas, horno s de micro ondas, zumidoras, etc. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de nueva Potosi en la ciudad de La Paz; Amalia es casada y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y también a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Amalia works at a shop that sells children’s clothing. Her husband has a job with a private company. The loan she is requesting will be used to start her own business of selling electrical appliances for the home such as blenders, mixers, irons, microwave ovens, calculators, and other items. Amalia lives at the home of her parents in the District of Nueva Potosi in the city of La Paz. She is married and has one child.

This is the first time she has obtained a loan from IMPRO and through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy household appliances such as blenders, mixers, irons, microwave ovens, calculators, and other items.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Clorinda; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia sigue en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, harina y fideos, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m,la socia quiere seguir ampliando y mejorando el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz,azucar,leche y fideos al por mayor para la tienda de abarrotes.
                                                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Her name is Clorinda. She is 43 years old, married common-law, and she has 2 children. Her business is a grocery store from where she sells basic consumer goods such as rice, sugar, milk, flour, and pasta. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 11:00 p.m. She wants to keep expanding and improving her grocery store business. She requests a loan to purchase products such as rice, sugar, milk, and pasta in wholesale for her grocery store. 

She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase products such as rice, sugar, milk, and pastas in wholesale for her grocery store.

loans.name: Bernarda Beatriz

texts.es:
Bernarda D. 55 años D. edad, vive en su casa propia con su familia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por su actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Bernarda tiene como actividad laboral la confección y venta D. prendas D. vestir, desD. hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene en su casa, cuenta con su propia clientela, se a hecho conocida por el buen trabajo que realiza y también realiza trabajos a pedidos, la competencia en el rubro no es mucha, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias D. su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla D. 1000 para comprar material como telas, hilos y accesorios para realizar sus prendas D. vestir, así pueD. seguir brindando un buen servicio y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes, lo que le permitirá tener más ganancias para mejorar el nivel D. vida D. su familia.  Bernarda con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar su negocio y a su familia adelante, con la intensión D. superarse en la vida.
texts.en:
Bernarda is 55 years old and she lives in a house of her own together with her family. The house is equipped with all the basic services and it is located in an urban region in the district of TambogranD., belonging to the department of Piura. This region is known for its agricultural, farming and artisan activities.

Bernarda's business activity is the production and sale of articles of clothing. She has had her business for several years in her house. She has her own clientele and she has gotten herself known for the good work that she produces. She also works by taking orders. The competition in the field is not very much. With the income that she obtains she will be able to cover the daily necessities of the household.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) through Capital Semilla D. 1000 to purchase materials such as fabrics, threads, and accessories to make articles of clothing. This way she will be able to continue providing a good service and filling the orders that her clients have placed. In turn, this will permit her to earn greater profits to improve the quality of her family's life. Bernarda has known how to move her business forward through a great deal of effort and a lot of work. Her intention is to improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as fabrics, threads, and accessories to produce articles of clothing.

loans.name: Yola

texts.es: La señora Yola es empleada del sector público y trabaja como abogada. El crédito lo requiere para cancelar un curso a nivel superior en derecho civil. Vive en casa de sus padres políticos misma queda ubicada en la zona de 14 de septiembre en la ciudad de La Paz; es casada  y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que Yola obtiene un crédito en IMPRO, y como es un crédito para educación superior se lo canaliza por Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Yola is employed in the public sector as an attorney. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for an upper-level course in civil law. Yola lives at the house of her parents in the September 14th District of the city of La Paz. She is married and has two children.

This is the first time Yola has obtained a loan from IMPRO. Since this a higher education loan, it is being referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to pay for a course in civil law.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Maruja; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia sigue trabjando en su negocio de restaurant, ella sigue preparando desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia también se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de fruta, la socia por medio de estos negocios saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de restaurant y mejorar el negocio de venta de frutas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar naranjas, platanos, uvas y mandarinas y también para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, azúcar y verduras. 
                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Her name is Maruja. She is 40 years old, married common-law, and she has 4 children. She continues to work on her restaurant. She has been preparing breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and she has also continued to dedicate herself to fruits sales. It is through these businesses that she is able to provide for her children. She wants to expand and improve her restaurant business and she wants to improve her fruits sales business. She requests a loan to purchase oranges, bananas, grapes, and mandarins, and to purchase cooking ingredients such as rice, sugar, and vegetables.

He is happy for the loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, bananas, grapes, and mandarin oranges as well as ingredients for cooking such as rice, sugar and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock for the shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy hair-straightening kits for her salon and clothes for sale at the flee market

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Victor tiene un snack de comida rápida y su esposa lo ayuda en su negocio. El crédito lo requiere para aumentar el capital de trabajo ya que comprando por mayor los insumos como ser: arroz, papa, aceite, les resulta más barato y por consiguiente influye en un mejor volumen de ganancias. Vive en casa de alquiler misma queda ubicada en la zona de Tacagua en la ciudad de La Paz; Victor es casado  y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Sr. Victor has a snack bar and his wife helps with his business. The loan he is requesting will be used to increase his operating capital so that he can buy supplies in bulk such as rice, potatoes, and oil. By purchasing in volume, he will be able to get these products much cheaper and improve his earnings. Victor lives in a rented house in the District of Tacagua in the city of La Paz. He is married and has two children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk such as rice, potatoes, and oil.

loans.name: Cassien

texts.en: Cassien was born in 1976. He is married and has three children who are between 6 and 8 years old. All of his children attend school. Cassien sells different products such as ones from poultry, food items such as bananas, beans, and vegetables. He will use the loan to increase his inventory. With the profits, he will expand his poultry business. Cassien dreams to get more than four million in income in the future.

loans.use: To expand his poultry business by purchasing more inventory

loans.name: Ramil

texts.es: El señor Ramil es jubilado rentista y trabaja como administrador en una empresa  de distribución de medicamentos usando su propia camioneta; su esposa tiene una farmacia. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor para la camioneta; así podrá llevar los productos a sus clientes. El  señor vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona El Rosario  en la ciudad de La Paz; Ramil es casado y tiene un hijo pero ya está casado y no depende de de nadie. Es la primera vez que obtiene el crédito en IMPRO deseando hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Ramil receives a retirement pension, but he also works as a manager for a company that distributes medicines. He uses his own truck. His wife has a pharmacy. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a motor for his truck so that he can deliver products to his customers. Sr. Ramil lives in his own home in the District of El Rosario in the city of La Paz. He is married and has one child. His son is married, so he no longer has any dependents.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO because he wants to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy a motor for the truck that he uses to distribute medicines.

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Marwa, who is in his late 30s, is married with four children two of whom are independent and two are still at school. He has been running a stationary business for two years now.  He works from 8 a.m to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to sell telephone housing equipment and then started the stationary business.  He also took care of his family.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy items to replenish his stationary stock.  His dream is to one day be able to buy his own land.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mshikamano" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy items to replenish his stock.

loans.name: Sky Group

texts.en: Daniel is a hardworking married man with three children, ages 12, 8 and 4. Two of his children are still of school-going age. He operates a grocery shop and a flea market. The business has been in existence for the past five years now. The business is inadequately funded; thereby, affecting sales return. He is requesting a $400 US loan to increase his stock for the shop and flea market. The additional income from his business will sustain his family and dependents. Daniel looks forward to being a stocker and a grocery wholesaler in the near future.

loans.use: to buy groceries for the shop and clothes for the flea market

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: El señor Ronald se dedica a la producción de embutidos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra insumos para elaborar chorizos barrilleros. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en anticrético (es un contrato legal entre el dueño de casa y el inquilino, por el cual el inquilino entrega por adelantado una suma de dinero por vivir en la casa del dueño por un tiempo determinado, bajo una cláusula que indica que al final del periodo, el dueño de casa se compromete a devolver el dinero al inquilino) en una casa, la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de Villa Armonia de la ciudad de La Paz; Ronald es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es la segunda vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Ronald makes sausages. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy supplies for making barbecued chorizo. This business is the source of income by which he is able to cover his expenses. Ronald lives in a house through an “anticrético” (a legal contract between a homeowner and a tenant in which the tenant pays a determined lump sum to live in a house for a specified period and the homeowner promises to return the money at the end of the lease). He resides in the District of Villa Armonia in the city of La Paz. Ronald is single and has no children.

This is the second time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO and through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making barbecued chorizo sausages.

loans.name: Khantaty Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KHANTATY” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro de Copacabana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Remedios. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de leche, abarrotes, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de cerveza

La señora Remedios,  indica es la primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida que viene trabajando desde años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra fideo, arroz, aceite, etc.), que comprara de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente la elaboración lo venderá en su puesto de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Khantaty" will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) as part of Copacabana Centre. It is formed by six members and it is led by a board of directors which is headed by Remedios. The businesses held by the members of this communal bank are various, and among them are: dairy production, grocery store, vegetable sales, community store, food sales, beer sales.

Remedios indicates that it is the first time she works with Pro Mujer and she joined following an invitation from a promoter. She currently has a food sales business that she has been managing for several years.

The loan that she requests will be used to increase her capital (to purchase pasta, rice, cooking oil etc.). She will make her purchases in the city of La Paz and she will later sell her products from her food stall. This form of work lets her generate a source of income to support her family as much as possible. She lives with her common-law partner and their three children.

loans.use: to purchase pasta, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Nolvia Cecilia

texts.es:
Doña Nolvia siempre en su trabajo como empacadora en zona franca, pues solo asi, pueden tener una mejor administracion con los gastos del hogar. Su esposo desempeñandose como ingeniero agronomo, y sus dos hijos creciendo y cursando el años escolar.
Hoy en dia, Nolvia, se afilio a la Avon, para lograr tener otros ingresos que le ayude a mejorar la condicion de su hogar, vende cosmeticos, ropa, zapatos, a sus compañeros de trabajo como en su casa, por encargo y mantiene productos, ya que su meta es crecer en ventas.
Tanbien ah  hecho mejoras a su casa, mejoro las divisiones del cuarto, logro terminar el muro frontal, con finnaciamiento que Afodenic, ha dado en cuatro ciclos, lo que es de gran beneficios para el bienestar de la familia.
Lo que invertira con este prestamo es en ropa nueva de dama, varones, niños, zapatos y cosmeticos, en mayor cantidad, asi como cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes. Y seguir con su pequeño negocio, que espera poder fortalecer en corto plazo.
texts.en:
Nolvia has always worked as a packager in duty free region. This is the only way that they are able to improve the administration of the household expenses. Her husband works as an agricultural engineer. Their two children are growing and they attend school.

Currently Nolvia has become an Avon representative in order to generate another source of income to improve the condition of their home. She sells cosmetics, clothing, and shoes to her work colleagues, as well as from her house. She takes orders and she has merchandise in stock as well. Her goal is to increase her sales.

They have also made some home improvements, adding new bedroom divisions, and she also managed to finish building the front wall with the help of four past loans from Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner). This has proven to be a great benefit for the well-being of the family. She will invest this loan in the purchase of new clothing for ladies, men, and children, and to purchase shoes and cosmetics in larger quantities. She will also fill the orders placed by her clients. She will continue one with her small business and she hopes to strengthen it in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Awovi

texts.fr:
Awovi est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est célibataire.  
Awovi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2003. Elle achète et revend des pagnes, des tissus et des mèches à toutes les personnes à la devanture de leur maison au quartier Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille seule sur son activité. 
Awovi a requis son premier crédit WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes de qualité, des tissus de qualité et les nouvelles arrivages de mèches.
Dans les prochaines années, Awovi voudrait acquérir sa propre boutique de vente. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit avoir une vie heureuse.
texts.en:
Awovi is 29 years old and single. She has been working since 2003 buying and reselling lengths of African print cloth, other fabrics, and hair extensions to all comers in front of their house in the Adidogomé district of Lomé. She buys her wares in the Grand Marché in Lomé. She works by herself in the business. 
 
Awovi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy high-quality "pagnes" and other high-quality fabrics and recently imported hair extensions. In the coming years, Awavi would like to acquire her own little shop. She says that with the profit, she intends to live a happy life.

loans.use: to buy lengths of African print cloth, other fabrics, and hair extensions.

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.fr:
Nathalie est une femme âgée de 44 ans. Elle est célibataire et mère de 2 enfants. 
Nathalie travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle prépare et vend des jus de fruit à toutes  les personnes désireuses dans le marché de  Gbossimé. Elle achète les produits de préparation de ses jus à Lomé. Elle travaille avec deux personnes.  
Nathalie a requis son premier  crédit  de WAGES afin d’acheter des aromes, du Bakin Powder, des saches et du bissap pour la préparation des jus. Elle veut utiliser ses profits supplémentaires pour agrandir son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Nathalie voudrait voir son activité prospérer. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit bien  s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nathalie, 44, is single and the mother of two children. She has been working as a small-scale retailer since 2006 preparing fruit juice and selling it to all comers in the market in Gbossimé. She buys the products used to prepare her juice in Lomé. She works with two persons. 

Nathalie has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy flavoring agents, baking powder, small bags, and "bissap" (dried hibiscus flowers) to prepare juices. She wants to use her extra profit to expand her little activity. 

In the coming years, Nathalie would like to see her business prosper. She says that with the profit she expects to take good care of her children.

loans.use: to buy products for juice-making.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 200 chickens and 100 guinea pigs

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée à un militaire, et est mère de deux enfants.  
Afi travaille comme revendeuse depuis l’an 2000. Elle achète et revend les bijoux genres colliers, boucles d’oreille, gommettes, bagues à tous ces clients à la devanture de leur maison, ou comme ambulante à Lomé. Elle achète ces produits au grand marché de Cotonou au BENIN voisin. Elle est aidée par une personne dans l’exercice de son activité. 
Afi a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bijoux de qualité pour sa clientèle.  Elle veut utiliser les profits supplémentaires de son activité à développer son commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait avoir son propre  boutique de vente de bijoux. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit  contribuer au bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afi is a 43-year old woman. Her husband is in the military, and she has two children. Afi has been working as vendor since 2000. She buys and resells jewelry, such as necklaces, earrings, hair elastics, and rings. She sells to all kinds of clients  in front of her house, or as a street vendor in Lomé. She buys these goods at the big market of Cotonou in the neighboring Benin. She is aided by one additional person in her business.

Afi has requested her fourth loan from WAGES in order to purchase quality jewelry for her clients. She would lie to use additional profits   to grow her business. In the years to come, Afi would like to open her own jewelry store. She says that she plans to use her profits  to contribute to the family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: El Señor José Francisco tiene 31 años es padre soltero, además se dedica una desgranadora de maíz, hace ocho años. Anteriormente el negocio lo tenía su Papa que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantenerlo y decidió establecer a José como responsable del negocio. El motivo del crédito es para mantenimiento de la maquina, su meta es ver crecer su negocio y lograr el sueño de seguir manteniendo a su familia que son su mayor prioridad. José está muy agradecido con el crédito otorgado ya que con esa oportunidad cumplirá sus desafíos propuestos.
texts.en: Jose Francisco is 31 years old and he is a single father. He has also been working at a corn production plant for the past eight years. The business which he had previously belonged to his father; he maintained it with a great deal of effort. He later decided to establish Jose as the responsible person of the business. The reason for the loan is to carry out maintenance repairs to the machine. His goal is to see his business grow and to achieve his dream of continually supporting his family. They are his greatest priority. Jose is very thankful for the loan granted to him. With this opportunity he will attain the goals he has set for himself.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance repairs to a machine.

loans.name: Luis Anibal

texts.es:
Luis tiene 19 años, es soltero y tiene un hijo de tres años de edad, vive con sus padres e hijo en Salcedo, que se encuentra cerca de Latacunga en la Sierra Centro de Ecuador. Luis se describe como una persona tranquila de buen caracter y sobre todo muy cariñoso con su familia y sus animales.

Luis trabaja con sus padres en la crianza de cerdos para posteriormente venderlos. Es el primer crédito que realiza a Fodemi el cual va a ser invertido en la compra de balanceado para la alimentación de sus animales, debido a que con el balanceado los cerdos crecen saludables y al momento de su venta son de buena calidad y estos aspectos ayudarán que Luis tenga muy buenos ingresos manteniendo a su familia y el terminando sus estudios.

Su sueño es ser profesional y dar el estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Luis is 19, single, and has a three year-old son. He lives with his parents and son in Salcedo, which is near Latacunga in the Sierra Central region of Ecuador.  

Luis desribes himself as an easy-going person of good character, and above all, very loving with his family and his animals.  Luis and his parents raise animals for later sale. 

This is the first loan he has taken out with Fodemi. He will use it to buy balanced feed for his animals, because with balanced feed pigs grow up healthy, and are good quality at the time they are sold. These factors will help Luis to have very good income for supporting his family and completing his education.

His dream is to be a professional, and provide his son with an education.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Agossa

texts.fr:
Agossa est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est célibataire.  
Agossa travaille comme revendeur depuis 2008. Il achète et revend des huiles à moteur à tous les usagers d’engins à moteur, dans sa boutique à Lomé. Il travaille avec une personne. 
Agossa a requis son premier crédit de 300.000FCFA de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartons d’huile à moteur destinées à la vente. Il veut avec les profits supplémentaires de son activité, agrandir sa boutique. 
Dans les prochaines années, Agossa voudrait ouvrir d’autres points de ventes. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit  avoir une meilleure situation financière.
texts.en:
Agossa is a 32-year-old single man who has been working as a retailer since 2008.  He buys engine oil which he re-sells to anybody who uses engine oil, in his store in Lomé.  He works with the help of one other person.

Agossa has requested his first loan from WAGES, for 300,000 frances, to buy boxes of engine oil to sell.  He would like to use the extra income from his business to increase the size of his store.

In the coming years, Agossa would like to open other sales locations.  He says that he plans to use his profits to improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to buy engine oil

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou est âgé de 41 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2000.  Elle a déjà remboursé 9 crédits antérieurs. Elle s’active dans le commerce et la vente de petit déjeuner et diner, savon, Omo, boissons. Elle a une expérience de 2 ans dans cette  activité. Elle gère  une cantine dans laquelle elle exerce son activité, cantine  qu’elle a héritée de sa mère. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits divers destinés  au renforcement de son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Mrs. Seynabou is 41 years old.  She lives in Senegal.  She is married and has been a member of l'U-IMCEC since July of 2000.  She has already paid back nine previous loans.  She is in the business of selling breakfast and dinner, soap, Omo detergent and drinks.  She has two years of experience with this type of work.  She manages a cantine, which she inherited from her mother, where she works.  She is requesting a loan of 200,000 frs. to buy various products to build up her business.

loans.use: to buy various products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy one sack of cabbages, one sack of onions, one sack of eggplants and one sack of carrots

loans.name: Celeste Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CELESTE” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Florinda. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de chompas, venta de salchipapas, venta de chamarras, costura de pantalones, venta de quesos, tienda de barrio.

La señora Florinda,  indica que hace cinco meses que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora y de compañeras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes que viene trabajando hace diez y seis años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de fideo, arroz, azúcar, etc.) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente lo venderá en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “Celeste” community bank are about to start their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which is headed by Florinda.  The businesses that the members of the community bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling food, selling sweaters, selling 'salchipapas' (traditional Peruvian fast food), selling jackets, sewing pants, selling cheese and running a neighborhood store.

Florinda says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for five months.  She joined the institution through an invitation from a loan officer and some friends.  She has a grocery store business where she has been working for sixteen years.

Florinda will use the loan that she is taking out to increase her capital (buying noodles, rice, sugar, etc.).  She will buy these products in La Ceja and then sell them in her store.  This work allows her to make income to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Florinda replied that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Damaris Margarita

texts.es:
Doña Damarys, siempre administrando su pulperia, el cual con mucho empeño, trabajo ha crecido en su negocio, madre soltera que salio adelante con sus tres hijos, solo el menor esta con ella, y ahora su nuevo compañero que despues de varios años formalizo un nuevo hogar, es de oficio artista pintor. Siendo de apoyo moral, economico.
Sus credito han sido para introducir en mas productos, lo mas demandado por sus clientes, lo que ha venido comprando cosmeticos, productos de medicamentos con venta libre en panadol, higado sanil, zepol, entre otros.
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento sera para la compra en quintales de arroz, azucar, cajas de aceite, productos coca cola, productos en medicamentos, y cosmetico, manteniendo surtida su negocio, manteniendo su margen de venta. Ya que tiene muchos pagos y compromisos que cumplir.
texts.en:
Damaris continues running her store.  With a lot of effort and work, she has managed to grow her business.  Damaris is a single mother who has managed to provide for her three children.  Only her youngest still lives with her.  Damaris also lives with her new partner.  After several years she has set up a new home.  Her partner is a painter (artist) by profession.  He provides her with moral and financial support.

Damaris has used her loans to introduce more products, which her customers are requesting, into her store.  She has bought cosmetics and over-the-counter medicines such as Panadol, Higado Sanil, Zepol, etc.

Damaris will use this new loan to buy 100lb bags of rice and sugar, crates of oil, Coca Cola products, medicines and cosmetics.  This will keep her store stocked and allow her to maintain her sales margin as she has many payments and commitments to fulfill.

loans.use: to invest in products for her store (basic grains, medicines, cosmetics and Coca Cola products)

loans.name: Gloria Vilma

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 15 años. 
Gloria tiene 5 hectáreas de tierra en Lagunilla, donde siembra verduras, en todo este tiempo pudo aprender muchas cosas que le ayudaron a mejorar su calidad de vida, tanto personal como en su negocio y en su familia, agradece por la confianza que le brindaron, la facilidad de los préstamos, el ahorro le ayuda a poder concluir la meta que se pone en cada cierre. Con el préstamo que va a recibir comprará abono y semillas, su deseo es poder tener un carro.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Manantial community bank.  She is 43 years old and has two children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years.

Gloria has 5 hectares of land in Lagunilla where she grows vegetables.  Over the years she has learned a lot which has helped her to improve her quality of life both from a personal point of view as well as from a business and family point of view.  She is grateful for the trust that has been placed in her, the ease of obtaining loans and the savings which help her to achieve the goal that she sets herself with each closing.  Gloria will use the loan that she receives to buy manure and seeds.  Her wish is to be able to own a car.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Yudith tiene 32 años, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, tiene 2 hijos, es casada, recuerda que antes trabajaba en la chacra desyerbando, y con el ahorro que tenia ha empezado su negocio, agradece a Finca por todo lo que le enseñaron y le capacitaron para que su negocio pueda crecer, ahora su meta es poder tener una tienda mas grande, y ahora el préstamo que saco es para poder comprar arroz, leche, aceite y azúcar.
texts.en:
Judith is 32 years old, married, and has two children. She has a grocery store in her home. Judith previously worked on a vegetable farm, but with her savings she was able to establish her own business. Thanks to everything that FINCA Peru has taught her and the training she has received, Judith has been able to grow her business.

Now her goal is to have a larger store. The loan she is receiving will be used to buy rice, milk, oil, and sugar.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes e socia del Banco Comunal Manantial, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 15 años.
Lourdes tiene un restaurante, antes ella trabajaba haciendo cortinas, pero como no tenia mucho apoyo se fue a una cafetín y eso le ayudó a poder iniciarse en el negocio de la comida e hizo un restaurante y ahora le va muy bien, gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido en su Banco Comunal le enseñaron muchas cosas que lo supo poner en práctica en su negocio, aprendió a valorarse como mujer y saber orientar a sus hijos, ahora la meta que tiene es poder comprar su casa y abrir un local mas grande. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado comprará abarrotes de mayor necesidad para su restaurante.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the Communal Bank “Manantial”. She is 43 years old and has three children. Lourdes has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years.

She manages a restaurant. Lourdes previously had a job making curtains, but she did not receive much support, so she went to a cafeteria and started helping prepare food. This was how she got started in the food business and now she has a restaurant that is doing very well. Thanks to the training she received from her Communal Bank, Lourdes has learned many things that she puts into practice in her business. She has also learned how to value herself as a woman and to provide guidance to her children. Now her goal is to buy a house and to open a larger location. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy ingredients in bulk that she needs for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk for her restaurant.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 39 ans. Elle s’active dans le commerce et la vente de bijoux, bracelets, boucles d’oreilles et tissus. Elle a une expérience d’une année dans son activité. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi  sous l’influence de sa tante qui importe des bijoux en plaqué  or. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2007. Elle a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Actuellement elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de bijoux plaqué qui seront destinés a la vente. Elle a pour objectif  de mettre en place un stock de bijoux pour mieux rentabiliser son activité surtout a l’occasion de la fête de Tabaski.
texts.en: Mrs. Fatou lives in Senegal. She is 39 years old. She is in the business of buying and selling jewelry, bracelets, earrings and fabric. She has a year of experience in this line of work. She chose this type of work through the influence of her aunt who imports plated jewelry. She has been a member of l'U-IMCEC since November of 2007. She has already repaid a previous loan. She is now requesting a loan of 200,000 firs. in order to buy plated jewelry to be sold. Her goal is to stock up on jewelry in order to increase her profits, especially during the festival of Tabaski.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es:
Doña María Nela, siempre cuenta con su pequeño negocio, una pulpería, y el apoyo moral y económico de su compañero, sus dos pequeños hijos, estudiando.

Hoy en día, está contenta porque su proyecto de su cuarto sigue avanzando, con el crédito anterior, logro avanzar hasta la mitad de concreto, y tiene parte de materiales, pero con el cemento no ajusto. 
Lo que con este nuevo financiamiento podrá seguir levantando paredes, y techo si le alcanza, oh seguirá esforzándose junto a su esposo para concluir la mejora  a su cuarto. En donde vendrá, ah tener un techo propio  mejor comodidad, privacidad para su familia. Ya que viví donde su suegra, y que pronto cambiara, para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Doña María Nela has always had a small business, a grocery store, and the moral and financial support of her companion. They have two small children who are studying.

Today she is pleased because her project of building a room continues to move forward. With her previous loan, María Nela was able to complete half of the concrete work and pay for part of the materials. However, she was not able to acquire additional cement.

This new loan will be used to continue building the walls and the ceiling. She and her husband will continue to work together until the room is finished. When the time comes, they will have a proper roof that will provide greater comfort and privacy for their family. They currently live with her mother-in-law, so she wants to move in quickly so that they will have a better future.

loans.use: to continue the construction of a room.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa es socia del FINCA Peru desD. hace 13 años. Teresa se dedica a la venta D. cochinilla y tara, tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, siempre trabajó en la venta D. cochinilla y tara, y recuerda que con sus ahorros, pudo empezar con el negocio D. su tienda y también pudo construir su casa, da gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido en su Banco Comunal porque le enseñaron a poder tener un negocio próspero, el préstamo fácil, y las capacitaciones le ayudan a poder ser mas eficiente en su negocio, ahora con el préstamo que esta sacando comprará arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa has been a member of FINCA Peru for 13 years. She sells cochineal (a natural dye) and “tara” (a natural tannin used in making leather), but she also manages a grocery store. Teresa has always sold cochineal and “tara”, but she recalls using her savings to establish her store and to build her house. Thanks to the training she has received from her Communal Bank, Teresa has learned how to have a prosperous business. The loans have been easy to manage and the training has helped her to make her business more efficient.

Now this loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, milk, and noodles so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and noodles.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: José Francisco tiene 53 años, el se dedica a la venta de pan. Desde hace mas de 6 años que tiene este negocio, pues el arduo trabajo que realiza es muy reconfortante para él. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de plan simple, semitas, picos, empanadas entre otros. Posee mucha clientela ya que él se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy honesto, responsable y dedicado a su trabajo. Su sueño es ver florecer su negocio de tal manera que sus ingresos se vean aumentados y logre mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Es por esta razón que tomo la decisión de solicitar este crédito para la compra de una variedad de pan.
texts.en:
José Francisco is 53 years old and has been selling bread for more than six years. Working hard at his business is very comforting for him.

The reason for this loan is to buy plain bread, sweet rolls, pastries, turnovers, and other products. José Francisco has many customers since he is known for being an honest and responsible man who is dedicated to his work. His dream is to see his business flourish so that his income will increase and he can improve the quality of life for his family. For this reason, he decided to request a loan in order to buy a variety of bread.

loans.use: to buy plain bread, sweet rolls, pastries, turnovers, and other baked goods.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, tiene 51 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, es socia D. FINCA Peru desD. hace 8 años.
Teofila se dedica a la venta y compra D. cochinilla y tara, y venta D. cueros mojados en la feria, recuerda que sus hermanas le invitaron a integrarse al Banco Comunal, el negocio que tiene siempre fue familiar, sus padres le enseñaron ese negocio ahora ella tiene su propio capital, Finca tuvo mucho que ver en este crecimiento que ella tuvo por las capacitaciones, por los préstamos que le dieron y la confianza que depositaron en ella. Su meta es poder terminar D. construir su casa, ahora con préstamo comprará abarrotes para llevar a la feria.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the “Amaqella” Communal Bank. She is 51 years old, married, and has 5 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 8 years now.

Teofila buys and sells dyes, including cochineal, and she also sells uncured hides in the local fair. She recalls that her sisters invited her to join the communal bank. Her business was always a family affair; her parents taught her this business. Now, she possesses her own capital. Finca had a lot to do with the growth she has experienced through its training sessions, the loans it provided, and the confidence it placed in her.

Teofila's goal is to be able to finish constructing her house. Now, with this loan, she will buy grocery items to sell at the fair.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell at the local fair.

loans.name: Yolanda Robe

texts.es: Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, tiene 44 años, se dedica a la venta y compra de cochinilla y tara, tiene 3 hijos. Una amiga le invitó a participar en el Banco Comunal, siempre trabajó con Finca y siempre valoró las capacitaciones que le dan, las enseñanzas que le inculcan, trata todo de ponerlo en práctica, la responsabilidad es uno de los valores que mas aprendió y lo practica hasta hoy. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de cochinilla y tara, el gran sueño que tiene es poder tener una ferretería.
texts.en: Yolanda is a member of the Amaqella community bank. She is 44 years old and her business is buying and selling cochineal and tara (a tannin which comes from a native plant). She has three children. A friend invited Yolanda to join her community bank and she has always worked with FINCA. She has always valued the training sessions and the teaching that they provide and she tries to put it all into practice. Responsibility is one of the values that she has learned and she continues to practice it. Yolanda will invest the loan that she has requested in buying cochineal and tara. Her big dream is to set up a hardware store.

loans.use: to buy 'tara' and cochineal

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия – рыночный предприниматель из Белой Церкви. Она живет в этом городе с мужем и тремя детьми почти всю свою жизнь. Бизнес Наталия решила начать для того, чтобы было как прокормить семью, так как на тот момент она вместе с мужем работала на заводе, который развалился. На средства, которые удалось накопить ранее, они приобрели немного товара, и так начали торговать. Начинали с реализации мужского и женского белья, а со временем перешли на обувь. На данный момент Наталия  торгует женской обувью на центральном рынке города. Она предлагает небольшую наценку на качественную обувь, которую приобретает непосредственно на обувной фабрике без посредников. В торговле данным типом товара Наталия находится уже 15 лет. Ее ежемесячная чистая прибыль превышает 5 000 гривен. 

Наталия давно выкупила торговое место и вышла на прямого поставщика обуви. На данный момент планирует вложить полученные финансовые средства в размере 15 000 гривен в закупку зимней обуви для продажи в этом сезоне. Несмотря на то, что Наталии пришлось столкнуться с разного рода трудностями (у нее воровали обувь с оптовых складов, долгое время не было своего торгового места), она все равно не сдалась и продолжала смело идти вперед с верой в успех собственного предприятия. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Nataliya is a market entrepreneur from Belaya Tserkov. She lives in this town with her husband and three children almost all of her life. Nataliya started her business so she could somehow feed her family because at that time she and her husband were working on the factory which collapsed. The savings which they were able to have before were used to buy some merchandise and started to sell. They started from selling men's and women's underwear and with time switched to shoes. At this time Nataliya sells women's shoes on the central market of the town. She offers a small surcharge on quality shoes which she buys directly from the factory without middlemen. Nataliya has been selling this type of merchandise for fifteen years already. Her clean monthly profit is over 5,000 hryvna.

Nataliya has bought out her vendor space a long time ago and works directly with the factory. At this time she plans to invest the loan money in the amount of 15,000 hryvna to buy winter shoes for sale during this season. Although Nataliya was faced with all kinds of difficulties (her shoes were stolen from the wholesale storage, and for a long time she did not have her own vendor space) she did not give up and continued to bravely move forward with faith in the success of her own business.

loans.use: to invest the loan money in the amount of 15,000 hryvna to buy winter shoes for sale this season.

loans.name: Olga Cristina

texts.es:
Doña Olga, mantiene su negocio en venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de cosmeticos Avon, el cual ha introducido como producto nuevo, para ayudarse mas con los gastos, su esposo labora como albañil, apoyando  a sus dos hijos, con la educacion, y moral, para un bienestar comun de la familia.
Olga, comprara dos pacas surtida y productos Avon, el cual trabaja por catalogo y pedidos de sus nuevos clientes, matiene productos por que quiere crecer, para fortalecer su negocio, ya que cuando su esposo no labora en la construccion, todos se apoyan. Y que tambien se ha hecho posible esta inversion a los financiamiento con Afodenic.
texts.en: Doña Olga runs a second hand clothing shop and sells Avon cosmetics, a new area of sales that helps her cover household expenses.  Her husband works as a laborer, and they are raising two children, supporting their education and household well-being.  Olga will use this credit to buy varied items such as clothing and Avon products.  She plans to fulfill client requests, and will work to grow her sales business.  When he's not working, her husband will help her with sales.  This loan was made possible through financing by Afodenic.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and Avon products

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья с мужем и двумя детьми живет в небольшом селе Великая Знаменка. Она – предприниматель сельскохозяйственник, занимается выращиванием ранних овощей: помидоров, редиса, капусты и перца. Наталья владеет двумя большими участками земли, всего 1 гектар. У нее – 3 больших теплицы и 30 маленьких. Наталья занимается выращиванием овощей уже 14 лет. В хозяйство у нее вложено 200 000 гривен. Ежегодно затраты на пленку составляют 51 000 гривен.  

Наталья планирует вложить кредит КИВА в 15 000 гривен в установку отопительного оборудования в двух больших теплицах, а также в приобретение пленки. Это даст возможность раньше высаживать помидоры и соответственно продавать их по более выгодной цене. В тепле помидоры будут меньше болеть и дадут большой и более качественный урожай, что поможет Наталье получить хороший доход в следующей сезоне. У Натальи очень много земли, есть куда развиваться. В будущем ее семья планирует использовать полученную прибыль для того, чтобы сделать пристройку в доме и расширить жилплощадь.
